317 // internal macros for string concatenation and anonymous variable name generation
318 #define DOCTEST_CAT_IMPL(s1, s2) s1##s2
319 #define DOCTEST_CAT(s1, s2) DOCTEST_CAT_IMPL(s1, s2)
320 #ifdef __COUNTER__ // not standard and may be missing for some compilers
321 #define DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(x) DOCTEST_CAT(x, __COUNTER__)
322 #else // __COUNTER__
323 #define DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(x) DOCTEST_CAT(x, __LINE__)
324 #endif // __COUNTER__
325 
326 #define DOCTEST_TOSTR(x) #x
327 
328 #ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_ASSERTION_PARAMETERS_BY_VALUE
329 #define DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(x) x&
330 #else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_ASSERTION_PARAMETERS_BY_VALUE
331 #define DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(x) x
332 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_ASSERTION_PARAMETERS_BY_VALUE
333 
334 // not using __APPLE__ because... this is how Catch does it
335 #ifdef __MAC_OS_X_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED
336 #define DOCTEST_PLATFORM_MAC
337 #elif defined(__IPHONE_OS_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED)
338 #define DOCTEST_PLATFORM_IPHONE
339 #elif defined(_WIN32)
340 #define DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
341 #else // DOCTEST_PLATFORM
342 #define DOCTEST_PLATFORM_LINUX
343 #endif // DOCTEST_PLATFORM
344 
345 // clang-format off
346 #define DOCTEST_DELETE_COPIES(type) type(const type&) = delete; type& operator=(const type&) = delete
347 #define DOCTEST_DECLARE_COPIES(type) type(const type&); type& operator=(const type&)
348 #define DOCTEST_DEFINE_COPIES(type) type::type(const type&) = default; type& type::operator=(const type&) = default
349 #define DOCTEST_DECLARE_DEFAULTS(type) type(); ~type()
350 #define DOCTEST_DEFINE_DEFAULTS(type) type::type() = default; type::~type() = default
351 // clang-format on
352 
353 #define DOCTEST_GLOBAL_NO_WARNINGS(var) \
354  DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wglobal-constructors") \
355  static int var DOCTEST_UNUSED // NOLINT(fuchsia-statically-constructed-objects,cert-err58-cpp)
356 #define DOCTEST_GLOBAL_NO_WARNINGS_END() DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
357 
358 // should probably take a look at https://github.com/scottt/debugbreak
359 #ifdef DOCTEST_PLATFORM_MAC
360 #define DOCTEST_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER() __asm__("int $3\n" : :)
361 #elif DOCTEST_MSVC
362 #define DOCTEST_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER() __debugbreak()
363 #elif defined(__MINGW32__)
364 extern "C" __declspec(dllimport) void __stdcall DebugBreak();
365 #define DOCTEST_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER() ::DebugBreak()
366 #else // linux
367 #define DOCTEST_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER() ((void)0)
368 #endif // linux
369 
370 // this is kept here for backwards compatibility since the config option was changed
371 #ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_USE_IOSFWD
372 #define DOCTEST_CONFIG_USE_STD_HEADERS
373 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_USE_IOSFWD
374 
375 #ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_USE_STD_HEADERS
376 #include <iosfwd>
377 #include <cstddef>
378 #else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_USE_STD_HEADERS
379 
380 #if DOCTEST_CLANG
381 // to detect if libc++ is being used with clang (the _LIBCPP_VERSION identifier)
382 #include <ciso646>
383 #endif // clang
384 
385 #ifdef _LIBCPP_VERSION
386 #define DOCTEST_STD_NAMESPACE_BEGIN _LIBCPP_BEGIN_NAMESPACE_STD
387 #define DOCTEST_STD_NAMESPACE_END _LIBCPP_END_NAMESPACE_STD
388 #else // _LIBCPP_VERSION
389 #define DOCTEST_STD_NAMESPACE_BEGIN namespace std {
390 #define DOCTEST_STD_NAMESPACE_END }
391 #endif // _LIBCPP_VERSION
392 
393 // Forward declaring 'X' in namespace std is not permitted by the C++ Standard.
394 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(4643)
395 
396 DOCTEST_STD_NAMESPACE_BEGIN
397 typedef decltype(nullptr) nullptr_t;
398 template <class charT>
399 struct char_traits;
400 template <>
401 struct char_traits<char>;
402 template <class charT, class traits>
403 class basic_ostream;
404 typedef basic_ostream<char, char_traits<char>> ostream;
405 template <class... Types>
406 class tuple;
407 DOCTEST_STD_NAMESPACE_END
408 
409 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
410 
411 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_USE_STD_HEADERS
412 
413 #ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
414 #include <type_traits>
415 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
416 
417 namespace doctest {
418 
419 DOCTEST_INTERFACE extern bool is_running_in_test;
420 
421 // A 24 byte string class (can be as small as 17 for x64 and 13 for x86) that can hold strings with length
422 // of up to 23 chars on the stack before going on the heap - the last byte of the buffer is used for:
423 // - "is small" bit - the highest bit - if "0" then it is small - otherwise its "1" (128)
424 // - if small - capacity left before going on the heap - using the lowest 5 bits
425 // - if small - 2 bits are left unused - the second and third highest ones
426 // - if small - acts as a null terminator if strlen() is 23 (24 including the null terminator)
427 // and the "is small" bit remains "0" ("as well as the capacity left") so its OK
428 // Idea taken from this lecture about the string implementation of facebook/folly - fbstring
429 // https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kPR8h4-qZdk
430 // TODO:
431 // - optimizations - like not deleting memory unnecessarily in operator= and etc.
432 // - resize/reserve/clear
433 // - substr
434 // - replace
435 // - back/front
436 // - iterator stuff
437 // - find & friends
438 // - push_back/pop_back
439 // - assign/insert/erase
440 // - relational operators as free functions - taking const char* as one of the params
441 class DOCTEST_INTERFACE String
442 {
443  static const unsigned len = 24;
444  static const unsigned last = len - 1;
445 
446  struct view // len should be more than sizeof(view) - because of the final byte for flags
447  {
448  char* ptr;
449  unsigned size;
450  unsigned capacity;
451  };
452 
453  union
454  {
455  char buf[len];
456  view data;
457  };
458 
459  bool isOnStack() const { return (buf[last] & 128) == 0; }
460  void setOnHeap();
461  void setLast(unsigned in = last);
462 
463  void copy(const String& other);
464 
465 public:
466  String();
467  ~String();
468 
469  // cppcheck-suppress noExplicitConstructor
470  String(const char* in);
471  String(const char* in, unsigned in_size);
472 
473  String(const String& other);
474  String& operator=(const String& other);
475 
476  String& operator+=(const String& other);
477  String operator+(const String& other) const;
478 
479  String(String&& other);
480  String& operator=(String&& other);
481 
482  char operator[](unsigned i) const;
483  char& operator[](unsigned i);
484 
485  // the only functions I'm willing to leave in the interface - available for inlining
486  const char* c_str() const { return const_cast<String*>(this)->c_str(); } // NOLINT
487  char* c_str() {
488  if(isOnStack())
489  return reinterpret_cast<char*>(buf);
490  return data.ptr;
491  }
492 
493  unsigned size() const;
494  unsigned capacity() const;
495 
496  int compare(const char* other, bool no_case = false) const;
497  int compare(const String& other, bool no_case = false) const;
498 };
499 
500 DOCTEST_INTERFACE bool operator==(const String& lhs, const String& rhs);
501 DOCTEST_INTERFACE bool operator!=(const String& lhs, const String& rhs);
502 DOCTEST_INTERFACE bool operator<(const String& lhs, const String& rhs);
503 DOCTEST_INTERFACE bool operator>(const String& lhs, const String& rhs);
504 DOCTEST_INTERFACE bool operator<=(const String& lhs, const String& rhs);
505 DOCTEST_INTERFACE bool operator>=(const String& lhs, const String& rhs);
506 
507 DOCTEST_INTERFACE std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& s, const String& in);
508 
509 namespace Color {
510  enum Enum
511  {
512  None = 0,
513  White,
514  Red,
515  Green,
516  Blue,
517  Cyan,
518  Yellow,
519  Grey,
520 
521  Bright = 0x10,
522 
523  BrightRed = Bright | Red,
524  BrightGreen = Bright | Green,
525  LightGrey = Bright | Grey,
526  BrightWhite = Bright | White
527  };
528 
529  DOCTEST_INTERFACE std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& s, Color::Enum code);
530 } // namespace Color
531 
532 namespace assertType {
533  enum Enum
534  {
535  // macro traits
536 
537  is_warn = 1,
538  is_check = 2 * is_warn,
539  is_require = 2 * is_check,
540 
541  is_normal = 2 * is_require,
542  is_throws = 2 * is_normal,
543  is_throws_as = 2 * is_throws,
544  is_throws_with = 2 * is_throws_as,
545  is_nothrow = 2 * is_throws_with,
546 
547  is_false = 2 * is_nothrow,
548  is_unary = 2 * is_false, // not checked anywhere - used just to distinguish the types
549 
550  is_eq = 2 * is_unary,
551  is_ne = 2 * is_eq,
552 
553  is_lt = 2 * is_ne,
554  is_gt = 2 * is_lt,
555 
556  is_ge = 2 * is_gt,
557  is_le = 2 * is_ge,
558 
559  // macro types
560 
561  DT_WARN = is_normal | is_warn,
562  DT_CHECK = is_normal | is_check,
563  DT_REQUIRE = is_normal | is_require,
564 
565  DT_WARN_FALSE = is_normal | is_false | is_warn,
566  DT_CHECK_FALSE = is_normal | is_false | is_check,
567  DT_REQUIRE_FALSE = is_normal | is_false | is_require,
568 
569  DT_WARN_THROWS = is_throws | is_warn,
570  DT_CHECK_THROWS = is_throws | is_check,
571  DT_REQUIRE_THROWS = is_throws | is_require,
572 
573  DT_WARN_THROWS_AS = is_throws_as | is_warn,
574  DT_CHECK_THROWS_AS = is_throws_as | is_check,
575  DT_REQUIRE_THROWS_AS = is_throws_as | is_require,
576 
577  DT_WARN_THROWS_WITH = is_throws_with | is_warn,
578  DT_CHECK_THROWS_WITH = is_throws_with | is_check,
579  DT_REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH = is_throws_with | is_require,
580 
581  DT_WARN_NOTHROW = is_nothrow | is_warn,
582  DT_CHECK_NOTHROW = is_nothrow | is_check,
583  DT_REQUIRE_NOTHROW = is_nothrow | is_require,
584 
585  DT_WARN_EQ = is_normal | is_eq | is_warn,
586  DT_CHECK_EQ = is_normal | is_eq | is_check,
587  DT_REQUIRE_EQ = is_normal | is_eq | is_require,
588 
589  DT_WARN_NE = is_normal | is_ne | is_warn,
590  DT_CHECK_NE = is_normal | is_ne | is_check,
591  DT_REQUIRE_NE = is_normal | is_ne | is_require,
592 
593  DT_WARN_GT = is_normal | is_gt | is_warn,
594  DT_CHECK_GT = is_normal | is_gt | is_check,
595  DT_REQUIRE_GT = is_normal | is_gt | is_require,
596 
597  DT_WARN_LT = is_normal | is_lt | is_warn,
598  DT_CHECK_LT = is_normal | is_lt | is_check,
599  DT_REQUIRE_LT = is_normal | is_lt | is_require,
600 
601  DT_WARN_GE = is_normal | is_ge | is_warn,
602  DT_CHECK_GE = is_normal | is_ge | is_check,
603  DT_REQUIRE_GE = is_normal | is_ge | is_require,
604 
605  DT_WARN_LE = is_normal | is_le | is_warn,
606  DT_CHECK_LE = is_normal | is_le | is_check,
607  DT_REQUIRE_LE = is_normal | is_le | is_require,
608 
609  DT_WARN_UNARY = is_normal | is_unary | is_warn,
610  DT_CHECK_UNARY = is_normal | is_unary | is_check,
611  DT_REQUIRE_UNARY = is_normal | is_unary | is_require,
612 
613  DT_WARN_UNARY_FALSE = is_normal | is_false | is_unary | is_warn,
614  DT_CHECK_UNARY_FALSE = is_normal | is_false | is_unary | is_check,
615  DT_REQUIRE_UNARY_FALSE = is_normal | is_false | is_unary | is_require,
616  };
617 } // namespace assertType
618 
619 DOCTEST_INTERFACE const char* assertString(assertType::Enum at);
620 DOCTEST_INTERFACE const char* failureString(assertType::Enum at);
621 DOCTEST_INTERFACE const char* skipPathFromFilename(const char* file);
622 
623 struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE TestCaseData
624 {
625  const char* m_file; // the file in which the test was registered
626  unsigned m_line; // the line where the test was registered
627  const char* m_name; // name of the test case
628  const char* m_test_suite; // the test suite in which the test was added
629  const char* m_description;
630  bool m_skip;
631  bool m_may_fail;
632  bool m_should_fail;
633  int m_expected_failures;
634  double m_timeout;
635 
636  DOCTEST_DECLARE_DEFAULTS(TestCaseData);
637  DOCTEST_DECLARE_COPIES(TestCaseData);
638 };
639 
640 struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE AssertData
641 {
642  // common - for all asserts
643  const TestCaseData* m_test_case;
644  assertType::Enum m_at;
645  const char* m_file;
646  int m_line;
647  const char* m_expr;
648  bool m_failed;
649 
650  // exception-related - for all asserts
651  bool m_threw;
652  String m_exception;
653 
654  // for normal asserts
655  String m_decomp;
656 
657  // for specific exception-related asserts
658  bool m_threw_as;
659  const char* m_exception_type;
660 
661  DOCTEST_DECLARE_DEFAULTS(AssertData);
662  DOCTEST_DELETE_COPIES(AssertData);
663 };
664 
665 struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE MessageData
666 {
667  String m_string;
668  const char* m_file;
669  int m_line;
670  assertType::Enum m_severity;
671 
672  DOCTEST_DECLARE_DEFAULTS(MessageData);
673  DOCTEST_DELETE_COPIES(MessageData);
674 };
675 
676 struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE SubcaseSignature
677 {
678  const char* m_name;
679  const char* m_file;
680  int m_line;
681 
682  SubcaseSignature(const char* name, const char* file, int line);
683 
684  bool operator<(const SubcaseSignature& other) const;
685 
686  DOCTEST_DECLARE_DEFAULTS(SubcaseSignature);
687  DOCTEST_DECLARE_COPIES(SubcaseSignature);
688 };
689 
690 struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE IContextScope
691 {
692  DOCTEST_DELETE_COPIES(IContextScope);
693 
694  IContextScope();
695  virtual ~IContextScope();
696  virtual void stringify(std::ostream*) const = 0;
697 };
698 
699 struct ContextOptions
700 {
701  std::ostream* cout; // stdout stream - std::cout by default
702  std::ostream* cerr; // stderr stream - std::cerr by default
703  String binary_name; // the test binary name
704 
705  // == parameters from the command line
706  String out; // output filename
707  String order_by; // how tests should be ordered
708  unsigned rand_seed; // the seed for rand ordering
709 
710  unsigned first; // the first (matching) test to be executed
711  unsigned last; // the last (matching) test to be executed
712 
713  int abort_after; // stop tests after this many failed assertions
714  int subcase_filter_levels; // apply the subcase filters for the first N levels
715 
716  bool success; // include successful assertions in output
717  bool case_sensitive; // if filtering should be case sensitive
718  bool exit; // if the program should be exited after the tests are ran/whatever
719  bool duration; // print the time duration of each test case
720  bool no_throw; // to skip exceptions-related assertion macros
721  bool no_exitcode; // if the framework should return 0 as the exitcode
722  bool no_run; // to not run the tests at all (can be done with an "*" exclude)
723  bool no_version; // to not print the version of the framework
724  bool no_colors; // if output to the console should be colorized
725  bool force_colors; // forces the use of colors even when a tty cannot be detected
726  bool no_breaks; // to not break into the debugger
727  bool no_skip; // don't skip test cases which are marked to be skipped
728  bool gnu_file_line; // if line numbers should be surrounded with :x: and not (x):
729  bool no_path_in_filenames; // if the path to files should be removed from the output
730  bool no_line_numbers; // if source code line numbers should be omitted from the output
731  bool no_skipped_summary; // don't print "skipped" in the summary !!! UNDOCUMENTED !!!
732 
733  bool help; // to print the help
734  bool version; // to print the version
735  bool count; // if only the count of matching tests is to be retreived
736  bool list_test_cases; // to list all tests matching the filters
737  bool list_test_suites; // to list all suites matching the filters
738  bool list_reporters; // lists all registered reporters
739 
740  DOCTEST_DECLARE_DEFAULTS(ContextOptions);
741  DOCTEST_DELETE_COPIES(ContextOptions);
742 };
743 
744 namespace detail {
745 #if defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING) || defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS)
746  template <bool CONDITION, typename TYPE = void>
747  struct enable_if
748  {};
749 
750  template <typename TYPE>
751  struct enable_if<true, TYPE>
752  { typedef TYPE type; };
753 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING) || DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
754 
755  // clang-format off
756  template<class T> struct remove_reference { typedef T type; };
757  template<class T> struct remove_reference<T&> { typedef T type; };
758  template<class T> struct remove_reference<T&&> { typedef T type; };
759 
760  template<class T> struct remove_const { typedef T type; };
761  template<class T> struct remove_const<const T> { typedef T type; };
762  // clang-format on
763 
764  template <typename T>
765  struct deferred_false
766  // cppcheck-suppress unusedStructMember
767  { static const bool value = false; };
768 
769  namespace has_insertion_operator_impl {
770  typedef char no;
771  typedef char yes[2];
772 
773  struct any_t
774  {
775  template <typename T>
776  // cppcheck-suppress noExplicitConstructor
777  any_t(const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(T));
778  };
779 
780  yes& testStreamable(std::ostream&);
781  no testStreamable(no);
782 
783  no operator<<(const std::ostream&, const any_t&);
784 
785  template <typename T>
786  struct has_insertion_operator
787  {
788  static std::ostream& s;
789  static const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(T) t;
790  static const bool value = sizeof(decltype(testStreamable(s << t))) == sizeof(yes);
791  };
792  } // namespace has_insertion_operator_impl
793 
794  template <typename T>
795  struct has_insertion_operator : has_insertion_operator_impl::has_insertion_operator<T>
796  {};
797 
798  DOCTEST_INTERFACE void my_memcpy(void* dest, const void* src, unsigned num);
799 
800  DOCTEST_INTERFACE std::ostream* getTlsOss(); // returns a thread-local ostringstream
801  DOCTEST_INTERFACE String getTlsOssResult();
802 
803  template <bool C>
804  struct StringMakerBase
805  {
806  template <typename T>
807  static String convert(const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(T)) {
808  return "{?}";
809  }
810  };
811 
812  template <>
813  struct StringMakerBase<true>
814  {
815  template <typename T>
816  static String convert(const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(T) in) {
817  *getTlsOss() << in;
818  return getTlsOssResult();
819  }
820  };
821 
822  DOCTEST_INTERFACE String rawMemoryToString(const void* object, unsigned size);
823 
824  template <typename T>
825  String rawMemoryToString(const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(T) object) {
826  return rawMemoryToString(&object, sizeof(object));
827  }
828 
829  template <typename T>
830  const char* type_to_string() {
831  return "<>";
832  }
833 } // namespace detail
834 
835 template <typename T>
836 struct StringMaker : public detail::StringMakerBase<detail::has_insertion_operator<T>::value>
837 {};
838 
839 template <typename T>
840 struct StringMaker<T*>
841 {
842  template <typename U>
843  static String convert(U* p) {
844  if(p)
845  return detail::rawMemoryToString(p);
846  return "NULL";
847  }
848 };
849 
850 template <typename R, typename C>
851 struct StringMaker<R C::*>
852 {
853  static String convert(R C::*p) {
854  if(p)
855  return detail::rawMemoryToString(p);
856  return "NULL";
857  }
858 };
859 
860 template <typename T>
861 String toString(const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(T) value) {
862  return StringMaker<T>::convert(value);
863 }
864 
865 #ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING
866 DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(char* in);
867 DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(const char* in);
868 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING
869 DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(bool in);
870 DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(float in);
871 DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(double in);
872 DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(double long in);
873 
874 DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(char in);
875 DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(char signed in);
876 DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(char unsigned in);
877 DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(int short in);
878 DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(int short unsigned in);
879 DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(int in);
880 DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(int unsigned in);
881 DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(int long in);
882 DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(int long unsigned in);
883 DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(int long long in);
884 DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(int long long unsigned in);
885 DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(std::nullptr_t in);
886 
887 class DOCTEST_INTERFACE Approx
888 {
889 public:
890  explicit Approx(double value);
891 
892  DOCTEST_DECLARE_COPIES(Approx);
893 
894  Approx operator()(double value) const;
895 
896 #ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
897  template <typename T>
898  explicit Approx(const T& value,
899  typename detail::enable_if<std::is_constructible<double, T>::value>::type* =
900  static_cast<T*>(nullptr)) {
901  *this = Approx(static_cast<double>(value));
902  }
903 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
904 
905  Approx& epsilon(double newEpsilon);
906 
907 #ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
908  template <typename T>
909  typename detail::enable_if<std::is_constructible<double, T>::value, Approx&>::type epsilon(
910  const T& newEpsilon) {
911  m_epsilon = static_cast<double>(newEpsilon);
912  return *this;
913  }
914 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
915 
916  Approx& scale(double newScale);
917 
918 #ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
919  template <typename T>
920  typename detail::enable_if<std::is_constructible<double, T>::value, Approx&>::type scale(
921  const T& newScale) {
922  m_scale = static_cast<double>(newScale);
923  return *this;
924  }
925 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
926 
927  // clang-format off
928  DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator==(double lhs, const Approx & rhs);
929  DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator==(const Approx & lhs, double rhs);
930  DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator!=(double lhs, const Approx & rhs);
931  DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator!=(const Approx & lhs, double rhs);
932  DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator<=(double lhs, const Approx & rhs);
933  DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator<=(const Approx & lhs, double rhs);
934  DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator>=(double lhs, const Approx & rhs);
935  DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator>=(const Approx & lhs, double rhs);
936  DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator< (double lhs, const Approx & rhs);
937  DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator< (const Approx & lhs, double rhs);
938  DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator> (double lhs, const Approx & rhs);
939  DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend bool operator> (const Approx & lhs, double rhs);
940 
941  DOCTEST_INTERFACE friend String toString(const Approx& in);
942 
943 #ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
944 #define DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX \
945  template <typename T> friend typename detail::enable_if<std::is_constructible<double, T>::value, bool>::type
946 
947  DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator==(const T& lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return operator==(double(lhs), rhs); }
948  DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator==(const Approx& lhs, const T& rhs) { return operator==(rhs, lhs); }
949  DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator!=(const T& lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return !operator==(lhs, rhs); }
950  DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator!=(const Approx& lhs, const T& rhs) { return !operator==(rhs, lhs); }
951  DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator<=(const T& lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return double(lhs) < rhs.m_value || lhs == rhs; }
952  DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator<=(const Approx& lhs, const T& rhs) { return lhs.m_value < double(rhs) || lhs == rhs; }
953  DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator>=(const T& lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return double(lhs) > rhs.m_value || lhs == rhs; }
954  DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator>=(const Approx& lhs, const T& rhs) { return lhs.m_value > double(rhs) || lhs == rhs; }
955  DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator< (const T& lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return double(lhs) < rhs.m_value && lhs != rhs; }
956  DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator< (const Approx& lhs, const T& rhs) { return lhs.m_value < double(rhs) && lhs != rhs; }
957  DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator> (const T& lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return double(lhs) > rhs.m_value && lhs != rhs; }
958  DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX operator> (const Approx& lhs, const T& rhs) { return lhs.m_value > double(rhs) && lhs != rhs; }
959 #undef DOCTEST_APPROX_PREFIX
960 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_INCLUDE_TYPE_TRAITS
961 
962  // clang-format on
963 
964 private:
965  double m_epsilon;
966  double m_scale;
967  double m_value;
968 };
969 
970 DOCTEST_INTERFACE String toString(const Approx& in);
971 
972 DOCTEST_INTERFACE const ContextOptions* getContextOptions();
973 
974 #if !defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_DISABLE)
975 
976 namespace detail {
977  // clang-format off
978 #ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING
979  template<class T> struct decay_array { typedef T type; };
980  template<class T, unsigned N> struct decay_array<T[N]> { typedef T* type; };
981  template<class T> struct decay_array<T[]> { typedef T* type; };
982 
983  template<class T> struct not_char_pointer { enum { value = 1 }; };
984  template<> struct not_char_pointer<char*> { enum { value = 0 }; };
985  template<> struct not_char_pointer<const char*> { enum { value = 0 }; };
986 
987  template<class T> struct can_use_op : public not_char_pointer<typename decay_array<T>::type> {};
988 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING
989  // clang-format on
990 
991  struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE TestFailureException
992  {
993  DOCTEST_DECLARE_DEFAULTS(TestFailureException);
994  DOCTEST_DECLARE_COPIES(TestFailureException);
995  };
996 
997  DOCTEST_INTERFACE bool checkIfShouldThrow(assertType::Enum at);
998 
999 #ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
1000  [[noreturn]]
1001 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
1002  DOCTEST_INTERFACE void throwException();
1003 
1004  struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE Subcase
1005  {
1006  SubcaseSignature m_signature;
1007  bool m_entered = false;
1008 
1009  Subcase(const char* name, const char* file, int line);
1010  ~Subcase();
1011 
1012  DOCTEST_DELETE_COPIES(Subcase);
1013 
1014  operator bool() const;
1015  };
1016 
1017  template <typename L, typename R>
1018  String stringifyBinaryExpr(const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(L) lhs, const char* op,
1019  const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(R) rhs) {
1020  return toString(lhs) + op + toString(rhs);
1021  }
1022 
1023 #define DOCTEST_DO_BINARY_EXPRESSION_COMPARISON(op, op_str, op_macro) \
1024  template <typename R> \
1025  DOCTEST_NOINLINE Result operator op(const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(R) rhs) { \
1026  bool res = op_macro(lhs, rhs); \
1027  if(m_at & assertType::is_false) \
1028  res = !res; \
1029  if(!res || doctest::getContextOptions()->success) \
1030  return Result(res, stringifyBinaryExpr(lhs, op_str, rhs)); \
1031  return Result(res); \
1032  }
1033 
1034  // more checks could be added - like in Catch:
1035  // https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2/pull/1480/files
1036  // https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2/pull/1481/files
1037 #define DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(rt, op) \
1038  template <typename R> \
1039  rt& operator op(const R&) { \
1040  static_assert(deferred_false<R>::value, \
1041  "Expression Too Complex Please Rewrite As Binary Comparison!"); \
1042  return *this; \
1043  }
1044 
1045  struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE Result
1046  {
1047  bool m_passed;
1048  String m_decomp;
1049 
1050  Result(bool passed, const String& decomposition = String());
1051 
1052  DOCTEST_DECLARE_DEFAULTS(Result);
1053  DOCTEST_DECLARE_COPIES(Result);
1054 
1055  // forbidding some expressions based on this table: http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/operator_precedence
1056  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, &)
1057  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, ^)
1058  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, |)
1059  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, &&)
1060  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, ||)
1061  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, ==)
1062  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, !=)
1063  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, <)
1064  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, >)
1065  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, <=)
1066  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, >=)
1067  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, =)
1068  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, +=)
1069  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, -=)
1070  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, *=)
1071  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, /=)
1072  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, %=)
1073  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, <<=)
1074  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, >>=)
1075  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, &=)
1076  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, ^=)
1077  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Result, |=)
1078  };
1079 
1080 #ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_COMPARISON_WARNING_SUPPRESSION
1081 
1082  DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_PUSH
1083  DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wsign-conversion")
1084  DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wsign-compare")
1085  //DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wdouble-promotion")
1086  //DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wconversion")
1087  //DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wfloat-equal")
1088 
1089  DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_PUSH
1090  DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wsign-conversion")
1091  DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wsign-compare")
1092  //DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wdouble-promotion")
1093  //DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wconversion")
1094  //DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING("-Wfloat-equal")
1095 
1096  DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_PUSH
1097  // http://stackoverflow.com/questions/39479163 what's the difference between 4018 and 4389
1098  DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4388) // signed/unsigned mismatch
1099  DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4389) // 'operator' : signed/unsigned mismatch
1100  DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4018) // 'expression' : signed/unsigned mismatch
1101  //DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4805) // 'operation' : unsafe mix of type 'type' and type 'type' in operation
1102 
1103 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_COMPARISON_WARNING_SUPPRESSION
1104 
1105  // clang-format off
1106 #ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING
1107 #define DOCTEST_COMPARISON_RETURN_TYPE bool
1108 #else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING
1109 #define DOCTEST_COMPARISON_RETURN_TYPE typename enable_if<can_use_op<L>::value || can_use_op<R>::value, bool>::type
1110  inline bool eq(const char* lhs, const char* rhs) { return String(lhs) == String(rhs); }
1111  inline bool ne(const char* lhs, const char* rhs) { return String(lhs) != String(rhs); }
1112  inline bool lt(const char* lhs, const char* rhs) { return String(lhs) < String(rhs); }
1113  inline bool gt(const char* lhs, const char* rhs) { return String(lhs) > String(rhs); }
1114  inline bool le(const char* lhs, const char* rhs) { return String(lhs) <= String(rhs); }
1115  inline bool ge(const char* lhs, const char* rhs) { return String(lhs) >= String(rhs); }
1116 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING
1117  // clang-format on
1118 
1119 #define DOCTEST_RELATIONAL_OP(name, op) \
1120  template <typename L, typename R> \
1121  DOCTEST_COMPARISON_RETURN_TYPE name(const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(L) lhs, \
1122  const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(R) rhs) { \
1123  return lhs op rhs; \
1124  }
1125 
1126  DOCTEST_RELATIONAL_OP(eq, ==)
1127  DOCTEST_RELATIONAL_OP(ne, !=)
1128  DOCTEST_RELATIONAL_OP(lt, <)
1129  DOCTEST_RELATIONAL_OP(gt, >)
1130  DOCTEST_RELATIONAL_OP(le, <=)
1131  DOCTEST_RELATIONAL_OP(ge, >=)
1132 
1133 #ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING
1134 #define DOCTEST_CMP_EQ(l, r) l == r
1135 #define DOCTEST_CMP_NE(l, r) l != r
1136 #define DOCTEST_CMP_GT(l, r) l > r
1137 #define DOCTEST_CMP_LT(l, r) l < r
1138 #define DOCTEST_CMP_GE(l, r) l >= r
1139 #define DOCTEST_CMP_LE(l, r) l <= r
1140 #else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING
1141 #define DOCTEST_CMP_EQ(l, r) eq(l, r)
1142 #define DOCTEST_CMP_NE(l, r) ne(l, r)
1143 #define DOCTEST_CMP_GT(l, r) gt(l, r)
1144 #define DOCTEST_CMP_LT(l, r) lt(l, r)
1145 #define DOCTEST_CMP_GE(l, r) ge(l, r)
1146 #define DOCTEST_CMP_LE(l, r) le(l, r)
1147 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING
1148 
1149  template <typename L>
1150  // cppcheck-suppress copyCtorAndEqOperator
1151  struct Expression_lhs
1152  {
1153  L lhs;
1154  assertType::Enum m_at;
1155 
1156  explicit Expression_lhs(L in, assertType::Enum at)
1157  : lhs(in)
1158  , m_at(at) {}
1159 
1160  DOCTEST_NOINLINE operator Result() {
1161  bool res = !!lhs;
1162  if(m_at & assertType::is_false)
1163  res = !res;
1164 
1165  if(!res || getContextOptions()->success)
1166  return Result(res, toString(lhs));
1167  return Result(res);
1168  }
1169 
1170  // clang-format off
1171  DOCTEST_DO_BINARY_EXPRESSION_COMPARISON(==, " == ", DOCTEST_CMP_EQ)
1172  DOCTEST_DO_BINARY_EXPRESSION_COMPARISON(!=, " != ", DOCTEST_CMP_NE)
1173  DOCTEST_DO_BINARY_EXPRESSION_COMPARISON(>, " > ", DOCTEST_CMP_GT)
1174  DOCTEST_DO_BINARY_EXPRESSION_COMPARISON(<, " < ", DOCTEST_CMP_LT)
1175  DOCTEST_DO_BINARY_EXPRESSION_COMPARISON(>=, " >= ", DOCTEST_CMP_GE)
1176  DOCTEST_DO_BINARY_EXPRESSION_COMPARISON(<=, " <= ", DOCTEST_CMP_LE)
1177  // clang-format on
1178 
1179  // forbidding some expressions based on this table: http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/operator_precedence
1180  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, &)
1181  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, ^)
1182  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, |)
1183  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, &&)
1184  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, ||)
1185  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, =)
1186  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, +=)
1187  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, -=)
1188  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, *=)
1189  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, /=)
1190  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, %=)
1191  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, <<=)
1192  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, >>=)
1193  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, &=)
1194  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, ^=)
1195  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, |=)
1196  // these 2 are unfortunate because they should be allowed - they have higher precedence over the comparisons, but the
1197  // ExpressionDecomposer class uses the left shift operator to capture the left operand of the binary expression...
1198  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, <<)
1199  DOCTEST_FORBIT_EXPRESSION(Expression_lhs, >>)
1200  };
1201 
1202 #ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_COMPARISON_WARNING_SUPPRESSION
1203 
1204  DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
1205  DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
1206  DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
1207 
1208 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_COMPARISON_WARNING_SUPPRESSION
1209 
1210  struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE ExpressionDecomposer
1211  {
1212  assertType::Enum m_at;
1213 
1214  ExpressionDecomposer(assertType::Enum at);
1215 
1216  DOCTEST_DECLARE_DEFAULTS(ExpressionDecomposer);
1217  DOCTEST_DELETE_COPIES(ExpressionDecomposer);
1218 
1219  // The right operator for capturing expressions is "<=" instead of "<<" (based on the operator precedence table)
1220  // but then there will be warnings from GCC about "-Wparentheses" and since "_Pragma()" is problematic this will stay for now...
1221  // https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2/issues/870
1222  // https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2/issues/565
1223  template <typename L>
1224  Expression_lhs<const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(L)> operator<<(const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(L) operand) {
1225  return Expression_lhs<const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(L)>(operand, m_at);
1226  }
1227  };
1228 
1229  struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE TestSuite
1230  {
1231  const char* m_test_suite;
1232  const char* m_description;
1233  bool m_skip;
1234  bool m_may_fail;
1235  bool m_should_fail;
1236  int m_expected_failures;
1237  double m_timeout;
1238 
1239  DOCTEST_DECLARE_DEFAULTS(TestSuite);
1240  DOCTEST_DECLARE_COPIES(TestSuite);
1241 
1242  TestSuite& operator*(const char* in);
1243 
1244  template <typename T>
1245  TestSuite& operator*(const T& in) {
1246  in.fill(*this);
1247  return *this;
1248  }
1249  };
1250 
1251  typedef void (*funcType)();
1252 
1253  struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE TestCase : public TestCaseData
1254  {
1255  funcType m_test; // a function pointer to the test case
1256 
1257  const char* m_type; // for templated test cases - gets appended to the real name
1258  int m_template_id; // an ID used to distinguish between the different versions of a templated test case
1259  String m_full_name; // contains the name (only for templated test cases!) + the template type
1260 
1261  TestCase(funcType test, const char* file, unsigned line, const TestSuite& test_suite,
1262  const char* type = "", int template_id = -1);
1263 
1264  DOCTEST_DECLARE_DEFAULTS(TestCase);
1265 
1266  TestCase(const TestCase& other);
1267 
1268  DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(26434) // hides a non-virtual function
1269  TestCase& operator=(const TestCase& other);
1270  DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
1271 
1272  TestCase& operator*(const char* in);
1273 
1274  template <typename T>
1275  TestCase& operator*(const T& in) {
1276  in.fill(*this);
1277  return *this;
1278  }
1279 
1280  bool operator<(const TestCase& other) const;
1281  };
1282 
1283  // forward declarations of functions used by the macros
1284  DOCTEST_INTERFACE int regTest(const TestCase& tc);
1285  DOCTEST_INTERFACE int setTestSuite(const TestSuite& ts);
1286  DOCTEST_INTERFACE bool isDebuggerActive();
1287 
1288  namespace binaryAssertComparison {
1289  enum Enum
1290  {
1291  eq = 0,
1292  ne,
1293  gt,
1294  lt,
1295  ge,
1296  le
1297  };
1298  } // namespace binaryAssertComparison
1299 
1300  // clang-format off
1301  template <int, class L, class R> struct RelationalComparator { bool operator()(const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(L), const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(R) ) const { return false; } };
1302 
1303 #define DOCTEST_BINARY_RELATIONAL_OP(n, op) \
1304  template <class L, class R> struct RelationalComparator<n, L, R> { bool operator()(const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(L) lhs, const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(R) rhs) const { return op(lhs, rhs); } };
1305  // clang-format on
1306 
1307  DOCTEST_BINARY_RELATIONAL_OP(0, eq)
1308  DOCTEST_BINARY_RELATIONAL_OP(1, ne)
1309  DOCTEST_BINARY_RELATIONAL_OP(2, gt)
1310  DOCTEST_BINARY_RELATIONAL_OP(3, lt)
1311  DOCTEST_BINARY_RELATIONAL_OP(4, ge)
1312  DOCTEST_BINARY_RELATIONAL_OP(5, le)
1313 
1314  struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE ResultBuilder : public AssertData
1315  {
1316  ResultBuilder(assertType::Enum at, const char* file, int line, const char* expr,
1317  const char* exception_type = "");
1318 
1319  DOCTEST_DECLARE_DEFAULTS(ResultBuilder);
1320  DOCTEST_DELETE_COPIES(ResultBuilder);
1321 
1322  void setResult(const Result& res);
1323 
1324  template <int comparison, typename L, typename R>
1325  DOCTEST_NOINLINE void binary_assert(const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(L) lhs,
1326  const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(R) rhs) {
1327  m_failed = !RelationalComparator<comparison, L, R>()(lhs, rhs);
1328  if(m_failed || getContextOptions()->success)
1329  m_decomp = stringifyBinaryExpr(lhs, ", ", rhs);
1330  }
1331 
1332  template <typename L>
1333  DOCTEST_NOINLINE void unary_assert(const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(L) val) {
1334  m_failed = !val;
1335 
1336  if(m_at & assertType::is_false)
1337  m_failed = !m_failed;
1338 
1339  if(m_failed || getContextOptions()->success)
1340  m_decomp = toString(val);
1341  }
1342 
1343  void translateException();
1344 
1345  bool log();
1346  void react() const;
1347  };
1348 
1349  namespace assertAction {
1350  enum Enum
1351  {
1352  nothing = 0,
1353  dbgbreak = 1,
1354  shouldthrow = 2
1355  };
1356  } // namespace assertAction
1357 
1358  DOCTEST_INTERFACE void failed_out_of_a_testing_context(const AssertData& ad);
1359 
1360  DOCTEST_INTERFACE void decomp_assert(assertType::Enum at, const char* file, int line,
1361  const char* expr, Result result);
1362 
1363 #define DOCTEST_ASSERT_OUT_OF_TESTS(decomp) \
1364  do { \
1365  if(!is_running_in_test) { \
1366  if(failed) { \
1367  ResultBuilder rb(at, file, line, expr); \
1368  rb.m_failed = failed; \
1369  rb.m_decomp = decomp; \
1370  failed_out_of_a_testing_context(rb); \
1371  if(isDebuggerActive() && !getContextOptions()->no_breaks) \
1372  DOCTEST_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER(); \
1373  if(checkIfShouldThrow(at)) \
1374  throwException(); \
1375  } \
1376  return; \
1377  } \
1378  } while(false)
1379 
1380 #define DOCTEST_ASSERT_IN_TESTS(decomp) \
1381  ResultBuilder rb(at, file, line, expr); \
1382  rb.m_failed = failed; \
1383  if(rb.m_failed || getContextOptions()->success) \
1384  rb.m_decomp = decomp; \
1385  if(rb.log()) \
1386  DOCTEST_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER(); \
1387  if(rb.m_failed && checkIfShouldThrow(at)) \
1388  throwException()
1389 
1390  template <int comparison, typename L, typename R>
1391  DOCTEST_NOINLINE void binary_assert(assertType::Enum at, const char* file, int line,
1392  const char* expr, const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(L) lhs,
1393  const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(R) rhs) {
1394  bool failed = !RelationalComparator<comparison, L, R>()(lhs, rhs);
1395 
1396  // ###################################################################################
1397  // IF THE DEBUGGER BREAKS HERE - GO 1 LEVEL UP IN THE CALLSTACK FOR THE FAILING ASSERT
1398  // THIS IS THE EFFECT OF HAVING 'DOCTEST_CONFIG_SUPER_FAST_ASSERTS' DEFINED
1399  // ###################################################################################
1400  DOCTEST_ASSERT_OUT_OF_TESTS(stringifyBinaryExpr(lhs, ", ", rhs));
1401  DOCTEST_ASSERT_IN_TESTS(stringifyBinaryExpr(lhs, ", ", rhs));
1402  }
1403 
1404  template <typename L>
1405  DOCTEST_NOINLINE void unary_assert(assertType::Enum at, const char* file, int line,
1406  const char* expr, const DOCTEST_REF_WRAP(L) val) {
1407  bool failed = !val;
1408 
1409  if(at & assertType::is_false)
1410  failed = !failed;
1411 
1412  // ###################################################################################
1413  // IF THE DEBUGGER BREAKS HERE - GO 1 LEVEL UP IN THE CALLSTACK FOR THE FAILING ASSERT
1414  // THIS IS THE EFFECT OF HAVING 'DOCTEST_CONFIG_SUPER_FAST_ASSERTS' DEFINED
1415  // ###################################################################################
1416  DOCTEST_ASSERT_OUT_OF_TESTS(toString(val));
1417  DOCTEST_ASSERT_IN_TESTS(toString(val));
1418  }
1419 
1420  struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE IExceptionTranslator
1421  {
1422  DOCTEST_DELETE_COPIES(IExceptionTranslator);
1423 
1424  IExceptionTranslator();
1425  virtual ~IExceptionTranslator();
1426  virtual bool translate(String&) const = 0;
1427  };
1428 
1429  template <typename T>
1430  class ExceptionTranslator : public IExceptionTranslator
1431  {
1432  public:
1433  explicit ExceptionTranslator(String (*translateFunction)(T))
1434  : m_translateFunction(translateFunction) {}
1435 
1436  bool translate(String& res) const override {
1437 #ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
1438  try {
1439  throw; // lgtm [cpp/rethrow-no-exception]
1440  // cppcheck-suppress catchExceptionByValue
1441  } catch(T ex) { // NOLINT
1442  res = m_translateFunction(ex);
1443  return true;
1444  } catch(...) {}
1445 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
1446  ((void)res); // to silence -Wunused-parameter
1447  return false;
1448  }
1449 
1450  private:
1451  String (*m_translateFunction)(T);
1452  };
1453 
1454  DOCTEST_INTERFACE void registerExceptionTranslatorImpl(const IExceptionTranslator* et);
1455 
1456  template <bool C>
1457  struct StringStreamBase
1458  {
1459  template <typename T>
1460  static void convert(std::ostream* s, const T& in) {
1461  *s << toString(in);
1462  }
1463 
1464  // always treat char* as a string in this context - no matter
1465  // if DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING is defined
1466  static void convert(std::ostream* s, const char* in) { *s << String(in); }
1467  };
1468 
1469  template <>
1470  struct StringStreamBase<true>
1471  {
1472  template <typename T>
1473  static void convert(std::ostream* s, const T& in) {
1474  *s << in;
1475  }
1476  };
1477 
1478  template <typename T>
1479  struct StringStream : public StringStreamBase<has_insertion_operator<T>::value>
1480  {};
1481 
1482  template <typename T>
1483  void toStream(std::ostream* s, const T& value) {
1484  StringStream<T>::convert(s, value);
1485  }
1486 
1487 #ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING
1488  DOCTEST_INTERFACE void toStream(std::ostream* s, char* in);
1489  DOCTEST_INTERFACE void toStream(std::ostream* s, const char* in);
1490 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING
1491  DOCTEST_INTERFACE void toStream(std::ostream* s, bool in);
1492  DOCTEST_INTERFACE void toStream(std::ostream* s, float in);
1493  DOCTEST_INTERFACE void toStream(std::ostream* s, double in);
1494  DOCTEST_INTERFACE void toStream(std::ostream* s, double long in);
1495 
1496  DOCTEST_INTERFACE void toStream(std::ostream* s, char in);
1497  DOCTEST_INTERFACE void toStream(std::ostream* s, char signed in);
1498  DOCTEST_INTERFACE void toStream(std::ostream* s, char unsigned in);
1499  DOCTEST_INTERFACE void toStream(std::ostream* s, int short in);
1500  DOCTEST_INTERFACE void toStream(std::ostream* s, int short unsigned in);
1501  DOCTEST_INTERFACE void toStream(std::ostream* s, int in);
1502  DOCTEST_INTERFACE void toStream(std::ostream* s, int unsigned in);
1503  DOCTEST_INTERFACE void toStream(std::ostream* s, int long in);
1504  DOCTEST_INTERFACE void toStream(std::ostream* s, int long unsigned in);
1505  DOCTEST_INTERFACE void toStream(std::ostream* s, int long long in);
1506  DOCTEST_INTERFACE void toStream(std::ostream* s, int long long unsigned in);
1507 
1508  class DOCTEST_INTERFACE ContextBuilder
1509  {
1510  friend class ContextScope;
1511 
1512  struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE ICapture
1513  {
1514  DOCTEST_DELETE_COPIES(ICapture);
1515  ICapture();
1516  virtual ~ICapture();
1517  virtual void toStream(std::ostream*) const = 0;
1518  };
1519 
1520  template <typename T>
1521  struct Capture : public ICapture
1522  {
1523  const T* capture;
1524 
1525  explicit Capture(const T* in)
1526  : capture(in) {}
1527  void toStream(std::ostream* s) const override { detail::toStream(s, *capture); }
1528  };
1529 
1530  struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE Chunk
1531  {
1532  char buf[sizeof(Capture<char>)] DOCTEST_ALIGNMENT(
1533  2 * sizeof(void*)); // place to construct a Capture<T>
1534 
1535  DOCTEST_DECLARE_DEFAULTS(Chunk);
1536  DOCTEST_DELETE_COPIES(Chunk);
1537  };
1538 
1539  struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE Node
1540  {
1541  Chunk chunk;
1542  Node* next;
1543 
1544  DOCTEST_DECLARE_DEFAULTS(Node);
1545  DOCTEST_DELETE_COPIES(Node);
1546  };
1547 
1548  Chunk stackChunks[DOCTEST_CONFIG_NUM_CAPTURES_ON_STACK];
1549  int numCaptures = 0;
1550  Node* head = nullptr;
1551  Node* tail = nullptr;
1552 
1553  ContextBuilder(ContextBuilder& other);
1554 
1555  ContextBuilder& operator=(const ContextBuilder&) = delete;
1556 
1557  void stringify(std::ostream* s) const;
1558 
1559  public:
1560  ContextBuilder();
1561  ~ContextBuilder();
1562 
1563  template <typename T>
1564  DOCTEST_NOINLINE ContextBuilder& operator<<(T& in) {
1565  Capture<T> temp(&in);
1566 
1567  // construct either on stack or on heap
1568  // copy the bytes for the whole object - including the vtable because we cant construct
1569  // the object directly in the buffer using placement new - need the <new> header...
1570  if(numCaptures < DOCTEST_CONFIG_NUM_CAPTURES_ON_STACK) {
1571  my_memcpy(stackChunks[numCaptures].buf, &temp, sizeof(Chunk));
1572  } else {
1573  auto curr = new Node;
1574  curr->next = nullptr;
1575  if(tail) {
1576  tail->next = curr;
1577  tail = curr;
1578  } else {
1579  head = tail = curr;
1580  }
1581 
1582  my_memcpy(tail->chunk.buf, &temp, sizeof(Chunk));
1583  }
1584  ++numCaptures;
1585  return *this;
1586  }
1587 
1588  template <typename T>
1589  ContextBuilder& operator<<(const T&&) {
1590  static_assert(deferred_false<T>::value,
1591  "Cannot pass temporaries or rvalues to the streaming operator because it "
1592  "caches pointers to the passed objects for lazy evaluation!");
1593  return *this;
1594  }
1595  };
1596 
1597  class DOCTEST_INTERFACE ContextScope : public IContextScope
1598  {
1599  ContextBuilder contextBuilder;
1600 
1601  public:
1602  explicit ContextScope(ContextBuilder& temp);
1603 
1604  DOCTEST_DELETE_COPIES(ContextScope);
1605 
1606  ~ContextScope() override;
1607 
1608  void stringify(std::ostream* s) const override;
1609  };
1610 
1611  struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE MessageBuilder : public MessageData
1612  {
1613  std::ostream* m_stream;
1614 
1615  MessageBuilder(const char* file, int line, assertType::Enum severity);
1616  MessageBuilder() = delete;
1617  ~MessageBuilder();
1618 
1619  DOCTEST_DELETE_COPIES(MessageBuilder);
1620 
1621  template <typename T>
1622  MessageBuilder& operator<<(const T& in) {
1623  toStream(m_stream, in);
1624  return *this;
1625  }
1626 
1627  bool log();
1628  void react();
1629  };
1630 } // namespace detail
1631 
1632 #define DOCTEST_DEFINE_DECORATOR(name, type, def) \
1633  struct name \
1634  { \
1635  type data; \
1636  name(type in = def) \
1637  : data(in) {} \
1638  void fill(detail::TestCase& state) const { state.DOCTEST_CAT(m_, name) = data; } \
1639  void fill(detail::TestSuite& state) const { state.DOCTEST_CAT(m_, name) = data; } \
1640  }
1641 
1642 DOCTEST_DEFINE_DECORATOR(test_suite, const char*, "");
1643 DOCTEST_DEFINE_DECORATOR(description, const char*, "");
1644 DOCTEST_DEFINE_DECORATOR(skip, bool, true);
1645 DOCTEST_DEFINE_DECORATOR(timeout, double, 0);
1646 DOCTEST_DEFINE_DECORATOR(may_fail, bool, true);
1647 DOCTEST_DEFINE_DECORATOR(should_fail, bool, true);
1648 DOCTEST_DEFINE_DECORATOR(expected_failures, int, 0);
1649 
1650 template <typename T>
1651 int registerExceptionTranslator(String (*translateFunction)(T)) {
1652  DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wexit-time-destructors")
1653  static detail::ExceptionTranslator<T> exceptionTranslator(translateFunction);
1654  DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
1655  detail::registerExceptionTranslatorImpl(&exceptionTranslator);
1656  return 0;
1657 }
1658 
1659 } // namespace doctest
1660 
1661 // in a separate namespace outside of doctest because the DOCTEST_TEST_SUITE macro
1662 // introduces an anonymous namespace in which getCurrentTestSuite gets overridden
1663 namespace doctest_detail_test_suite_ns {
1664 DOCTEST_INTERFACE doctest::detail::TestSuite& getCurrentTestSuite();
1665 } // namespace doctest_detail_test_suite_ns
1666 
1667 namespace doctest {
1668 #else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_DISABLE
1669 template <typename T>
1670 int registerExceptionTranslator(String (*)(T)) {
1671  return 0;
1672 }
1673 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_DISABLE
1674 
1675 namespace detail {
1676  typedef void (*assert_handler)(const AssertData&);
1677  struct ContextState;
1678 } // namespace detail
1679 
1680 class DOCTEST_INTERFACE Context
1681 {
1682  detail::ContextState* p;
1683 
1684  void parseArgs(int argc, const char* const* argv, bool withDefaults = false);
1685 
1686 public:
1687  explicit Context(int argc = 0, const char* const* argv = nullptr);
1688 
1689  DOCTEST_DELETE_COPIES(Context);
1690 
1691  ~Context();
1692 
1693  void applyCommandLine(int argc, const char* const* argv);
1694 
1695  void addFilter(const char* filter, const char* value);
1696  void clearFilters();
1697  void setOption(const char* option, int value);
1698  void setOption(const char* option, const char* value);
1699 
1700  bool shouldExit();
1701 
1702  void setAsDefaultForAssertsOutOfTestCases();
1703 
1704  void setAssertHandler(detail::assert_handler ah);
1705 
1706  int run();
1707 };
1708 
1709 namespace TestCaseFailureReason {
1710  enum Enum
1711  {
1712  None = 0,
1713  AssertFailure = 1, // an assertion has failed in the test case
1714  Exception = 2, // test case threw an exception
1715  Crash = 4, // a crash...
1716  TooManyFailedAsserts = 8, // the abort-after option
1717  Timeout = 16, // see the timeout decorator
1718  ShouldHaveFailedButDidnt = 32, // see the should_fail decorator
1719  ShouldHaveFailedAndDid = 64, // see the should_fail decorator
1720  DidntFailExactlyNumTimes = 128, // see the expected_failures decorator
1721  FailedExactlyNumTimes = 256, // see the expected_failures decorator
1722  CouldHaveFailedAndDid = 512 // see the may_fail decorator
1723  };
1724 } // namespace TestCaseFailureReason
1725 
1726 struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE CurrentTestCaseStats
1727 {
1728  int numAssertsCurrentTest;
1729  int numAssertsFailedCurrentTest;
1730  double seconds;
1731  int failure_flags; // use TestCaseFailureReason::Enum
1732 
1733  DOCTEST_DECLARE_DEFAULTS(CurrentTestCaseStats);
1734  DOCTEST_DELETE_COPIES(CurrentTestCaseStats);
1735 };
1736 
1737 struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE TestCaseException
1738 {
1739  String error_string;
1740  bool is_crash;
1741 };
1742 
1743 struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE TestRunStats
1744 {
1745  unsigned numTestCases;
1746  unsigned numTestCasesPassingFilters;
1747  unsigned numTestSuitesPassingFilters;
1748  unsigned numTestCasesFailed;
1749  int numAsserts;
1750  int numAssertsFailed;
1751 
1752  DOCTEST_DECLARE_DEFAULTS(TestRunStats);
1753  DOCTEST_DELETE_COPIES(TestRunStats);
1754 };
1755 
1756 struct QueryData
1757 {
1758  const TestRunStats* run_stats = nullptr;
1759  String* data = nullptr;
1760  unsigned num_data = 0;
1761 };
1762 
1763 struct DOCTEST_INTERFACE IReporter
1764 {
1765  // The constructor has to accept "const ContextOptions&" as a single argument
1766  // which has most of the options for the run + a pointer to the stdout stream
1767  // Reporter(const ContextOptions& in)
1768 
1769  // called when a query should be reported (listing test cases, printing the version, etc.)
1770  virtual void report_query(const QueryData&) = 0;
1771 
1772  // called when the whole test run starts
1773  virtual void test_run_start() = 0;
1774  // called when the whole test run ends (caching a pointer to the input doesn't make sense here)
1775  virtual void test_run_end(const TestRunStats&) = 0;
1776 
1777  // called when a test case is started (safe to cache a pointer to the input)
1778  virtual void test_case_start(const TestCaseData&) = 0;
1779  // called when a test case has ended
1780  virtual void test_case_end(const CurrentTestCaseStats&) = 0;
1781 
1782  // called when an exception is thrown from the test case (or it crashes)
1783  virtual void test_case_exception(const TestCaseException&) = 0;
1784 
1785  // called whenever a subcase is entered (don't cache pointers to the input)
1786  virtual void subcase_start(const SubcaseSignature&) = 0;
1787  // called whenever a subcase is exited (don't cache pointers to the input)
1788  virtual void subcase_end() = 0;
1789 
1790  // called for each assert (don't cache pointers to the input)
1791  virtual void log_assert(const AssertData&) = 0;
1792  // called for each message (don't cache pointers to the input)
1793  virtual void log_message(const MessageData&) = 0;
1794 
1795  // called when a test case is skipped either because it doesn't pass the filters, has a skip decorator
1796  // or isn't in the execution range (between first and last) (safe to cache a pointer to the input)
1797  virtual void test_case_skipped(const TestCaseData&) = 0;
1798 
1799  // doctest will not be managing the lifetimes of reporters given to it but this would still be nice to have
1800  virtual ~IReporter();
1801 
1802  // can obtain all currently active contexts and stringify them if one wishes to do so
1803  static int get_num_active_contexts();
1804  static const IContextScope* const* get_active_contexts();
1805 
1806  // can iterate through contexts which have been stringified automatically in their destructors when an exception has been thrown
1807  static int get_num_stringified_contexts();
1808  static const String* get_stringified_contexts();
1809 };
1810 
1811 namespace detail {
1812  typedef IReporter* (*reporterCreatorFunc)(const ContextOptions&);
1813 
1814  DOCTEST_INTERFACE void registerReporterImpl(const char* name, int prio, reporterCreatorFunc c);
1815 
1816  template <typename Reporter>
1817  IReporter* reporterCreator(const ContextOptions& o) {
1818  return new Reporter(o);
1819  }
1820 } // namespace detail
1821 
1822 template <typename Reporter>
1823 int registerReporter(const char* name, int priority) {
1824  detail::registerReporterImpl(name, priority, detail::reporterCreator<Reporter>);
1825  return 0;
1826 }
1827 } // namespace doctest
1828 
1829 // if registering is not disabled
1830 #if !defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_DISABLE)
1831 
1832 // common code in asserts - for convenience
1833 #define DOCTEST_ASSERT_LOG_AND_REACT(b) \
1834  if(b.log()) \
1835  DOCTEST_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER(); \
1836  b.react()
1837 
1838 #ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_TRY_CATCH_IN_ASSERTS
1839 #define DOCTEST_WRAP_IN_TRY(x) x;
1840 #else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_TRY_CATCH_IN_ASSERTS
1841 #define DOCTEST_WRAP_IN_TRY(x) \
1842  try { \
1843  x; \
1844  } catch(...) { _DOCTEST_RB.translateException(); }
1845 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_TRY_CATCH_IN_ASSERTS
1846 
1847 #ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_VOID_CAST_EXPRESSIONS
1848 #define DOCTEST_CAST_TO_VOID(x) \
1849  DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wuseless-cast") \
1850  static_cast<void>(x); \
1851  DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
1852 #else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_VOID_CAST_EXPRESSIONS
1853 #define DOCTEST_CAST_TO_VOID(x) x;
1854 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_VOID_CAST_EXPRESSIONS
1855 
1856 // registers the test by initializing a dummy var with a function
1857 #define DOCTEST_REGISTER_FUNCTION(global_prefix, f, decorators) \
1858  global_prefix DOCTEST_GLOBAL_NO_WARNINGS(DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_VAR_)) = \
1859  doctest::detail::regTest( \
1860  doctest::detail::TestCase( \
1861  f, __FILE__, __LINE__, \
1862  doctest_detail_test_suite_ns::getCurrentTestSuite()) * \
1863  decorators); \
1864  DOCTEST_GLOBAL_NO_WARNINGS_END()
1865 
1866 #define DOCTEST_IMPLEMENT_FIXTURE(der, base, func, decorators) \
1867  namespace { \
1868  struct der : public base \
1869  { \
1870  void f(); \
1871  }; \
1872  static void func() { \
1873  der v; \
1874  v.f(); \
1875  } \
1876  DOCTEST_REGISTER_FUNCTION(DOCTEST_EMPTY, func, decorators) \
1877  } \
1878  inline DOCTEST_NOINLINE void der::f()
1879 
1880 #define DOCTEST_CREATE_AND_REGISTER_FUNCTION(f, decorators) \
1881  static void f(); \
1882  DOCTEST_REGISTER_FUNCTION(DOCTEST_EMPTY, f, decorators) \
1883  static void f()
1884 
1885 #define DOCTEST_CREATE_AND_REGISTER_FUNCTION_IN_CLASS(f, proxy, decorators) \
1886  static doctest::detail::funcType proxy() { return f; } \
1887  DOCTEST_REGISTER_FUNCTION(inline const, proxy(), decorators) \
1888  static void f()
1889 
1890 // for registering tests
1891 #define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE(decorators) \
1892  DOCTEST_CREATE_AND_REGISTER_FUNCTION(DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_FUNC_), decorators)
1893 
1894 // for registering tests in classes - requires C++17 for inline variables!
1895 #if __cplusplus >= 201703L || (DOCTEST_MSVC >= DOCTEST_COMPILER(19, 12, 0) && _MSVC_LANG >= 201703L)
1896 #define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_CLASS(decorators) \
1897  DOCTEST_CREATE_AND_REGISTER_FUNCTION_IN_CLASS(DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_FUNC_), \
1898  DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_PROXY_), \
1899  decorators)
1900 #else // DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_CLASS
1901 #define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_CLASS(...) \
1902  TEST_CASES_CAN_BE_REGISTERED_IN_CLASSES_ONLY_IN_CPP17_MODE_OR_WITH_VS_2017_OR_NEWER
1903 #endif // DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_CLASS
1904 
1905 // for registering tests with a fixture
1906 #define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_FIXTURE(c, decorators) \
1907  DOCTEST_IMPLEMENT_FIXTURE(DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_CLASS_), c, \
1908  DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_FUNC_), decorators)
1909 
1910 // for converting types to strings without the <typeinfo> header and demangling
1911 #define DOCTEST_TYPE_TO_STRING_IMPL(...) \
1912  template <> \
1913  inline const char* type_to_string<__VA_ARGS__>() { \
1914  return "<" #__VA_ARGS__ ">"; \
1915  }
1916 #define DOCTEST_TYPE_TO_STRING(...) \
1917  namespace doctest { namespace detail { \
1918  DOCTEST_TYPE_TO_STRING_IMPL(__VA_ARGS__) \
1919  } \
1920  } \
1921  typedef int DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_FOR_SEMICOLON_)
1922 
1923 // for typed tests
1924 #define DOCTEST_REGISTER_TYPED_TEST_CASE_IMPL(func, type, decorators, idx) \
1925  doctest::detail::regTest( \
1926  doctest::detail::TestCase(func, __FILE__, __LINE__, \
1927  doctest_detail_test_suite_ns::getCurrentTestSuite(), \
1928  doctest::detail::type_to_string<type>(), idx) * \
1929  decorators)
1930 
1931 #define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_DEFINE_IMPL(dec, T, iter, func) \
1932  template <typename T> \
1933  inline void func(); \
1934  template <typename Tuple> \
1935  struct iter; \
1936  template <typename Type, typename... Rest> \
1937  struct iter<std::tuple<Type, Rest...>> \
1938  { \
1939  iter(int line, int index) { \
1940  DOCTEST_REGISTER_TYPED_TEST_CASE_IMPL(func<Type>, Type, dec, line * 1000 + index); \
1941  iter<std::tuple<Rest...>>(line, index + 1); \
1942  } \
1943  }; \
1944  template <> \
1945  struct iter<std::tuple<>> \
1946  { \
1947  iter(int, int) {} \
1948  }; \
1949  template <typename T> \
1950  inline void func()
1951 
1952 #define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_DEFINE(dec, T, id) \
1953  DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_DEFINE_IMPL(dec, T, DOCTEST_CAT(id, ITERATOR), \
1954  DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_TMP_))
1955 
1956 #define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_INVOKE_IMPL(id, anon, ...) \
1957  DOCTEST_GLOBAL_NO_WARNINGS(DOCTEST_CAT(anon, DUMMY)) = [] { \
1958  DOCTEST_CAT(id, ITERATOR)<std::tuple<__VA_ARGS__>> DOCTEST_UNUSED DOCTEST_CAT( \
1959  anon, inner_dummy)(__LINE__, 0); \
1960  return 0; \
1961  }(); \
1962  DOCTEST_GLOBAL_NO_WARNINGS_END()
1963 
1964 #define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_INVOKE(id, ...) \
1965  DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_INVOKE_IMPL(id, DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_TMP_), __VA_ARGS__) \
1966  typedef int DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_FOR_SEMICOLON_)
1967 
1968 #define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_APPLY_IMPL(id, anon, ...) \
1969  DOCTEST_GLOBAL_NO_WARNINGS(DOCTEST_CAT(anon, DUMMY)) = [] { \
1970  DOCTEST_CAT(id, ITERATOR)<__VA_ARGS__> DOCTEST_UNUSED DOCTEST_CAT(anon, inner_dummy)( \
1971  __LINE__, 0); \
1972  return 0; \
1973  }(); \
1974  DOCTEST_GLOBAL_NO_WARNINGS_END()
1975 
1976 #define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_APPLY(id, ...) \
1977  DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_APPLY_IMPL(id, DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_TMP_), __VA_ARGS__) \
1978  typedef int DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_FOR_SEMICOLON_)
1979 
1980 #define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_IMPL(dec, T, anon, ...) \
1981  DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_DEFINE_IMPL(dec, T, DOCTEST_CAT(anon, ITERATOR), anon); \
1982  DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_INVOKE_IMPL(anon, anon, __VA_ARGS__) \
1983  template <typename T> \
1984  inline void anon()
1985 
1986 #define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE(dec, T, ...) \
1987  DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_IMPL(dec, T, DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_TMP_), __VA_ARGS__)
1988 
1989 // for subcases
1990 #define DOCTEST_SUBCASE(name) \
1991  if(const doctest::detail::Subcase & DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_SUBCASE_) DOCTEST_UNUSED = \
1992  doctest::detail::Subcase(name, __FILE__, __LINE__))
1993 
1994 // for grouping tests in test suites by using code blocks
1995 #define DOCTEST_TEST_SUITE_IMPL(decorators, ns_name) \
1996  namespace ns_name { namespace doctest_detail_test_suite_ns { \
1997  static DOCTEST_NOINLINE doctest::detail::TestSuite& getCurrentTestSuite() { \
1998  DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(4640) \
1999  DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wexit-time-destructors") \
2000  static doctest::detail::TestSuite data; \
2001  static bool inited = false; \
2002  DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP \
2003  DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP \
2004  if(!inited) { \
2005  data* decorators; \
2006  inited = true; \
2007  } \
2008  return data; \
2009  } \
2010  } \
2011  } \
2012  namespace ns_name
2013 
2014 #define DOCTEST_TEST_SUITE(decorators) \
2015  DOCTEST_TEST_SUITE_IMPL(decorators, DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_SUITE_))
2016 
2017 // for starting a testsuite block
2018 #define DOCTEST_TEST_SUITE_BEGIN(decorators) \
2019  DOCTEST_GLOBAL_NO_WARNINGS(DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_VAR_)) = \
2020  doctest::detail::setTestSuite(doctest::detail::TestSuite() * decorators); \
2021  DOCTEST_GLOBAL_NO_WARNINGS_END() \
2022  typedef int DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_FOR_SEMICOLON_)
2023 
2024 // for ending a testsuite block
2025 #define DOCTEST_TEST_SUITE_END \
2026  DOCTEST_GLOBAL_NO_WARNINGS(DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_VAR_)) = \
2027  doctest::detail::setTestSuite(doctest::detail::TestSuite() * ""); \
2028  DOCTEST_GLOBAL_NO_WARNINGS_END() \
2029  typedef int DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_FOR_SEMICOLON_)
2030 
2031 // for registering exception translators
2032 #define DOCTEST_REGISTER_EXCEPTION_TRANSLATOR_IMPL(translatorName, signature) \
2033  inline doctest::String translatorName(signature); \
2034  DOCTEST_GLOBAL_NO_WARNINGS(DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_TRANSLATOR_)) = \
2035  doctest::registerExceptionTranslator(translatorName); \
2036  DOCTEST_GLOBAL_NO_WARNINGS_END() \
2037  doctest::String translatorName(signature)
2038 
2039 #define DOCTEST_REGISTER_EXCEPTION_TRANSLATOR(signature) \
2040  DOCTEST_REGISTER_EXCEPTION_TRANSLATOR_IMPL(DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_TRANSLATOR_), \
2041  signature)
2042 
2043 // for registering
2044 #define DOCTEST_REGISTER_REPORTER(name, priority, reporter) \
2045  DOCTEST_GLOBAL_NO_WARNINGS(DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_REPORTER_)) = \
2046  doctest::registerReporter<reporter>(name, priority); \
2047  DOCTEST_GLOBAL_NO_WARNINGS_END() typedef int DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_FOR_SEMICOLON_)
2048 
2049 // for logging
2050 #define DOCTEST_INFO(x) \
2051  doctest::detail::ContextScope DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_CAPTURE_)( \
2052  doctest::detail::ContextBuilder() << x)
2053 #define DOCTEST_CAPTURE(x) DOCTEST_INFO(#x " := " << x)
2054 
2055 #define DOCTEST_ADD_AT_IMPL(type, file, line, mb, x) \
2056  do { \
2057  doctest::detail::MessageBuilder mb(file, line, doctest::assertType::type); \
2058  mb << x; \
2059  DOCTEST_ASSERT_LOG_AND_REACT(mb); \
2060  } while((void)0, 0)
2061 
2062 // clang-format off
2063 #define DOCTEST_ADD_MESSAGE_AT(file, line, x) DOCTEST_ADD_AT_IMPL(is_warn, file, line, DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_MESSAGE_), x)
2064 #define DOCTEST_ADD_FAIL_CHECK_AT(file, line, x) DOCTEST_ADD_AT_IMPL(is_check, file, line, DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_MESSAGE_), x)
2065 #define DOCTEST_ADD_FAIL_AT(file, line, x) DOCTEST_ADD_AT_IMPL(is_require, file, line, DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_MESSAGE_), x)
2066 // clang-format on
2067 
2068 #define DOCTEST_MESSAGE(x) DOCTEST_ADD_MESSAGE_AT(__FILE__, __LINE__, x)
2069 #define DOCTEST_FAIL_CHECK(x) DOCTEST_ADD_FAIL_CHECK_AT(__FILE__, __LINE__, x)
2070 #define DOCTEST_FAIL(x) DOCTEST_ADD_FAIL_AT(__FILE__, __LINE__, x)
2071 
2072 // hack for macros like INFO() that require lvalues
2073 #if __cplusplus >= 201402L || (DOCTEST_MSVC >= DOCTEST_COMPILER(19, 10, 0))
2074 template <class T, T x>
2075 constexpr T to_lvalue = x;
2076 #define DOCTEST_TO_LVALUE(...) to_lvalue<decltype(__VA_ARGS__), __VA_ARGS__>
2077 #else // TO_LVALUE
2078 #define DOCTEST_TO_LVALUE(...) TO_LVALUE_CAN_BE_USED_ONLY_IN_CPP14_MODE_OR_WITH_VS_2017_OR_NEWER
2079 #endif // TO_LVALUE
2080 
2081 #ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_SUPER_FAST_ASSERTS
2082 
2083 #define DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_2(assert_type, ...) \
2084  DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Woverloaded-shift-op-parentheses") \
2085  doctest::detail::ResultBuilder _DOCTEST_RB(doctest::assertType::assert_type, __FILE__, \
2086  __LINE__, #__VA_ARGS__); \
2087  DOCTEST_WRAP_IN_TRY(_DOCTEST_RB.setResult( \
2088  doctest::detail::ExpressionDecomposer(doctest::assertType::assert_type) \
2089  << __VA_ARGS__)) \
2090  DOCTEST_ASSERT_LOG_AND_REACT(_DOCTEST_RB) \
2091  DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
2092 
2093 #define DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_1(assert_type, ...) \
2094  do { \
2095  DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_2(assert_type, __VA_ARGS__); \
2096  } while((void)0, 0)
2097 
2098 #else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_SUPER_FAST_ASSERTS
2099 
2100 #define DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_1(assert_type, ...) \
2101  DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Woverloaded-shift-op-parentheses") \
2102  doctest::detail::decomp_assert( \
2103  doctest::assertType::assert_type, __FILE__, __LINE__, #__VA_ARGS__, \
2104  doctest::detail::ExpressionDecomposer(doctest::assertType::assert_type) \
2105  << __VA_ARGS__) DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
2106 
2107 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_SUPER_FAST_ASSERTS
2108 
2109 #define DOCTEST_WARN(...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_1(DT_WARN, __VA_ARGS__)
2110 #define DOCTEST_CHECK(...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_1(DT_CHECK, __VA_ARGS__)
2111 #define DOCTEST_REQUIRE(...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_1(DT_REQUIRE, __VA_ARGS__)
2112 #define DOCTEST_WARN_FALSE(...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_1(DT_WARN_FALSE, __VA_ARGS__)
2113 #define DOCTEST_CHECK_FALSE(...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_1(DT_CHECK_FALSE, __VA_ARGS__)
2114 #define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_FALSE(...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_1(DT_REQUIRE_FALSE, __VA_ARGS__)
2115 
2116 // clang-format off
2117 #define DOCTEST_WARN_MESSAGE(cond, msg) do { DOCTEST_INFO(msg); DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_2(DT_WARN, cond); } while((void)0, 0)
2118 #define DOCTEST_CHECK_MESSAGE(cond, msg) do { DOCTEST_INFO(msg); DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_2(DT_CHECK, cond); } while((void)0, 0)
2119 #define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_MESSAGE(cond, msg) do { DOCTEST_INFO(msg); DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_2(DT_REQUIRE, cond); } while((void)0, 0)
2120 #define DOCTEST_WARN_FALSE_MESSAGE(cond, msg) do { DOCTEST_INFO(msg); DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_2(DT_WARN_FALSE, cond); } while((void)0, 0)
2121 #define DOCTEST_CHECK_FALSE_MESSAGE(cond, msg) do { DOCTEST_INFO(msg); DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_2(DT_CHECK_FALSE, cond); } while((void)0, 0)
2122 #define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_FALSE_MESSAGE(cond, msg) do { DOCTEST_INFO(msg); DOCTEST_ASSERT_IMPLEMENT_2(DT_REQUIRE_FALSE, cond); } while((void)0, 0)
2123 // clang-format on
2124 
2125 #define DOCTEST_ASSERT_THROWS_AS(expr, assert_type, ...) \
2126  do { \
2127  if(!doctest::getContextOptions()->no_throw) { \
2128  doctest::detail::ResultBuilder _DOCTEST_RB(doctest::assertType::assert_type, __FILE__, \
2129  __LINE__, #expr, #__VA_ARGS__); \
2130  try { \
2131  DOCTEST_CAST_TO_VOID(expr) \
2132  } catch(const doctest::detail::remove_const< \
2133  doctest::detail::remove_reference<__VA_ARGS__>::type>::type&) { \
2134  _DOCTEST_RB.translateException(); \
2135  _DOCTEST_RB.m_threw_as = true; \
2136  } catch(...) { _DOCTEST_RB.translateException(); } \
2137  DOCTEST_ASSERT_LOG_AND_REACT(_DOCTEST_RB); \
2138  } \
2139  } while((void)0, 0)
2140 
2141 #define DOCTEST_ASSERT_THROWS_WITH(expr, assert_type, ...) \
2142  do { \
2143  if(!doctest::getContextOptions()->no_throw) { \
2144  doctest::detail::ResultBuilder _DOCTEST_RB(doctest::assertType::assert_type, __FILE__, \
2145  __LINE__, #expr, __VA_ARGS__); \
2146  try { \
2147  DOCTEST_CAST_TO_VOID(expr) \
2148  } catch(...) { _DOCTEST_RB.translateException(); } \
2149  DOCTEST_ASSERT_LOG_AND_REACT(_DOCTEST_RB); \
2150  } \
2151  } while((void)0, 0)
2152 
2153 #define DOCTEST_ASSERT_NOTHROW(expr, assert_type) \
2154  do { \
2155  doctest::detail::ResultBuilder _DOCTEST_RB(doctest::assertType::assert_type, __FILE__, \
2156  __LINE__, #expr); \
2157  try { \
2158  DOCTEST_CAST_TO_VOID(expr) \
2159  } catch(...) { _DOCTEST_RB.translateException(); } \
2160  DOCTEST_ASSERT_LOG_AND_REACT(_DOCTEST_RB); \
2161  } while((void)0, 0)
2162 
2163 // clang-format off
2164 #define DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS(expr) DOCTEST_ASSERT_THROWS_WITH(expr, DT_WARN_THROWS, "")
2165 #define DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS(expr) DOCTEST_ASSERT_THROWS_WITH(expr, DT_CHECK_THROWS, "")
2166 #define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS(expr) DOCTEST_ASSERT_THROWS_WITH(expr, DT_REQUIRE_THROWS, "")
2167 
2168 #define DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_AS(expr, ...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_THROWS_AS(expr, DT_WARN_THROWS_AS, __VA_ARGS__)
2169 #define DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_AS(expr, ...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_THROWS_AS(expr, DT_CHECK_THROWS_AS, __VA_ARGS__)
2170 #define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_AS(expr, ...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_THROWS_AS(expr, DT_REQUIRE_THROWS_AS, __VA_ARGS__)
2171 
2172 #define DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_WITH(expr, ...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_THROWS_WITH(expr, DT_WARN_THROWS_WITH, __VA_ARGS__)
2173 #define DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_WITH(expr, ...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_THROWS_WITH(expr, DT_CHECK_THROWS_WITH, __VA_ARGS__)
2174 #define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH(expr, ...) DOCTEST_ASSERT_THROWS_WITH(expr, DT_REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH, __VA_ARGS__)
2175 
2176 #define DOCTEST_WARN_NOTHROW(expr) DOCTEST_ASSERT_NOTHROW(expr, DT_WARN_NOTHROW)
2177 #define DOCTEST_CHECK_NOTHROW(expr) DOCTEST_ASSERT_NOTHROW(expr, DT_CHECK_NOTHROW)
2178 #define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_NOTHROW(expr) DOCTEST_ASSERT_NOTHROW(expr, DT_REQUIRE_NOTHROW)
2179 
2180 #define DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_MESSAGE(expr, msg) do { DOCTEST_INFO(msg); DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS(expr); } while((void)0, 0)
2181 #define DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_MESSAGE(expr, msg) do { DOCTEST_INFO(msg); DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS(expr); } while((void)0, 0)
2182 #define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_MESSAGE(expr, msg) do { DOCTEST_INFO(msg); DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS(expr); } while((void)0, 0)
2183 #define DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_AS_MESSAGE(expr, ex, msg) do { DOCTEST_INFO(msg); DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_AS(expr, ex); } while((void)0, 0)
2184 #define DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_AS_MESSAGE(expr, ex, msg) do { DOCTEST_INFO(msg); DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_AS(expr, ex); } while((void)0, 0)
2185 #define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_AS_MESSAGE(expr, ex, msg) do { DOCTEST_INFO(msg); DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_AS(expr, ex); } while((void)0, 0)
2186 #define DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_WITH_MESSAGE(expr, ex, msg) do { DOCTEST_INFO(msg); DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_WITH(expr, ex); } while((void)0, 0)
2187 #define DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_WITH_MESSAGE(expr, ex, msg) do { DOCTEST_INFO(msg); DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_WITH(expr, ex); } while((void)0, 0)
2188 #define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH_MESSAGE(expr, ex, msg) do { DOCTEST_INFO(msg); DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH(expr, ex); } while((void)0, 0)
2189 #define DOCTEST_WARN_NOTHROW_MESSAGE(expr, msg) do { DOCTEST_INFO(msg); DOCTEST_WARN_NOTHROW(expr); } while((void)0, 0)
2190 #define DOCTEST_CHECK_NOTHROW_MESSAGE(expr, msg) do { DOCTEST_INFO(msg); DOCTEST_CHECK_NOTHROW(expr); } while((void)0, 0)
2191 #define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_NOTHROW_MESSAGE(expr, msg) do { DOCTEST_INFO(msg); DOCTEST_REQUIRE_NOTHROW(expr); } while((void)0, 0)
2192 // clang-format on
2193 
2194 #ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_SUPER_FAST_ASSERTS
2195 
2196 #define DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(assert_type, comp, ...) \
2197  do { \
2198  doctest::detail::ResultBuilder _DOCTEST_RB(doctest::assertType::assert_type, __FILE__, \
2199  __LINE__, #__VA_ARGS__); \
2200  DOCTEST_WRAP_IN_TRY( \
2201  _DOCTEST_RB.binary_assert<doctest::detail::binaryAssertComparison::comp>( \
2202  __VA_ARGS__)) \
2203  DOCTEST_ASSERT_LOG_AND_REACT(_DOCTEST_RB); \
2204  } while((void)0, 0)
2205 
2206 #define DOCTEST_UNARY_ASSERT(assert_type, ...) \
2207  do { \
2208  doctest::detail::ResultBuilder _DOCTEST_RB(doctest::assertType::assert_type, __FILE__, \
2209  __LINE__, #__VA_ARGS__); \
2210  DOCTEST_WRAP_IN_TRY(_DOCTEST_RB.unary_assert(__VA_ARGS__)) \
2211  DOCTEST_ASSERT_LOG_AND_REACT(_DOCTEST_RB); \
2212  } while((void)0, 0)
2213 
2214 #else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_SUPER_FAST_ASSERTS
2215 
2216 #define DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(assert_type, comparison, ...) \
2217  doctest::detail::binary_assert<doctest::detail::binaryAssertComparison::comparison>( \
2218  doctest::assertType::assert_type, __FILE__, __LINE__, #__VA_ARGS__, __VA_ARGS__)
2219 
2220 #define DOCTEST_UNARY_ASSERT(assert_type, ...) \
2221  doctest::detail::unary_assert(doctest::assertType::assert_type, __FILE__, __LINE__, \
2222  #__VA_ARGS__, __VA_ARGS__)
2223 
2224 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_SUPER_FAST_ASSERTS
2225 
2226 #define DOCTEST_WARN_EQ(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_WARN_EQ, eq, __VA_ARGS__)
2227 #define DOCTEST_CHECK_EQ(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_CHECK_EQ, eq, __VA_ARGS__)
2228 #define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_EQ(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_REQUIRE_EQ, eq, __VA_ARGS__)
2229 #define DOCTEST_WARN_NE(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_WARN_NE, ne, __VA_ARGS__)
2230 #define DOCTEST_CHECK_NE(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_CHECK_NE, ne, __VA_ARGS__)
2231 #define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_NE(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_REQUIRE_NE, ne, __VA_ARGS__)
2232 #define DOCTEST_WARN_GT(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_WARN_GT, gt, __VA_ARGS__)
2233 #define DOCTEST_CHECK_GT(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_CHECK_GT, gt, __VA_ARGS__)
2234 #define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_GT(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_REQUIRE_GT, gt, __VA_ARGS__)
2235 #define DOCTEST_WARN_LT(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_WARN_LT, lt, __VA_ARGS__)
2236 #define DOCTEST_CHECK_LT(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_CHECK_LT, lt, __VA_ARGS__)
2237 #define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_LT(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_REQUIRE_LT, lt, __VA_ARGS__)
2238 #define DOCTEST_WARN_GE(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_WARN_GE, ge, __VA_ARGS__)
2239 #define DOCTEST_CHECK_GE(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_CHECK_GE, ge, __VA_ARGS__)
2240 #define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_GE(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_REQUIRE_GE, ge, __VA_ARGS__)
2241 #define DOCTEST_WARN_LE(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_WARN_LE, le, __VA_ARGS__)
2242 #define DOCTEST_CHECK_LE(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_CHECK_LE, le, __VA_ARGS__)
2243 #define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_LE(...) DOCTEST_BINARY_ASSERT(DT_REQUIRE_LE, le, __VA_ARGS__)
2244 
2245 #define DOCTEST_WARN_UNARY(...) DOCTEST_UNARY_ASSERT(DT_WARN_UNARY, __VA_ARGS__)
2246 #define DOCTEST_CHECK_UNARY(...) DOCTEST_UNARY_ASSERT(DT_CHECK_UNARY, __VA_ARGS__)
2247 #define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_UNARY(...) DOCTEST_UNARY_ASSERT(DT_REQUIRE_UNARY, __VA_ARGS__)
2248 #define DOCTEST_WARN_UNARY_FALSE(...) DOCTEST_UNARY_ASSERT(DT_WARN_UNARY_FALSE, __VA_ARGS__)
2249 #define DOCTEST_CHECK_UNARY_FALSE(...) DOCTEST_UNARY_ASSERT(DT_CHECK_UNARY_FALSE, __VA_ARGS__)
2250 #define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_UNARY_FALSE(...) DOCTEST_UNARY_ASSERT(DT_REQUIRE_UNARY_FALSE, __VA_ARGS__)
2251

2283 #define DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS(expr) ((void)0)
2284 #define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS(expr) ((void)0)
2285 #define DOCTEST_WARN_THROWS_AS(expr, ...) ((void)0)
2286 #define DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_AS(expr, ...) ((void)0)
2287 #define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_AS(expr, ...) ((void)0)

2289 #define DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_WITH(expr, ...) ((void)0)
2290 #define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH(expr, ...) ((void)0)

2293 #define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_NOTHROW(expr) ((void)0)

2296 #define DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_MESSAGE(expr, msg) ((void)0)

2299 #define DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_AS_MESSAGE(expr, ex, msg) ((void)0)
2300 #define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_THROWS_AS_MESSAGE(expr, ex, msg) ((void)0)

2302 #define DOCTEST_CHECK_THROWS_WITH_MESSAGE(expr, ex, msg) ((void)0)
