2327 // =================================================================================================
2328 // == WHAT FOLLOWS IS VERSIONS OF THE MACROS THAT DO NOT DO ANY REGISTERING! ==
2329 // == THIS CAN BE ENABLED BY DEFINING DOCTEST_CONFIG_DISABLE GLOBALLY! ==
2330 // =================================================================================================
2331 #else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_DISABLE
2332 
2333 #define DOCTEST_IMPLEMENT_FIXTURE(der, base, func, name) \
2334  namespace { \
2335  template <typename DOCTEST_UNUSED_TEMPLATE_TYPE> \
2336  struct der : public base \
2337  { void f(); }; \
2338  } \
2339  template <typename DOCTEST_UNUSED_TEMPLATE_TYPE> \
2340  inline void der<DOCTEST_UNUSED_TEMPLATE_TYPE>::f()
2341 
2342 #define DOCTEST_CREATE_AND_REGISTER_FUNCTION(f, name) \
2343  template <typename DOCTEST_UNUSED_TEMPLATE_TYPE> \
2344  static inline void f()
2345 
2346 // for registering tests
2347 #define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE(name) \
2348  DOCTEST_CREATE_AND_REGISTER_FUNCTION(DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_FUNC_), name)
2349 
2350 // for registering tests in classes
2351 #define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_CLASS(name) \
2352  DOCTEST_CREATE_AND_REGISTER_FUNCTION(DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_FUNC_), name)
2353 
2354 // for registering tests with a fixture
2355 #define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_FIXTURE(x, name) \
2356  DOCTEST_IMPLEMENT_FIXTURE(DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_CLASS_), x, \
2357  DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_FUNC_), name)
2358 
2359 // for converting types to strings without the <typeinfo> header and demangling
2360 #define DOCTEST_TYPE_TO_STRING(...) typedef int DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_FOR_SEMICOLON_)
2361 #define DOCTEST_TYPE_TO_STRING_IMPL(...)
2362 
2363 // for typed tests
2364 #define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE(name, type, ...) \
2365  template <typename type> \
2366  inline void DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_TMP_)()
2367 
2368 #define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_DEFINE(name, type, id) \
2369  template <typename type> \
2370  inline void DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_TMP_)()
2371 
2372 #define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_INVOKE(id, ...) \
2373  typedef int DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_FOR_SEMICOLON_)
2374 
2375 #define DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_APPLY(id, ...) \
2376  typedef int DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_FOR_SEMICOLON_)
2377 
2378 // for subcases
2379 #define DOCTEST_SUBCASE(name)
2380 
2381 // for a testsuite block
2382 #define DOCTEST_TEST_SUITE(name) namespace
2383 
2384 // for starting a testsuite block
2385 #define DOCTEST_TEST_SUITE_BEGIN(name) typedef int DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_FOR_SEMICOLON_)
2386 
2387 // for ending a testsuite block
2388 #define DOCTEST_TEST_SUITE_END typedef int DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_FOR_SEMICOLON_)
2389 
2390 #define DOCTEST_REGISTER_EXCEPTION_TRANSLATOR(signature) \
2391  template <typename DOCTEST_UNUSED_TEMPLATE_TYPE> \
2392  static inline doctest::String DOCTEST_ANONYMOUS(_DOCTEST_ANON_TRANSLATOR_)(signature)
2393 
2394 #define DOCTEST_REGISTER_REPORTER(name, priority, reporter)
2395

2397 #define DOCTEST_CAPTURE(x) ((void)0)

2399 #define DOCTEST_ADD_FAIL_CHECK_AT(file, line, x) ((void)0)
2400 #define DOCTEST_ADD_FAIL_AT(file, line, x) ((void)0)

2402 #define DOCTEST_FAIL_CHECK(x) ((void)0)
2403 #define DOCTEST_FAIL(x) ((void)0)

2463 
2464 #define DOCTEST_WARN_UNARY(...) ((void)0)
2465 #define DOCTEST_CHECK_UNARY(...) ((void)0)
2466 #define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_UNARY(...) ((void)0)
2467 #define DOCTEST_WARN_UNARY_FALSE(...) ((void)0)
2468 #define DOCTEST_CHECK_UNARY_FALSE(...) ((void)0)
2469 #define DOCTEST_REQUIRE_UNARY_FALSE(...) ((void)0)
2470 
2471 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_DISABLE

2507 #define DOCTEST_SCENARIO_CLASS(name) DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_CLASS(" Scenario: " name)
2508 #define DOCTEST_SCENARIO_TEMPLATE(name, T, ...) DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE(" Scenario: " name, T, __VA_ARGS__)
2509 #define DOCTEST_SCENARIO_TEMPLATE_DEFINE(name, T, id) DOCTEST_TEST_CASE_TEMPLATE_DEFINE(" Scenario: " name, T, id)

2514 #define DOCTEST_THEN(name) SUBCASE(" Then: " name)
2515 #define DOCTEST_AND_THEN(name) SUBCASE(" And: " name)

2743 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4616) // invalid compiler warning
2744 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4619) // invalid compiler warning
2745 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4996) // The compiler encountered a deprecated declaration
2746 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4267) // 'var' : conversion from 'x' to 'y', possible loss of data
2747 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4706) // assignment within conditional expression
2748 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4512) // 'class' : assignment operator could not be generated
2749 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4127) // conditional expression is constant
2750 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4530) // C++ exception handler used, but unwind semantics not enabled
2751 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4577) // 'noexcept' used with no exception handling mode specified
2752 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4774) // format string expected in argument is not a string literal
2753 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4365) // conversion from 'int' to 'unsigned', signed/unsigned mismatch
2754 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4820) // padding in structs
2755 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4640) // construction of local static object is not thread-safe
2756 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(5039) // pointer to potentially throwing function passed to extern C
2757 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(5045) // Spectre mitigation stuff
2758 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4626) // assignment operator was implicitly defined as deleted
2759 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(5027) // move assignment operator was implicitly defined as deleted
2760 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(5026) // move constructor was implicitly defined as deleted
2761 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4625) // copy constructor was implicitly defined as deleted
2762 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(4800) // forcing value to bool 'true' or 'false' (performance warning)
2763 // static analysis
2764 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(26439) // This kind of function may not throw. Declare it 'noexcept'
2765 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(26495) // Always initialize a member variable
2766 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(26451) // Arithmetic overflow ...
2767 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(26444) // Avoid unnamed objects with custom construction and dtor...

2840 // counts the number of elements in a C array
2841 #define DOCTEST_COUNTOF(x) (sizeof(x) / sizeof(x[0]))

2862 
2863 namespace doctest {
2864 
2865 bool is_running_in_test = false;
2866 
2867 namespace {
2868  using namespace detail;
2869  // case insensitive strcmp
2870  int stricmp(const char* a, const char* b) {
2871  for(;; a++, b++) {
2872  const int d = tolower(*a) - tolower(*b);
2873  if(d != 0 || !*a)
2874  return d;
2875  }
2876  }
2877 
2878  template <typename T>
2879  String fpToString(T value, int precision) {
2880  std::ostringstream oss;
2881  oss << std::setprecision(precision) << std::fixed << value;
2882  std::string d = oss.str();
2883  size_t i = d.find_last_not_of('0');
2884  if(i != std::string::npos && i != d.size() - 1) {
2885  if(d[i] == '.')
2886  i++;
2887  d = d.substr(0, i + 1);
2888  }
2889  return d.c_str();
2890  }
2891 
2892  struct Endianness
2893  {
2894  enum Arch
2895  {
2896  Big,
2897  Little
2898  };
2899 
2900  static Arch which() {
2901  int x = 1;
2902  // casting any data pointer to char* is allowed
2903  auto ptr = reinterpret_cast<char*>(&x);
2904  if(*ptr)
2905  return Little;
2906  return Big;
2907  }
2908  };
2909 } // namespace
2910 
2911 namespace detail {
2912  void my_memcpy(void* dest, const void* src, unsigned num) { memcpy(dest, src, num); }
2913 
2914  String rawMemoryToString(const void* object, unsigned size) {
2915  // Reverse order for little endian architectures
2916  int i = 0, end = static_cast<int>(size), inc = 1;
2917  if(Endianness::which() == Endianness::Little) {
2918  i = end - 1;
2919  end = inc = -1;
2920  }
2921 
2922  unsigned const char* bytes = static_cast<unsigned const char*>(object);
2923  std::ostringstream oss;
2924  oss << "0x" << std::setfill('0') << std::hex;
2925  for(; i != end; i += inc)
2926  oss << std::setw(2) << static_cast<unsigned>(bytes[i]);
2927  return oss.str().c_str();
2928  }
2929 
2930  DOCTEST_THREAD_LOCAL std::ostringstream g_oss;
2931 
2932  std::ostream* getTlsOss() {
2933  g_oss.clear(); // there shouldn't be anything worth clearing in the flags
2934  g_oss.str(""); // the slow way of resetting a string stream
2935  //g_oss.seekp(0); // optimal reset - as seen here: https://stackoverflow.com/a/624291/3162383
2936  return &g_oss;
2937  }
2938 
2939  String getTlsOssResult() {
2940  //g_oss << std::ends; // needed - as shown here: https://stackoverflow.com/a/624291/3162383
2941  return g_oss.str().c_str();
2942  }
2943 
2944 #ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_DISABLE
2945 
2946  typedef uint64_t UInt64;
2947 
2948 #ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_GETCURRENTTICKS
2949  UInt64 getCurrentTicks() { return DOCTEST_CONFIG_GETCURRENTTICKS(); }
2950 #elif defined(DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS)
2951  UInt64 getCurrentTicks() {
2952  static UInt64 hz = 0, hzo = 0;
2953  if(!hz) {
2954  QueryPerformanceFrequency(reinterpret_cast<LARGE_INTEGER*>(&hz));
2955  QueryPerformanceCounter(reinterpret_cast<LARGE_INTEGER*>(&hzo));
2956  }
2957  UInt64 t;
2958  QueryPerformanceCounter(reinterpret_cast<LARGE_INTEGER*>(&t));
2959  return ((t - hzo) * 1000000) / hz;
2960  }
2961 #else // DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
2962  UInt64 getCurrentTicks() {
2963  timeval t;
2964  gettimeofday(&t, nullptr);
2965  return static_cast<UInt64>(t.tv_sec) * 1000000 + static_cast<UInt64>(t.tv_usec);
2966  }
2967 #endif // DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
2968 
2969  struct Timer
2970  {
2971  void start() { m_ticks = getCurrentTicks(); }
2972  unsigned int getElapsedMicroseconds() const {
2973  return static_cast<unsigned int>(getCurrentTicks() - m_ticks);
2974  }
2975  //unsigned int getElapsedMilliseconds() const {
2976  // return static_cast<unsigned int>(getElapsedMicroseconds() / 1000);
2977  //}
2978  double getElapsedSeconds() const { return getElapsedMicroseconds() / 1000000.0; }
2979 
2980  private:
2981  UInt64 m_ticks = 0;
2982  };
2983 
2984  // this holds both parameters from the command line and runtime data for tests
2985  struct ContextState : ContextOptions, TestRunStats, CurrentTestCaseStats
2986  {
2987  std::atomic<int> numAssertsCurrentTest_atomic;
2988  std::atomic<int> numAssertsFailedCurrentTest_atomic;
2989 
2990  std::vector<std::vector<String>> filters = decltype(filters)(9); // 9 different filters
2991 
2992  std::vector<IReporter*> reporters_currently_used;
2993 
2994  const TestCase* currentTest = nullptr;
2995 
2996  assert_handler ah = nullptr;
2997 
2998  Timer timer;
2999 
3000  std::vector<String> stringifiedContexts; // logging from INFO() due to an exception
3001 
3002  // stuff for subcases
3003  std::set<SubcaseSignature> subcasesPassed;
3004  std::set<int> subcasesEnteredLevels;
3005  int subcasesCurrentLevel;
3006  bool should_reenter;
3007 
3008  void resetRunData() {
3009  numTestCases = 0;
3010  numTestCasesPassingFilters = 0;
3011  numTestSuitesPassingFilters = 0;
3012  numTestCasesFailed = 0;
3013  numAsserts = 0;
3014  numAssertsFailed = 0;
3015  numAssertsCurrentTest = 0;
3016  numAssertsFailedCurrentTest = 0;
3017  }
3018 
3019  void finalizeTestCaseData() {
3020  seconds = timer.getElapsedSeconds();
3021 
3022  // update the non-atomic counters
3023  numAsserts += numAssertsCurrentTest_atomic;
3024  numAssertsFailed += numAssertsFailedCurrentTest_atomic;
3025  numAssertsCurrentTest = numAssertsCurrentTest_atomic;
3026  numAssertsFailedCurrentTest = numAssertsFailedCurrentTest_atomic;
3027 
3028  if(numAssertsFailedCurrentTest)
3029  failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::AssertFailure;
3030 
3031  if(Approx(currentTest->m_timeout).epsilon(DBL_EPSILON) != 0 &&
3032  Approx(seconds).epsilon(DBL_EPSILON) > currentTest->m_timeout)
3033  failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::Timeout;
3034 
3035  if(currentTest->m_should_fail) {
3036  if(failure_flags) {
3037  failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::ShouldHaveFailedAndDid;
3038  } else {
3039  failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::ShouldHaveFailedButDidnt;
3040  }
3041  } else if(failure_flags && currentTest->m_may_fail) {
3042  failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::CouldHaveFailedAndDid;
3043  } else if(currentTest->m_expected_failures > 0) {
3044  if(numAssertsFailedCurrentTest == currentTest->m_expected_failures) {
3045  failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::FailedExactlyNumTimes;
3046  } else {
3047  failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::DidntFailExactlyNumTimes;
3048  }
3049  }
3050 
3051  bool ok_to_fail = (TestCaseFailureReason::ShouldHaveFailedAndDid & failure_flags) ||
3052  (TestCaseFailureReason::CouldHaveFailedAndDid & failure_flags) ||
3053  (TestCaseFailureReason::FailedExactlyNumTimes & failure_flags);
3054 
3055  // if any subcase has failed - the whole test case has failed
3056  if(failure_flags && !ok_to_fail)
3057  numTestCasesFailed++;
3058  }
3059  };
3060 
3061  ContextState* g_cs = nullptr;
3062 
3063  // used to avoid locks for the debug output
3064  // TODO: figure out if this is indeed necessary/correct - seems like either there still
3065  // could be a race or that there wouldn't be a race even if using the context directly
3066  DOCTEST_THREAD_LOCAL bool g_no_colors;
3067 
3068 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_DISABLE
3069 } // namespace detail
3070 
3071 void String::setOnHeap() { *reinterpret_cast<unsigned char*>(&buf[last]) = 128; }
3072 void String::setLast(unsigned in) { buf[last] = char(in); }
3073 
3074 void String::copy(const String& other) {
3075  if(other.isOnStack()) {
3076  memcpy(buf, other.buf, len);
3077  } else {
3078  setOnHeap();
3079  data.size = other.data.size;
3080  data.capacity = data.size + 1;
3081  data.ptr = new char[data.capacity];
3082  memcpy(data.ptr, other.data.ptr, data.size + 1);
3083  }
3084 }
3085 
3086 String::String() {
3087  buf[0] = '\0';
3088  setLast();
3089 }
3090 
3091 String::~String() {
3092  if(!isOnStack())
3093  delete[] data.ptr;
3094 }
3095 
3096 String::String(const char* in)
3097  : String(in, strlen(in)) {}
3098 
3099 String::String(const char* in, unsigned in_size) {
3100  if(in_size <= last) {
3101  memcpy(buf, in, in_size + 1);
3102  setLast(last - in_size);
3103  } else {
3104  setOnHeap();
3105  data.size = in_size;
3106  data.capacity = data.size + 1;
3107  data.ptr = new char[data.capacity];
3108  memcpy(data.ptr, in, in_size + 1);
3109  }
3110 }
3111 
3112 String::String(const String& other) { copy(other); }
3113 
3114 String& String::operator=(const String& other) {
3115  if(this != &other) {
3116  if(!isOnStack())
3117  delete[] data.ptr;
3118 
3119  copy(other);
3120  }
3121 
3122  return *this;
3123 }
3124 
3125 String& String::operator+=(const String& other) {
3126  const unsigned my_old_size = size();
3127  const unsigned other_size = other.size();
3128  const unsigned total_size = my_old_size + other_size;
3129  if(isOnStack()) {
3130  if(total_size < len) {
3131  // append to the current stack space
3132  memcpy(buf + my_old_size, other.c_str(), other_size + 1);
3133  setLast(last - total_size);
3134  } else {
3135  // alloc new chunk
3136  char* temp = new char[total_size + 1];
3137  // copy current data to new location before writing in the union
3138  memcpy(temp, buf, my_old_size); // skip the +1 ('\0') for speed
3139  // update data in union
3140  setOnHeap();
3141  data.size = total_size;
3142  data.capacity = data.size + 1;
3143  data.ptr = temp;
3144  // transfer the rest of the data
3145  memcpy(data.ptr + my_old_size, other.c_str(), other_size + 1);
3146  }
3147  } else {
3148  if(data.capacity > total_size) {
3149  // append to the current heap block
3150  data.size = total_size;
3151  memcpy(data.ptr + my_old_size, other.c_str(), other_size + 1);
3152  } else {
3153  // resize
3154  data.capacity *= 2;
3155  if(data.capacity <= total_size)
3156  data.capacity = total_size + 1;
3157  // alloc new chunk
3158  char* temp = new char[data.capacity];
3159  // copy current data to new location before releasing it
3160  memcpy(temp, data.ptr, my_old_size); // skip the +1 ('\0') for speed
3161  // release old chunk
3162  delete[] data.ptr;
3163  // update the rest of the union members
3164  data.size = total_size;
3165  data.ptr = temp;
3166  // transfer the rest of the data
3167  memcpy(data.ptr + my_old_size, other.c_str(), other_size + 1);
3168  }
3169  }
3170 
3171  return *this;
3172 }
3173 
3174 String String::operator+(const String& other) const { return String(*this) += other; }
3175 
3176 String::String(String&& other) {
3177  memcpy(buf, other.buf, len);
3178  other.buf[0] = '\0';
3179  other.setLast();
3180 }
3181 
3182 String& String::operator=(String&& other) {
3183  if(this != &other) {
3184  if(!isOnStack())
3185  delete[] data.ptr;
3186  memcpy(buf, other.buf, len);
3187  other.buf[0] = '\0';
3188  other.setLast();
3189  }
3190  return *this;
3191 }
3192 
3193 char String::operator[](unsigned i) const {
3194  return const_cast<String*>(this)->operator[](i); // NOLINT
3195 }
3196 
3197 char& String::operator[](unsigned i) {
3198  if(isOnStack())
3199  return reinterpret_cast<char*>(buf)[i];
3200  return data.ptr[i];
3201 }
3202 
3203 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wmaybe-uninitialized")
3204 unsigned String::size() const {
3205  if(isOnStack())
3206  return last - (unsigned(buf[last]) & 31); // using "last" would work only if "len" is 32
3207  return data.size;
3208 }
3209 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
3210 
3211 unsigned String::capacity() const {
3212  if(isOnStack())
3213  return len;
3214  return data.capacity;
3215 }
3216 
3217 int String::compare(const char* other, bool no_case) const {
3218  if(no_case)
3219  return stricmp(c_str(), other);
3220  return std::strcmp(c_str(), other);
3221 }
3222 
3223 int String::compare(const String& other, bool no_case) const {
3224  return compare(other.c_str(), no_case);
3225 }
3226 
3227 // clang-format off
3228 bool operator==(const String& lhs, const String& rhs) { return lhs.compare(rhs) == 0; }
3229 bool operator!=(const String& lhs, const String& rhs) { return lhs.compare(rhs) != 0; }
3230 bool operator< (const String& lhs, const String& rhs) { return lhs.compare(rhs) < 0; }
3231 bool operator> (const String& lhs, const String& rhs) { return lhs.compare(rhs) > 0; }
3232 bool operator<=(const String& lhs, const String& rhs) { return (lhs != rhs) ? lhs.compare(rhs) < 0 : true; }
3233 bool operator>=(const String& lhs, const String& rhs) { return (lhs != rhs) ? lhs.compare(rhs) > 0 : true; }
3234 // clang-format on
3235 
3236 std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& s, const String& in) { return s << in.c_str(); }
3237 
3238 namespace {
3239  void color_to_stream(std::ostream&, Color::Enum) DOCTEST_BRANCH_ON_DISABLED({}, ;)
3240 } // namespace
3241 
3242 namespace Color {
3243  std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& s, Color::Enum code) {
3244  color_to_stream(s, code);
3245  return s;
3246  }
3247 } // namespace Color

3249 // clang-format off
3250 const char* assertString(assertType::Enum at) {
3251  DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(4062) // enum 'x' in switch of enum 'y' is not handled
3252  switch(at) {
3253  case assertType::DT_WARN : return "WARN";
3254  case assertType::DT_CHECK : return "CHECK";
3255  case assertType::DT_REQUIRE : return "REQUIRE";
3256 
3257  case assertType::DT_WARN_FALSE : return "WARN_FALSE";
3258  case assertType::DT_CHECK_FALSE : return "CHECK_FALSE";
3259  case assertType::DT_REQUIRE_FALSE : return "REQUIRE_FALSE";
3260 
3261  case assertType::DT_WARN_THROWS : return "WARN_THROWS";
3262  case assertType::DT_CHECK_THROWS : return "CHECK_THROWS";
3263  case assertType::DT_REQUIRE_THROWS : return "REQUIRE_THROWS";
3264 
3265  case assertType::DT_WARN_THROWS_AS : return "WARN_THROWS_AS";
3266  case assertType::DT_CHECK_THROWS_AS : return "CHECK_THROWS_AS";
3267  case assertType::DT_REQUIRE_THROWS_AS : return "REQUIRE_THROWS_AS";
3268 
3269  case assertType::DT_WARN_THROWS_WITH : return "WARN_THROWS_WITH";
3270  case assertType::DT_CHECK_THROWS_WITH : return "CHECK_THROWS_WITH";
3271  case assertType::DT_REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH : return "REQUIRE_THROWS_WITH";
3272 
3273  case assertType::DT_WARN_NOTHROW : return "WARN_NOTHROW";
3274  case assertType::DT_CHECK_NOTHROW : return "CHECK_NOTHROW";
3275  case assertType::DT_REQUIRE_NOTHROW : return "REQUIRE_NOTHROW";
3276 
3277  case assertType::DT_WARN_EQ : return "WARN_EQ";
3278  case assertType::DT_CHECK_EQ : return "CHECK_EQ";
3279  case assertType::DT_REQUIRE_EQ : return "REQUIRE_EQ";
3280  case assertType::DT_WARN_NE : return "WARN_NE";
3281  case assertType::DT_CHECK_NE : return "CHECK_NE";
3282  case assertType::DT_REQUIRE_NE : return "REQUIRE_NE";
3283  case assertType::DT_WARN_GT : return "WARN_GT";
3284  case assertType::DT_CHECK_GT : return "CHECK_GT";
3285  case assertType::DT_REQUIRE_GT : return "REQUIRE_GT";
3286  case assertType::DT_WARN_LT : return "WARN_LT";
3287  case assertType::DT_CHECK_LT : return "CHECK_LT";
3288  case assertType::DT_REQUIRE_LT : return "REQUIRE_LT";
3289  case assertType::DT_WARN_GE : return "WARN_GE";
3290  case assertType::DT_CHECK_GE : return "CHECK_GE";
3291  case assertType::DT_REQUIRE_GE : return "REQUIRE_GE";
3292  case assertType::DT_WARN_LE : return "WARN_LE";
3293  case assertType::DT_CHECK_LE : return "CHECK_LE";
3294  case assertType::DT_REQUIRE_LE : return "REQUIRE_LE";
3295 
3296  case assertType::DT_WARN_UNARY : return "WARN_UNARY";
3297  case assertType::DT_CHECK_UNARY : return "CHECK_UNARY";
3298  case assertType::DT_REQUIRE_UNARY : return "REQUIRE_UNARY";
3299  case assertType::DT_WARN_UNARY_FALSE : return "WARN_UNARY_FALSE";
3300  case assertType::DT_CHECK_UNARY_FALSE : return "CHECK_UNARY_FALSE";
3301  case assertType::DT_REQUIRE_UNARY_FALSE : return "REQUIRE_UNARY_FALSE";
3302  }
3303  DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
3304  return "";
3305 }
3306 // clang-format on
3307 
3308 const char* failureString(assertType::Enum at) {
3309  if(at & assertType::is_warn)
3310  return "WARNING";
3311  if(at & assertType::is_check)
3312  return "ERROR";
3313  if(at & assertType::is_require)
3314  return "FATAL ERROR";
3315  return "";
3316 }
3317 
3318 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wnull-dereference")
3319 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wnull-dereference")
3320 // depending on the current options this will remove the path of filenames
3321 const char* skipPathFromFilename(const char* file) {
3322  if(getContextOptions()->no_path_in_filenames) {
3323  auto back = std::strrchr(file, '\\');
3324  auto forward = std::strrchr(file, '/');
3325  if(back || forward) {
3326  if(back > forward)
3327  forward = back;
3328  return forward + 1;
3329  }
3330  }
3331  return file;
3332 }
3333 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
3334 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP

3343 SubcaseSignature::SubcaseSignature(const char* name, const char* file, int line)
3344  : m_name(name)
3345  , m_file(file)
3346  , m_line(line) {}
3347 
3348 DOCTEST_DEFINE_DEFAULTS(SubcaseSignature);
3349 DOCTEST_DEFINE_COPIES(SubcaseSignature);
3350 
3351 bool SubcaseSignature::operator<(const SubcaseSignature& other) const {
3352  if(m_line != other.m_line)
3353  return m_line < other.m_line;
3354  if(std::strcmp(m_file, other.m_file) != 0)
3355  return std::strcmp(m_file, other.m_file) < 0;
3356  return std::strcmp(m_name, other.m_name) < 0;
3357 }

3364 #ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING
3365 String toString(char* in) { return toString(static_cast<const char*>(in)); }
3366 String toString(const char* in) { return String("\"") + (in ? in : "{null string}") + "\""; }
3367 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING
3368 String toString(bool in) { return in ? "true" : "false"; }
3369 String toString(float in) { return fpToString(in, 5) + "f"; }
3370 String toString(double in) { return fpToString(in, 10); }
3371 String toString(double long in) { return fpToString(in, 15); }
3372 
3373 #define DOCTEST_TO_STRING_OVERLOAD(type, fmt) \
3374  String toString(type in) { \
3375  char buf[64]; \
3376  std::sprintf(buf, fmt, in); \
3377  return buf; \
3378  }
3379 
3380 DOCTEST_TO_STRING_OVERLOAD(char, "%d")
3381 DOCTEST_TO_STRING_OVERLOAD(char signed, "%d")
3382 DOCTEST_TO_STRING_OVERLOAD(char unsigned, "%u")
3383 DOCTEST_TO_STRING_OVERLOAD(int short, "%d")
3384 DOCTEST_TO_STRING_OVERLOAD(int short unsigned, "%u")
3385 DOCTEST_TO_STRING_OVERLOAD(int, "%d")
3386 DOCTEST_TO_STRING_OVERLOAD(unsigned, "%u")
3387 DOCTEST_TO_STRING_OVERLOAD(int long, "%ld")
3388 DOCTEST_TO_STRING_OVERLOAD(int long unsigned, "%lu")
3389 DOCTEST_TO_STRING_OVERLOAD(int long long, "%lld")
3390 DOCTEST_TO_STRING_OVERLOAD(int long long unsigned, "%llu")
3391 
3392 String toString(std::nullptr_t) { return "NULL"; }
3393 
3394 Approx::Approx(double value)
3395  : m_epsilon(static_cast<double>(std::numeric_limits<float>::epsilon()) * 100)
3396  , m_scale(1.0)
3397  , m_value(value) {}
3398 
3399 DOCTEST_DEFINE_COPIES(Approx);
3400 
3401 Approx Approx::operator()(double value) const {
3402  Approx approx(value);
3403  approx.epsilon(m_epsilon);
3404  approx.scale(m_scale);
3405  return approx;
3406 }
3407 
3408 Approx& Approx::epsilon(double newEpsilon) {
3409  m_epsilon = newEpsilon;
3410  return *this;
3411 }
3412 Approx& Approx::scale(double newScale) {
3413  m_scale = newScale;
3414  return *this;
3415 }
3416 
3417 bool operator==(double lhs, const Approx& rhs) {
3418  // Thanks to Richard Harris for his help refining this formula
3419  return std::fabs(lhs - rhs.m_value) <
3420  rhs.m_epsilon * (rhs.m_scale + std::max(std::fabs(lhs), std::fabs(rhs.m_value)));
3421 }
3422 bool operator==(const Approx& lhs, double rhs) { return operator==(rhs, lhs); }
3423 bool operator!=(double lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return !operator==(lhs, rhs); }
3424 bool operator!=(const Approx& lhs, double rhs) { return !operator==(rhs, lhs); }
3425 bool operator<=(double lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return lhs < rhs.m_value || lhs == rhs; }
3426 bool operator<=(const Approx& lhs, double rhs) { return lhs.m_value < rhs || lhs == rhs; }
3427 bool operator>=(double lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return lhs > rhs.m_value || lhs == rhs; }
3428 bool operator>=(const Approx& lhs, double rhs) { return lhs.m_value > rhs || lhs == rhs; }
3429 bool operator<(double lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return lhs < rhs.m_value && lhs != rhs; }
3430 bool operator<(const Approx& lhs, double rhs) { return lhs.m_value < rhs && lhs != rhs; }
3431 bool operator>(double lhs, const Approx& rhs) { return lhs > rhs.m_value && lhs != rhs; }
3432 bool operator>(const Approx& lhs, double rhs) { return lhs.m_value > rhs && lhs != rhs; }
3433 
3434 String toString(const Approx& in) {
3435  return String("Approx( ") + doctest::toString(in.m_value) + " )";
3436 }
3437 const ContextOptions* getContextOptions() { return DOCTEST_BRANCH_ON_DISABLED(nullptr, g_cs); }
3438 
3439 } // namespace doctest
3440 
3441 #ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_DISABLE
3442 namespace doctest {
3443 Context::Context(int, const char* const*) {}
3444 Context::~Context() = default;
3445 void Context::applyCommandLine(int, const char* const*) {}
3446 void Context::addFilter(const char*, const char*) {}
3447 void Context::clearFilters() {}
3448 void Context::setOption(const char*, int) {}
3449 void Context::setOption(const char*, const char*) {}
3450 bool Context::shouldExit() { return false; }
3451 void Context::setAsDefaultForAssertsOutOfTestCases() {}
3452 void Context::setAssertHandler(detail::assert_handler) {}
3453 int Context::run() { return 0; }
3454 
3455 DOCTEST_DEFINE_DEFAULTS(CurrentTestCaseStats);
3456 
3457 DOCTEST_DEFINE_DEFAULTS(TestRunStats);
3458 
3459 IReporter::~IReporter() = default;

3461 int IReporter::get_num_active_contexts() { return 0; }
3462 const IContextScope* const* IReporter::get_active_contexts() { return nullptr; }
3463 int IReporter::get_num_stringified_contexts() { return 0; }
3464 const String* IReporter::get_stringified_contexts() { return nullptr; }
3465 
3466 int registerReporter(const char*, int, IReporter*) { return 0; }
3467 
3468 } // namespace doctest
3469 #else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_DISABLE
3470 
3471 #if !defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_NONE)
3472 #if !defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_WINDOWS) && !defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_ANSI)
3473 #ifdef DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
3474 #define DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_WINDOWS
3475 #else // linux
3476 #define DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_ANSI
3477 #endif // platform
3478 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_WINDOWS && DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_ANSI
3479 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_NONE

3481 namespace doctest_detail_test_suite_ns {
3482 // holds the current test suite
3483 doctest::detail::TestSuite& getCurrentTestSuite() {
3484  static doctest::detail::TestSuite data;
3485  return data;
3486 }
3487 } // namespace doctest_detail_test_suite_ns
3488 
3489 namespace doctest {
3490 namespace {
3491  // the int (priority) is part of the key for automatic sorting - sadly one can register a
3492  // reporter with a duplicate name and a different priority but hopefully that won't happen often :|
3493  typedef std::map<std::pair<int, String>, reporterCreatorFunc> reporterMap;
3494  reporterMap& getReporters() {
3495  static reporterMap data;
3496  return data;
3497  }
3498 } // namespace
3499 namespace detail {
3500 #define DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(function, ...) \
3501  for(auto& curr_rep : g_cs->reporters_currently_used) \
3502  curr_rep->function(__VA_ARGS__)
3503 
3504  DOCTEST_DEFINE_DEFAULTS(TestFailureException);
3505  DOCTEST_DEFINE_COPIES(TestFailureException);
3506  bool checkIfShouldThrow(assertType::Enum at) {
3507  if(at & assertType::is_require)
3508  return true;
3509 
3510  if((at & assertType::is_check)
3511  && getContextOptions()->abort_after > 0 &&
3512  (g_cs->numAssertsFailed + g_cs->numAssertsFailedCurrentTest_atomic) >=
3513  getContextOptions()->abort_after)
3514  return true;
3515 
3516  return false;
3517  }
3518 
3519 #ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
3520  [[noreturn]] void throwException() { throw TestFailureException(); }
3521 #else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
3522  void throwException() {}
3523 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
3524 } // namespace detail
3525 
3526 namespace {
3527  using namespace detail;
3528  // matching of a string against a wildcard mask (case sensitivity configurable) taken from
3529  // https://www.codeproject.com/Articles/1088/Wildcard-string-compare-globbing
3530  int wildcmp(const char* str, const char* wild, bool caseSensitive) {
3531  const char* cp = nullptr;
3532  const char* mp = nullptr;
3533 
3534  while((*str) && (*wild != '*')) {
3535  if((caseSensitive ? (*wild != *str) : (tolower(*wild) != tolower(*str))) &&
3536  (*wild != '?')) {
3537  return 0;
3538  }
3539  wild++;
3540  str++;
3541  }
3542 
3543  while(*str) {
3544  if(*wild == '*') {
3545  if(!*++wild) {
3546  return 1;
3547  }
3548  mp = wild;
3549  cp = str + 1;
3550  } else if((caseSensitive ? (*wild == *str) : (tolower(*wild) == tolower(*str))) ||
3551  (*wild == '?')) {
3552  wild++;
3553  str++;
3554  } else {
3555  wild = mp;
3556  str = cp++;
3557  }
3558  }
3559 
3560  while(*wild == '*') {
3561  wild++;
3562  }
3563  return !*wild;
3564  }
3565 
3567  //unsigned hashStr(unsigned const char* str) {
3568  // unsigned long hash = 5381;
3569  // char c;
3570  // while((c = *str++))
3571  // hash = ((hash << 5) + hash) + c; // hash * 33 + c
3572  // return hash;
3573  //}
3574 
3575  // checks if the name matches any of the filters (and can be configured what to do when empty)
3576  bool matchesAny(const char* name, const std::vector<String>& filters, bool matchEmpty,
3577  bool caseSensitive) {
3578  if(filters.empty() && matchEmpty)
3579  return true;
3580  for(auto& curr : filters)
3581  if(wildcmp(name, curr.c_str(), caseSensitive))
3582  return true;
3583  return false;
3584  }
3585 } // namespace
3586 namespace detail {
3587 
3588  Subcase::Subcase(const char* name, const char* file, int line)
3589  : m_signature(name, file, line) {
3590  ContextState* s = g_cs;
3591 
3592  // if we have already completed it
3593  if(s->subcasesPassed.count(m_signature) != 0)
3594  return;
3595 
3596  // check subcase filters
3597  if(s->subcasesCurrentLevel < s->subcase_filter_levels) {
3598  if(!matchesAny(m_signature.m_name, s->filters[6], true, s->case_sensitive))
3599  return;
3600  if(matchesAny(m_signature.m_name, s->filters[7], false, s->case_sensitive))
3601  return;
3602  }
3603 
3604  // if a Subcase on the same level has already been entered
3605  if(s->subcasesEnteredLevels.count(s->subcasesCurrentLevel) != 0) {
3606  s->should_reenter = true;
3607  return;
3608  }
3609 
3610  s->subcasesEnteredLevels.insert(s->subcasesCurrentLevel++);
3611  m_entered = true;
3612 
3613  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(subcase_start, m_signature);
3614  }
3615 
3616  Subcase::~Subcase() {
3617  if(m_entered) {
3618  ContextState* s = g_cs;
3619 
3620  s->subcasesCurrentLevel--;
3621  // only mark the subcase as passed if no subcases have been skipped
3622  if(s->should_reenter == false)
3623  s->subcasesPassed.insert(m_signature);
3624 
3625  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(subcase_end, DOCTEST_EMPTY);
3626  }
3627  }
3628 
3629  Subcase::operator bool() const { return m_entered; }
3630 
3631  Result::Result(bool passed, const String& decomposition)
3632  : m_passed(passed)
3633  , m_decomp(decomposition) {}
3634 
3635  DOCTEST_DEFINE_DEFAULTS(Result);
3636  DOCTEST_DEFINE_COPIES(Result);
3637 
3638  ExpressionDecomposer::ExpressionDecomposer(assertType::Enum at)
3639  : m_at(at) {}
3640 
3641  DOCTEST_DEFINE_DEFAULTS(ExpressionDecomposer);
3642 
3643  DOCTEST_DEFINE_DEFAULTS(TestSuite);
3644  DOCTEST_DEFINE_COPIES(TestSuite);
3645 
3646  TestSuite& TestSuite::operator*(const char* in) {
3647  m_test_suite = in;
3648  // clear state
3649  m_description = nullptr;
3650  m_skip = false;
3651  m_may_fail = false;
3652  m_should_fail = false;
3653  m_expected_failures = 0;
3654  m_timeout = 0;
3655  return *this;
3656  }
3657 
3658  TestCase::TestCase(funcType test, const char* file, unsigned line, const TestSuite& test_suite,
3659  const char* type, int template_id) {
3660  m_file = file;
3661  m_line = line;
3662  m_name = nullptr;
3663  m_test_suite = test_suite.m_test_suite;
3664  m_description = test_suite.m_description;
3665  m_skip = test_suite.m_skip;
3666  m_may_fail = test_suite.m_may_fail;
3667  m_should_fail = test_suite.m_should_fail;
3668  m_expected_failures = test_suite.m_expected_failures;
3669  m_timeout = test_suite.m_timeout;
3670 
3671  m_test = test;
3672  m_type = type;
3673  m_template_id = template_id;
3674  }
3675 
3676  DOCTEST_DEFINE_DEFAULTS(TestCase);
3677 
3678  TestCase::TestCase(const TestCase& other)
3679  : TestCaseData() {
3680  *this = other;
3681  }
3682 
3683  DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(26434) // hides a non-virtual function
3684  DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING(26437) // Do not slice
3685  TestCase& TestCase::operator=(const TestCase& other) {
3686  static_cast<TestCaseData&>(*this) = static_cast<const TestCaseData&>(other);
3687 
3688  m_test = other.m_test;
3689  m_type = other.m_type;
3690  m_template_id = other.m_template_id;
3691  m_full_name = other.m_full_name;
3692 
3693  if(m_template_id != -1)
3694  m_name = m_full_name.c_str();
3695  return *this;
3696  }
3697  DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
3698 
3699  TestCase& TestCase::operator*(const char* in) {
3700  m_name = in;
3701  // make a new name with an appended type for templated test case
3702  if(m_template_id != -1) {
3703  m_full_name = String(m_name) + m_type;
3704  // redirect the name to point to the newly constructed full name
3705  m_name = m_full_name.c_str();
3706  }
3707  return *this;
3708  }
3709 
3710  bool TestCase::operator<(const TestCase& other) const {
3711  if(m_line != other.m_line)
3712  return m_line < other.m_line;
3713  const int file_cmp = std::strcmp(m_file, other.m_file);
3714  if(file_cmp != 0)
3715  return file_cmp < 0;
3716  return m_template_id < other.m_template_id;
3717  }
3718 } // namespace detail
3719 namespace {
3720  using namespace detail;
3721  // for sorting tests by file/line
3722  bool fileOrderComparator(const TestCase* lhs, const TestCase* rhs) {
3723 #if DOCTEST_MSVC
3724  // this is needed because MSVC gives different case for drive letters
3725  // for __FILE__ when evaluated in a header and a source file
3726  const int res = stricmp(lhs->m_file, rhs->m_file);
3727 #else // MSVC
3728  const int res = std::strcmp(lhs->m_file, rhs->m_file);
3729 #endif // MSVC
3730  if(res != 0)
3731  return res < 0;
3732  if(lhs->m_line != rhs->m_line)
3733  return lhs->m_line < rhs->m_line;
3734  return lhs->m_template_id < rhs->m_template_id;
3735  }
3736 
3737  // for sorting tests by suite/file/line
3738  bool suiteOrderComparator(const TestCase* lhs, const TestCase* rhs) {
3739  const int res = std::strcmp(lhs->m_test_suite, rhs->m_test_suite);
3740  if(res != 0)
3741  return res < 0;
3742  return fileOrderComparator(lhs, rhs);
3743  }
3744 
3745  // for sorting tests by name/suite/file/line
3746  bool nameOrderComparator(const TestCase* lhs, const TestCase* rhs) {
3747  const int res = std::strcmp(lhs->m_name, rhs->m_name);
3748  if(res != 0)
3749  return res < 0;
3750  return suiteOrderComparator(lhs, rhs);
3751  }
3752 
3753  // all the registered tests
3754  std::set<TestCase>& getRegisteredTests() {
3755  static std::set<TestCase> data;
3756  return data;
3757  }
3758 
3759 #ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_WINDOWS
3760  HANDLE g_stdoutHandle;
3761  WORD g_origFgAttrs;
3762  WORD g_origBgAttrs;
3763  bool g_attrsInitted = false;
3764 
3765  int colors_init() {
3766  if(!g_attrsInitted) {
3767  g_stdoutHandle = GetStdHandle(STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE);
3768  g_attrsInitted = true;
3769  CONSOLE_SCREEN_BUFFER_INFO csbiInfo;
3770  GetConsoleScreenBufferInfo(g_stdoutHandle, &csbiInfo);
3771  g_origFgAttrs = csbiInfo.wAttributes & ~(BACKGROUND_GREEN | BACKGROUND_RED |
3772  BACKGROUND_BLUE | BACKGROUND_INTENSITY);
3773  g_origBgAttrs = csbiInfo.wAttributes & ~(FOREGROUND_GREEN | FOREGROUND_RED |
3774  FOREGROUND_BLUE | FOREGROUND_INTENSITY);
3775  }
3776  return 0;
3777  }
3778 
3779  int dumy_init_console_colors = colors_init();
3780 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_WINDOWS
3781 
3782  DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wdeprecated-declarations")
3783  void color_to_stream(std::ostream& s, Color::Enum code) {
3784  ((void)s); // for DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_NONE or DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_WINDOWS
3785  ((void)code); // for DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_NONE
3786 #ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_ANSI
3787  if(g_no_colors ||
3788  (isatty(STDOUT_FILENO) == false && getContextOptions()->force_colors == false))
3789  return;
3790 
3791  auto col = "";
3792  // clang-format off
3793  switch(code) {
3794  case Color::Red: col = "[0;31m"; break;
3795  case Color::Green: col = "[0;32m"; break;
3796  case Color::Blue: col = "[0;34m"; break;
3797  case Color::Cyan: col = "[0;36m"; break;
3798  case Color::Yellow: col = "[0;33m"; break;
3799  case Color::Grey: col = "[1;30m"; break;
3800  case Color::LightGrey: col = "[0;37m"; break;
3801  case Color::BrightRed: col = "[1;31m"; break;
3802  case Color::BrightGreen: col = "[1;32m"; break;
3803  case Color::BrightWhite: col = "[1;37m"; break;
3804  case Color::Bright: // invalid
3805  case Color::None:
3806  case Color::White:
3807  default: col = "[0m";
3808  }
3809  // clang-format on
3810  s << "\033" << col;
3811 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_ANSI
3812 
3813 #ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_WINDOWS
3814  if(g_no_colors ||
3815  (isatty(fileno(stdout)) == false && getContextOptions()->force_colors == false))
3816  return;
3817 
3818 #define DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(x) SetConsoleTextAttribute(g_stdoutHandle, x | g_origBgAttrs)
3819 
3820  // clang-format off
3821  switch (code) {
3822  case Color::White: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_GREEN | FOREGROUND_RED | FOREGROUND_BLUE); break;
3823  case Color::Red: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_RED); break;
3824  case Color::Green: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_GREEN); break;
3825  case Color::Blue: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_BLUE); break;
3826  case Color::Cyan: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_BLUE | FOREGROUND_GREEN); break;
3827  case Color::Yellow: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_RED | FOREGROUND_GREEN); break;
3828  case Color::Grey: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(0); break;
3829  case Color::LightGrey: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_INTENSITY); break;
3830  case Color::BrightRed: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_INTENSITY | FOREGROUND_RED); break;
3831  case Color::BrightGreen: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_INTENSITY | FOREGROUND_GREEN); break;
3832  case Color::BrightWhite: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(FOREGROUND_INTENSITY | FOREGROUND_GREEN | FOREGROUND_RED | FOREGROUND_BLUE); break;
3833  case Color::None:
3834  case Color::Bright: // invalid
3835  default: DOCTEST_SET_ATTR(g_origFgAttrs);
3836  }
3837  // clang-format on
3838 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_COLORS_WINDOWS
3839  }
3840  DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
3841 
3842  std::vector<const IExceptionTranslator*>& getExceptionTranslators() {
3843  static std::vector<const IExceptionTranslator*> data;
3844  return data;
3845  }
3846 
3847  String translateActiveException() {
3848 #ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
3849  String res;
3850  auto& translators = getExceptionTranslators();
3851  for(auto& curr : translators)
3852  if(curr->translate(res))
3853  return res;
3854  // clang-format off
3855  DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wcatch-value")
3856  try {
3857  throw;
3858  } catch(std::exception& ex) {
3859  return ex.what();
3860  } catch(std::string& msg) {
3861  return msg.c_str();
3862  } catch(const char* msg) {
3863  return msg;
3864  } catch(...) {
3865  return "unknown exception";
3866  }
3867  DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
3868 // clang-format on
3869 #else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
3870  return "";
3871 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
3872  }
3873 } // namespace
3874 
3875 namespace detail {
3876  // used by the macros for registering tests
3877  int regTest(const TestCase& tc) {
3878  getRegisteredTests().insert(tc);
3879  return 0;
3880  }
3881 
3882  // sets the current test suite
3883  int setTestSuite(const TestSuite& ts) {
3884  doctest_detail_test_suite_ns::getCurrentTestSuite() = ts;
3885  return 0;
3886  }
3887 
3888 #ifdef DOCTEST_PLATFORM_MAC
3889  // The following function is taken directly from the following technical note:
3890  // http://developer.apple.com/library/mac/#qa/qa2004/qa1361.html
3891  // Returns true if the current process is being debugged (either
3892  // running under the debugger or has a debugger attached post facto).
3893  bool isDebuggerActive() {
3894  int mib[4];
3895  kinfo_proc info;
3896  size_t size;
3897  // Initialize the flags so that, if sysctl fails for some bizarre
3898  // reason, we get a predictable result.
3899  info.kp_proc.p_flag = 0;
3900  // Initialize mib, which tells sysctl the info we want, in this case
3901  // we're looking for information about a specific process ID.
3902  mib[0] = CTL_KERN;
3903  mib[1] = KERN_PROC;
3904  mib[2] = KERN_PROC_PID;
3905  mib[3] = getpid();
3906  // Call sysctl.
3907  size = sizeof(info);
3908  if(sysctl(mib, DOCTEST_COUNTOF(mib), &info, &size, 0, 0) != 0) {
3909  std::cerr << "\nCall to sysctl failed - unable to determine if debugger is active **\n";
3910  return false;
3911  }
3912  // We're being debugged if the P_TRACED flag is set.
3913  return ((info.kp_proc.p_flag & P_TRACED) != 0);
3914  }
3915 #elif DOCTEST_MSVC || defined(__MINGW32__)
3916  bool isDebuggerActive() { return ::IsDebuggerPresent() != 0; }
3917 #else
3918  bool isDebuggerActive() { return false; }
3919 #endif // Platform
3920 
3921  void registerExceptionTranslatorImpl(const IExceptionTranslator* et) {
3922  if(std::find(getExceptionTranslators().begin(), getExceptionTranslators().end(), et) ==
3923  getExceptionTranslators().end())
3924  getExceptionTranslators().push_back(et);
3925  }
3926 
3927 #ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING
3928  void toStream(std::ostream* s, char* in) { *s << in; }
3929  void toStream(std::ostream* s, const char* in) { *s << in; }
3930 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_TREAT_CHAR_STAR_AS_STRING
3931  void toStream(std::ostream* s, bool in) { *s << std::boolalpha << in << std::noboolalpha; }
3932  void toStream(std::ostream* s, float in) { *s << in; }
3933  void toStream(std::ostream* s, double in) { *s << in; }
3934  void toStream(std::ostream* s, double long in) { *s << in; }
3935 
3936  void toStream(std::ostream* s, char in) { *s << in; }
3937  void toStream(std::ostream* s, char signed in) { *s << in; }
3938  void toStream(std::ostream* s, char unsigned in) { *s << in; }
3939  void toStream(std::ostream* s, int short in) { *s << in; }
3940  void toStream(std::ostream* s, int short unsigned in) { *s << in; }
3941  void toStream(std::ostream* s, int in) { *s << in; }
3942  void toStream(std::ostream* s, int unsigned in) { *s << in; }
3943  void toStream(std::ostream* s, int long in) { *s << in; }
3944  void toStream(std::ostream* s, int long unsigned in) { *s << in; }
3945  void toStream(std::ostream* s, int long long in) { *s << in; }
3946  void toStream(std::ostream* s, int long long unsigned in) { *s << in; }
3947 
3948  DOCTEST_THREAD_LOCAL std::vector<IContextScope*> g_infoContexts; // for logging with INFO()
3949 
3950  ContextBuilder::ICapture::ICapture() = default;
3951  ContextBuilder::ICapture::~ICapture() = default;
3952 
3953  ContextBuilder::Chunk::Chunk() = default;
3954  ContextBuilder::Chunk::~Chunk() = default;
3955 
3956  ContextBuilder::Node::Node() = default;
3957  ContextBuilder::Node::~Node() = default;
3958 
3959  // steal the contents of the other - acting as a move constructor...
3960  ContextBuilder::ContextBuilder(ContextBuilder& other)
3961  : numCaptures(other.numCaptures)
3962  , head(other.head)
3963  , tail(other.tail) {
3964  other.numCaptures = 0;
3965  other.head = nullptr;
3966  other.tail = nullptr;
3967  memcpy(stackChunks, other.stackChunks,
3968  unsigned(int(sizeof(Chunk)) * DOCTEST_CONFIG_NUM_CAPTURES_ON_STACK));
3969  }
3970 
3971  DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wcast-align")
3972  void ContextBuilder::stringify(std::ostream* s) const {
3973  int curr = 0;
3974  // iterate over small buffer
3975  while(curr < numCaptures && curr < DOCTEST_CONFIG_NUM_CAPTURES_ON_STACK)
3976  reinterpret_cast<const ICapture*>(stackChunks[curr++].buf)->toStream(s);
3977  // iterate over list
3978  auto curr_elem = head;
3979  while(curr < numCaptures) {
3980  reinterpret_cast<const ICapture*>(curr_elem->chunk.buf)->toStream(s);
3981  curr_elem = curr_elem->next;
3982  ++curr;
3983  }
3984  }
3985  DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
3986 
3987  ContextBuilder::ContextBuilder() = default;
3988 
3989  ContextBuilder::~ContextBuilder() {
3990  // free the linked list - the ones on the stack are left as-is
3991  // no destructors are called at all - there is no need
3992  while(head) {
3993  auto next = head->next;
3994  delete head;
3995  head = next;
3996  }
3997  }
3998 
3999  ContextScope::ContextScope(ContextBuilder& temp)
4000  : contextBuilder(temp) {
4001  g_infoContexts.push_back(this);
4002  }
4003 
4004  DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(4996) // std::uncaught_exception is deprecated in C++17
4005  DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wdeprecated-declarations")
4006  DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wdeprecated-declarations")
4007  ContextScope::~ContextScope() {
4008  if(std::uncaught_exception()) {
4009  std::ostringstream s;
4010  this->stringify(&s);
4011  g_cs->stringifiedContexts.push_back(s.str().c_str());
4012  }
4013  g_infoContexts.pop_back();
4014  }
4015  DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
4016  DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
4017  DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
4018 
4019  void ContextScope::stringify(std::ostream* s) const { contextBuilder.stringify(s); }
4020 } // namespace detail
4021 namespace {
4022  using namespace detail;
4023 
4024  std::ostream& file_line_to_stream(std::ostream& s, const char* file, int line,
4025  const char* tail = "") {
4026  const auto opt = getContextOptions();
4027  s << Color::LightGrey << skipPathFromFilename(file) << (opt->gnu_file_line ? ":" : "(")
4028  << (opt->no_line_numbers ? 0 : line) // 0 or the real num depending on the option
4029  << (opt->gnu_file_line ? ":" : "):") << tail;
4030  return s;
4031  }
4032 
4033 #if !defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS) && !defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH)
4034  struct FatalConditionHandler
4035  {
4036  void reset() {}
4037  };
4038 #else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS || DOCTEST_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH
4039 
4040  void reportFatal(const std::string&);
4041 
4042 #ifdef DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
4043 
4044  struct SignalDefs
4045  {
4046  DWORD id;
4047  const char* name;
4048  };
4049  // There is no 1-1 mapping between signals and windows exceptions.
4050  // Windows can easily distinguish between SO and SigSegV,
4051  // but SigInt, SigTerm, etc are handled differently.
4052  SignalDefs signalDefs[] = {
4053  {EXCEPTION_ILLEGAL_INSTRUCTION, "SIGILL - Illegal instruction signal"},
4054  {EXCEPTION_STACK_OVERFLOW, "SIGSEGV - Stack overflow"},
4055  {EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION, "SIGSEGV - Segmentation violation signal"},
4056  {EXCEPTION_INT_DIVIDE_BY_ZERO, "Divide by zero error"},
4057  };
4058 
4059  struct FatalConditionHandler
4060  {
4061  static LONG CALLBACK handleVectoredException(PEXCEPTION_POINTERS ExceptionInfo) {
4062  for(size_t i = 0; i < DOCTEST_COUNTOF(signalDefs); ++i) {
4063  if(ExceptionInfo->ExceptionRecord->ExceptionCode == signalDefs[i].id) {
4064  reportFatal(signalDefs[i].name);
4065  }
4066  }
4067  // If its not an exception we care about, pass it along.
4068  // This stops us from eating debugger breaks etc.
4069  return EXCEPTION_CONTINUE_SEARCH;
4070  }
4071 
4072  FatalConditionHandler() {
4073  isSet = true;
4074  // 32k seems enough for doctest to handle stack overflow,
4075  // but the value was found experimentally, so there is no strong guarantee
4076  guaranteeSize = 32 * 1024;
4077  exceptionHandlerHandle = nullptr;
4078  // Register as first handler in current chain
4079  exceptionHandlerHandle = AddVectoredExceptionHandler(1, handleVectoredException);
4080  // Pass in guarantee size to be filled
4081  SetThreadStackGuarantee(&guaranteeSize);
4082  }
4083 
4084  static void reset() {
4085  if(isSet) {
4086  // Unregister handler and restore the old guarantee
4087  RemoveVectoredExceptionHandler(exceptionHandlerHandle);
4088  SetThreadStackGuarantee(&guaranteeSize);
4089  exceptionHandlerHandle = nullptr;
4090  isSet = false;
4091  }
4092  }
4093 
4094  ~FatalConditionHandler() { reset(); }
4095 
4096  private:
4097  static bool isSet;
4098  static ULONG guaranteeSize;
4099  static PVOID exceptionHandlerHandle;
4100  };
4101 
4102  bool FatalConditionHandler::isSet = false;
4103  ULONG FatalConditionHandler::guaranteeSize = 0;
4104  PVOID FatalConditionHandler::exceptionHandlerHandle = nullptr;
4105 
4106 #else // DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
4107 
4108  struct SignalDefs
4109  {
4110  int id;
4111  const char* name;
4112  };
4113  SignalDefs signalDefs[] = {{SIGINT, "SIGINT - Terminal interrupt signal"},
4114  {SIGILL, "SIGILL - Illegal instruction signal"},
4115  {SIGFPE, "SIGFPE - Floating point error signal"},
4116  {SIGSEGV, "SIGSEGV - Segmentation violation signal"},
4117  {SIGTERM, "SIGTERM - Termination request signal"},
4118  {SIGABRT, "SIGABRT - Abort (abnormal termination) signal"}};
4119 
4120  struct FatalConditionHandler
4121  {
4122  static bool isSet;
4123  static struct sigaction oldSigActions[DOCTEST_COUNTOF(signalDefs)];
4124  static stack_t oldSigStack;
4125  static char altStackMem[4 * SIGSTKSZ];
4126 
4127  static void handleSignal(int sig) {
4128  const char* name = "<unknown signal>";
4129  for(std::size_t i = 0; i < DOCTEST_COUNTOF(signalDefs); ++i) {
4130  SignalDefs& def = signalDefs[i];
4131  if(sig == def.id) {
4132  name = def.name;
4133  break;
4134  }
4135  }
4136  reset();
4137  reportFatal(name);
4138  raise(sig);
4139  }
4140 
4141  FatalConditionHandler() {
4142  isSet = true;
4143  stack_t sigStack;
4144  sigStack.ss_sp = altStackMem;
4145  sigStack.ss_size = sizeof(altStackMem);
4146  sigStack.ss_flags = 0;
4147  sigaltstack(&sigStack, &oldSigStack);
4148  struct sigaction sa = {};
4149  sa.sa_handler = handleSignal; // NOLINT
4150  sa.sa_flags = SA_ONSTACK;
4151  for(std::size_t i = 0; i < DOCTEST_COUNTOF(signalDefs); ++i) {
4152  sigaction(signalDefs[i].id, &sa, &oldSigActions[i]);
4153  }
4154  }
4155 
4156  ~FatalConditionHandler() { reset(); }
4157  static void reset() {
4158  if(isSet) {
4159  // Set signals back to previous values -- hopefully nobody overwrote them in the meantime
4160  for(std::size_t i = 0; i < DOCTEST_COUNTOF(signalDefs); ++i) {
4161  sigaction(signalDefs[i].id, &oldSigActions[i], nullptr);
4162  }
4163  // Return the old stack
4164  sigaltstack(&oldSigStack, nullptr);
4165  isSet = false;
4166  }
4167  }
4168  };
4169 
4170  bool FatalConditionHandler::isSet = false;
4171  struct sigaction FatalConditionHandler::oldSigActions[DOCTEST_COUNTOF(signalDefs)] = {};
4172  stack_t FatalConditionHandler::oldSigStack = {};
4173  char FatalConditionHandler::altStackMem[] = {};
4174 
4175 #endif // DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
4176 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS || DOCTEST_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH
4177 
4178 } // namespace
4179 
4180 namespace {
4181  using namespace detail;
4182 
4183 #ifdef DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
4184 #define DOCTEST_OUTPUT_DEBUG_STRING(text) ::OutputDebugStringA(text)
4185 #else
4186  // TODO: integration with XCode and other IDEs
4187 #define DOCTEST_OUTPUT_DEBUG_STRING(text)
4188 #endif // Platform
4189 
4190  void addAssert(assertType::Enum at) {
4191  if((at & assertType::is_warn) == 0)
4192  g_cs->numAssertsCurrentTest_atomic++;
4193  }
4194 
4195  void addFailedAssert(assertType::Enum at) {
4196  if((at & assertType::is_warn) == 0)
4197  g_cs->numAssertsFailedCurrentTest_atomic++;
4198  }
4199 
4200 #if defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS) || defined(DOCTEST_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH)
4201  void reportFatal(const std::string& message) {
4202  g_cs->failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::Crash;
4203 
4204  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_case_exception, {message.c_str(), true});
4205 
4206  while(g_cs->subcasesCurrentLevel--)
4207  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(subcase_end, DOCTEST_EMPTY);
4208 
4209  g_cs->finalizeTestCaseData();
4210 
4211  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_case_end, *g_cs);
4212 
4213  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_run_end, *g_cs);
4214  }
4215 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS || DOCTEST_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH
4216 } // namespace
4217 namespace detail {
4218 
4219  ResultBuilder::ResultBuilder(assertType::Enum at, const char* file, int line, const char* expr,
4220  const char* exception_type) {
4221  m_test_case = g_cs->currentTest;
4222  m_at = at;
4223  m_file = file;
4224  m_line = line;
4225  m_expr = expr;
4226  m_failed = true;
4227  m_threw = false;
4228  m_threw_as = false;
4229  m_exception_type = exception_type;
4230 #if DOCTEST_MSVC
4231  if(m_expr[0] == ' ') // this happens when variadic macros are disabled under MSVC
4232  ++m_expr;
4233 #endif // MSVC
4234  }
4235 
4236  DOCTEST_DEFINE_DEFAULTS(ResultBuilder);
4237 
4238  void ResultBuilder::setResult(const Result& res) {
4239  m_decomp = res.m_decomp;
4240  m_failed = !res.m_passed;
4241  }
4242 
4243  void ResultBuilder::translateException() {
4244  m_threw = true;
4245  m_exception = translateActiveException();
4246  }
4247 
4248  bool ResultBuilder::log() {
4249  if(m_at & assertType::is_throws) {
4250  m_failed = !m_threw;
4251  } else if(m_at & assertType::is_throws_as) {
4252  m_failed = !m_threw_as;
4253  } else if(m_at & assertType::is_throws_with) {
4254  m_failed = m_exception != m_exception_type;
4255  } else if(m_at & assertType::is_nothrow) {
4256  m_failed = m_threw;
4257  }
4258 
4259  if(m_exception.size())
4260  m_exception = String("\"") + m_exception + "\"";
4261 
4262  if(is_running_in_test) {
4263  addAssert(m_at);
4264  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(log_assert, *this);
4265 
4266  if(m_failed)
4267  addFailedAssert(m_at);
4268  } else if(m_failed) {
4269  failed_out_of_a_testing_context(*this);
4270  }
4271 
4272  return m_failed && isDebuggerActive() &&
4273  !getContextOptions()->no_breaks; // break into debugger
4274  }
4275 
4276  void ResultBuilder::react() const {
4277  if(m_failed && checkIfShouldThrow(m_at))
4278  throwException();
4279  }
4280 
4281  void failed_out_of_a_testing_context(const AssertData& ad) {
4282  if(g_cs->ah)
4283  g_cs->ah(ad);
4284  else
4285  std::abort();
4286  }
4287 
4288  void decomp_assert(assertType::Enum at, const char* file, int line, const char* expr,
4289  Result result) {
4290  bool failed = !result.m_passed;
4291 
4292  // ###################################################################################
4293  // IF THE DEBUGGER BREAKS HERE - GO 1 LEVEL UP IN THE CALLSTACK FOR THE FAILING ASSERT
4294  // THIS IS THE EFFECT OF HAVING 'DOCTEST_CONFIG_SUPER_FAST_ASSERTS' DEFINED
4295  // ###################################################################################
4296  DOCTEST_ASSERT_OUT_OF_TESTS(result.m_decomp);
4297  DOCTEST_ASSERT_IN_TESTS(result.m_decomp);
4298  }
4299 
4300  MessageBuilder::MessageBuilder(const char* file, int line, assertType::Enum severity) {
4301  m_stream = getTlsOss();
4302  m_file = file;
4303  m_line = line;
4304  m_severity = severity;
4305  }
4306 
4307  IExceptionTranslator::IExceptionTranslator() = default;
4308  IExceptionTranslator::~IExceptionTranslator() = default;
4309 
4310  bool MessageBuilder::log() {
4311  m_string = getTlsOssResult();
4312  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(log_message, *this);
4313 
4314  const bool isWarn = m_severity & assertType::is_warn;
4315 
4316  // warn is just a message in this context so we dont treat it as an assert
4317  if(!isWarn) {
4318  addAssert(m_severity);
4319  addFailedAssert(m_severity);
4320  }
4321 
4322  return isDebuggerActive() && !getContextOptions()->no_breaks && !isWarn; // break
4323  }
4324 
4325  void MessageBuilder::react() {
4326  if(m_severity & assertType::is_require)
4327  throwException();
4328  }
4329 
4330  MessageBuilder::~MessageBuilder() = default;
4331 } // namespace detail
4332 namespace {
4333  using namespace detail;
4334 
4335  template <typename Ex>
4336  [[noreturn]] void throw_exception(Ex const& e) {
4337 #ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
4338  throw e;
4339 #else // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
4340  std::cerr << "doctest will terminate because it needed to throw an exception.\n"
4341  << "The message was: " << e.what() << '\n';
4342  std::terminate();
4343 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
4344  }
4345 
4346 #define DOCTEST_INTERNAL_ERROR(msg) \
4347  throw_exception(std::logic_error( \
4348  __FILE__ ":" DOCTEST_TOSTR(__LINE__) ": Internal doctest error: " msg))
4349 
4350  // clang-format off
4351 
4352 // =================================================================================================
4353 // The following code has been taken verbatim from Catch2/include/internal/catch_xmlwriter.h/cpp
4354 // This is done so cherry-picking bug fixes is trivial - even the style/formatting is untouched.
4355 // =================================================================================================
4356 
4357  class XmlEncode {
4358  public:
4359  enum ForWhat { ForTextNodes, ForAttributes };
4360 
4361  XmlEncode( std::string const& str, ForWhat forWhat = ForTextNodes );
4362 
4363  void encodeTo( std::ostream& os ) const;
4364 
4365  friend std::ostream& operator << ( std::ostream& os, XmlEncode const& xmlEncode );
4366 
4367  private:
4368  std::string m_str;
4369  ForWhat m_forWhat;
4370  };
4371 
4372  class XmlWriter {
4373  public:

4388  m_writer->writeAttribute( name, attribute );
4389  return *this;
4390  }

4394  };

4417  rss << attribute;
4418  return writeAttribute( name, rss.str() );
4419  }
