4443 
4444 // =================================================================================================
4445 // The following code has been taken verbatim from Catch2/include/internal/catch_xmlwriter.h/cpp
4446 // This is done so cherry-picking bug fixes is trivial - even the style/formatting is untouched.
4447 // =================================================================================================
4448 
4449 using uchar = unsigned char;
4450 
4451 namespace {
4452 
4453  size_t trailingBytes(unsigned char c) {
4454  if ((c & 0xE0) == 0xC0) {
4455  return 2;
4456  }
4457  if ((c & 0xF0) == 0xE0) {
4458  return 3;
4459  }
4460  if ((c & 0xF8) == 0xF0) {
4461  return 4;
4462  }
4463  DOCTEST_INTERNAL_ERROR("Invalid multibyte utf-8 start byte encountered");
4464  }
4465 
4466  uint32_t headerValue(unsigned char c) {
4467  if ((c & 0xE0) == 0xC0) {
4468  return c & 0x1F;
4469  }
4470  if ((c & 0xF0) == 0xE0) {
4471  return c & 0x0F;
4472  }
4473  if ((c & 0xF8) == 0xF0) {
4474  return c & 0x07;
4475  }
4476  DOCTEST_INTERNAL_ERROR("Invalid multibyte utf-8 start byte encountered");
4477  }
4478 
4479  void hexEscapeChar(std::ostream& os, unsigned char c) {
4480  std::ios_base::fmtflags f(os.flags());
4481  os << "\\x"
4482  << std::uppercase << std::hex << std::setfill('0') << std::setw(2)
4483  << static_cast<int>(c);
4484  os.flags(f);
4485  }
4486 
4487 } // anonymous namespace
4488 
4489  XmlEncode::XmlEncode( std::string const& str, ForWhat forWhat )
4490  : m_str( str ),
4491  m_forWhat( forWhat )
4492  {}
4493 
4494  void XmlEncode::encodeTo( std::ostream& os ) const {
4495  // Apostrophe escaping not necessary if we always use " to write attributes
4496  // (see: http://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#syntax)
4497 
4498  for( std::size_t idx = 0; idx < m_str.size(); ++ idx ) {
4499  uchar c = m_str[idx];
4500  switch (c) {
4501  case '<': os << "&lt;"; break;
4502  case '&': os << "&amp;"; break;
4503 
4504  case '>':
4505  // See: http://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#syntax
4506  if (idx > 2 && m_str[idx - 1] == ']' && m_str[idx - 2] == ']')
4507  os << "&gt;";
4508  else
4509  os << c;
4510  break;
4511 
4512  case '\"':
4513  if (m_forWhat == ForAttributes)
4514  os << "&quot;";
4515  else
4516  os << c;
4517  break;
4518 
4519  default:
4520  // Check for control characters and invalid utf-8
4521 
4522  // Escape control characters in standard ascii
4523  // see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/404107/why-are-control-characters-illegal-in-xml-1-0
4524  if (c < 0x09 || (c > 0x0D && c < 0x20) || c == 0x7F) {
4525  hexEscapeChar(os, c);
4526  break;
4527  }
4528 
4529  // Plain ASCII: Write it to stream
4530  if (c < 0x7F) {
4531  os << c;
4532  break;
4533  }
4534 
4535  // UTF-8 territory
4536  // Check if the encoding is valid and if it is not, hex escape bytes.
4537  // Important: We do not check the exact decoded values for validity, only the encoding format
4538  // First check that this bytes is a valid lead byte:
4539  // This means that it is not encoded as 1111 1XXX
4540  // Or as 10XX XXXX
4541  if (c < 0xC0 ||
4542  c >= 0xF8) {
4543  hexEscapeChar(os, c);
4544  break;
4545  }
4546 
4547  auto encBytes = trailingBytes(c);
4548  // Are there enough bytes left to avoid accessing out-of-bounds memory?
4549  if (idx + encBytes - 1 >= m_str.size()) {
4550  hexEscapeChar(os, c);
4551  break;
4552  }
4553  // The header is valid, check data
4554  // The next encBytes bytes must together be a valid utf-8
4555  // This means: bitpattern 10XX XXXX and the extracted value is sane (ish)
4556  bool valid = true;
4557  uint32_t value = headerValue(c);
4558  for (std::size_t n = 1; n < encBytes; ++n) {
4559  uchar nc = m_str[idx + n];
4560  valid &= ((nc & 0xC0) == 0x80);
4561  value = (value << 6) | (nc & 0x3F);
4562  }
4563 
4564  if (
4565  // Wrong bit pattern of following bytes
4566  (!valid) ||
4567  // Overlong encodings
4568  (value < 0x80) ||
4569  ( value < 0x800 && encBytes > 2) || // removed "0x80 <= value &&" because redundant
4570  (0x800 < value && value < 0x10000 && encBytes > 3) ||
4571  // Encoded value out of range
4572  (value >= 0x110000)
4573  ) {
4574  hexEscapeChar(os, c);
4575  break;
4576  }
4577 
4578  // If we got here, this is in fact a valid(ish) utf-8 sequence
4579  for (std::size_t n = 0; n < encBytes; ++n) {
4580  os << m_str[idx + n];
4581  }
4582  idx += encBytes - 1;
4583  break;
4584  }
4585  }
4586  }
4587 
4588  std::ostream& operator << ( std::ostream& os, XmlEncode const& xmlEncode ) {
4589  xmlEncode.encodeTo( os );
4590  return os;
4591  }
4592 
4593  XmlWriter::ScopedElement::ScopedElement( XmlWriter* writer )
4594  : m_writer( writer )
4595  {}
4596 
4597  XmlWriter::ScopedElement::ScopedElement( ScopedElement&& other ) noexcept
4598  : m_writer( other.m_writer ){
4599  other.m_writer = nullptr;
4600  }
4601  XmlWriter::ScopedElement& XmlWriter::ScopedElement::operator=( ScopedElement&& other ) noexcept {
4602  if ( m_writer ) {
4603  m_writer->endElement();
4604  }
4605  m_writer = other.m_writer;
4606  other.m_writer = nullptr;
4607  return *this;
4608  }
4609 
4610 
4611  XmlWriter::ScopedElement::~ScopedElement() {
4612  if( m_writer )
4613  m_writer->endElement();
4614  }
4615 
4616  XmlWriter::ScopedElement& XmlWriter::ScopedElement::writeText( std::string const& text, bool indent ) {
4617  m_writer->writeText( text, indent );
4618  return *this;
4619  }
4620 
4621  XmlWriter::XmlWriter( std::ostream& os ) : m_os( os )
4622  {
4623  writeDeclaration();
4624  }
4625 
4626  XmlWriter::~XmlWriter() {
4627  while( !m_tags.empty() )
4628  endElement();
4629  }
4630 
4631  XmlWriter& XmlWriter::startElement( std::string const& name ) {
4632  ensureTagClosed();
4633  newlineIfNecessary();
4634  m_os << m_indent << '<' << name;
4635  m_tags.push_back( name );
4636  m_indent += " ";
4637  m_tagIsOpen = true;
4638  return *this;
4639  }
4640 
4641  XmlWriter::ScopedElement XmlWriter::scopedElement( std::string const& name ) {
4642  ScopedElement scoped( this );
4643  startElement( name );
4644  return scoped;
4645  }
4646 
4647  XmlWriter& XmlWriter::endElement() {
4648  newlineIfNecessary();
4649  m_indent = m_indent.substr( 0, m_indent.size()-2 );
4650  if( m_tagIsOpen ) {
4651  m_os << "/>";
4652  m_tagIsOpen = false;
4653  }
4654  else {
4655  m_os << m_indent << "</" << m_tags.back() << ">";
4656  }
4657  m_os << std::endl;
4658  m_tags.pop_back();
4659  return *this;
4660  }
4661 
4662  XmlWriter& XmlWriter::writeAttribute( std::string const& name, std::string const& attribute ) {
4663  if( !name.empty() && !attribute.empty() )
4664  m_os << ' ' << name << "=\"" << XmlEncode( attribute, XmlEncode::ForAttributes ) << '"';
4665  return *this;
4666  }
4667 
4668  XmlWriter& XmlWriter::writeAttribute( std::string const& name, const char* attribute ) {
4669  if( !name.empty() && attribute && attribute[0] != '\0' )
4670  m_os << ' ' << name << "=\"" << XmlEncode( attribute, XmlEncode::ForAttributes ) << '"';
4671  return *this;
4672  }
4673 
4674  XmlWriter& XmlWriter::writeAttribute( std::string const& name, bool attribute ) {
4675  m_os << ' ' << name << "=\"" << ( attribute ? "true" : "false" ) << '"';
4676  return *this;
4677  }
4678 
4679  XmlWriter& XmlWriter::writeText( std::string const& text, bool indent ) {
4680  if( !text.empty() ){
4681  bool tagWasOpen = m_tagIsOpen;
4682  ensureTagClosed();
4683  if( tagWasOpen && indent )
4684  m_os << m_indent;
4685  m_os << XmlEncode( text );
4686  m_needsNewline = true;
4687  }
4688  return *this;
4689  }
4690 
4691  //XmlWriter& XmlWriter::writeComment( std::string const& text ) {
4692  // ensureTagClosed();
4693  // m_os << m_indent << "<!--" << text << "-->";
4694  // m_needsNewline = true;
4695  // return *this;
4696  //}
4697 
4698  //void XmlWriter::writeStylesheetRef( std::string const& url ) {
4699  // m_os << "<?xml-stylesheet type=\"text/xsl\" href=\"" << url << "\"?>\n";
4700  //}
4701 
4702  //XmlWriter& XmlWriter::writeBlankLine() {
4703  // ensureTagClosed();
4704  // m_os << '\n';
4705  // return *this;
4706  //}
4707 
4708  void XmlWriter::ensureTagClosed() {
4709  if( m_tagIsOpen ) {
4710  m_os << ">" << std::endl;
4711  m_tagIsOpen = false;
4712  }
4713  }
4714 
4715  void XmlWriter::writeDeclaration() {
4716  m_os << "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?>\n";
4717  }
4718 
4719  void XmlWriter::newlineIfNecessary() {
4720  if( m_needsNewline ) {
4721  m_os << std::endl;
4722  m_needsNewline = false;
4723  }
4724  }
4725 
4726 // =================================================================================================
4727 // End of copy-pasted code from Catch
4728 // =================================================================================================
4729 
4730  // clang-format on
4731 
4732  struct XmlReporter : public IReporter
4733  {
4734  XmlWriter xml;
4735  std::mutex mutex;
4736 
4737  // caching pointers/references to objects of these types - safe to do
4738  const ContextOptions& opt;
4739  const TestCaseData* tc = nullptr;
4740 
4741  XmlReporter(const ContextOptions& co)
4742  : xml(*co.cout)
4743  , opt(co) {}
4744 
4745  void log_contexts() {
4746  int num_contexts = get_num_active_contexts();
4747  if(num_contexts) {
4748  auto contexts = get_active_contexts();
4749  std::stringstream ss;
4750  for(int i = 0; i < num_contexts; ++i) {
4751  contexts[i]->stringify(&ss);
4752  xml.scopedElement("Info").writeText(ss.str());
4753  ss.str("");
4754  }
4755  }
4756  }
4757 
4758  unsigned line(unsigned l) const { return opt.no_line_numbers ? 0 : l; }
4759 
4760  void test_case_start_impl(const TestCaseData& in) {
4761  bool open_ts_tag = false;
4762  if(tc != nullptr) { // we have already opened a test suite
4763  if(strcmp(tc->m_test_suite, in.m_test_suite) != 0) {
4764  xml.endElement();
4765  open_ts_tag = true;
4766  }
4767  }
4768  else {
4769  open_ts_tag = true; // first test case ==> first test suite
4770  }
4771 
4772  if(open_ts_tag) {
4773  xml.startElement("TestSuite");
4774  xml.writeAttribute("name", in.m_test_suite);
4775  }
4776 
4777  tc = &in;
4778  xml.startElement("TestCase")
4779  .writeAttribute("name", in.m_name)
4780  .writeAttribute("filename", skipPathFromFilename(in.m_file))
4781  .writeAttribute("line", line(in.m_line))
4782  .writeAttribute("description", in.m_description);
4783 
4784  if(Approx(in.m_timeout) != 0)
4785  xml.writeAttribute("timeout", in.m_timeout);
4786  if(in.m_may_fail)
4787  xml.writeAttribute("may_fail", true);
4788  if(in.m_should_fail)
4789  xml.writeAttribute("should_fail", true);
4790  }
4791 
4792  // =========================================================================================
4793  // WHAT FOLLOWS ARE OVERRIDES OF THE VIRTUAL METHODS OF THE REPORTER INTERFACE
4794  // =========================================================================================
4795 
4796  void report_query(const QueryData& in) override {
4797  test_run_start();
4798  if(opt.list_reporters) {
4799  for(auto& curr : getReporters())
4800  xml.scopedElement("Reporter")
4801  .writeAttribute("priority", curr.first.first)
4802  .writeAttribute("name", curr.first.second);
4803  } else if(opt.count || opt.list_test_cases) {
4804  for(unsigned i = 0; i < in.num_data; ++i)
4805  xml.scopedElement("TestCase").writeAttribute("name", in.data[i]);
4806  xml.scopedElement("OverallResultsTestCases")
4807  .writeAttribute("unskipped", in.run_stats->numTestCasesPassingFilters);
4808  } else if(opt.list_test_suites) {
4809  for(unsigned i = 0; i < in.num_data; ++i)
4810  xml.scopedElement("TestSuite").writeAttribute("name", in.data[i]);
4811  xml.scopedElement("OverallResultsTestCases")
4812  .writeAttribute("unskipped", in.run_stats->numTestCasesPassingFilters);
4813  xml.scopedElement("OverallResultsTestSuites")
4814  .writeAttribute("unskipped", in.run_stats->numTestSuitesPassingFilters);
4815  }
4816  xml.endElement();
4817  }
4818 
4819  void test_run_start() override {
4820  // remove .exe extension - mainly to have the same output on UNIX and Windows
4821  std::string binary_name = skipPathFromFilename(opt.binary_name.c_str());
4822 #ifdef DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
4823  if(binary_name.rfind(".exe") != std::string::npos)
4824  binary_name = binary_name.substr(0, binary_name.length() - 4);
4825 #endif // DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
4826 
4827  xml.startElement("doctest").writeAttribute("binary", binary_name);
4828  if(opt.no_version == false)
4829  xml.writeAttribute("version", DOCTEST_VERSION_STR);
4830 
4831  // only the consequential ones (TODO: filters)
4832  xml.scopedElement("Options")
4833  .writeAttribute("order_by", opt.order_by.c_str())
4834  .writeAttribute("rand_seed", opt.rand_seed)
4835  .writeAttribute("first", opt.first)
4836  .writeAttribute("last", opt.last)
4837  .writeAttribute("abort_after", opt.abort_after)
4838  .writeAttribute("subcase_filter_levels", opt.subcase_filter_levels)
4839  .writeAttribute("case_sensitive", opt.case_sensitive)
4840  .writeAttribute("no_throw", opt.no_throw)
4841  .writeAttribute("no_skip", opt.no_skip);
4842  }
4843 
4844  void test_run_end(const TestRunStats& p) override {
4845  if(tc) // the TestSuite tag - only if there has been at least 1 test case
4846  xml.endElement();
4847 
4848  xml.scopedElement("OverallResultsAsserts")
4849  .writeAttribute("successes", p.numAsserts - p.numAssertsFailed)
4850  .writeAttribute("failures", p.numAssertsFailed);
4851 
4852  xml.startElement("OverallResultsTestCases")
4853  .writeAttribute("successes",
4854  p.numTestCasesPassingFilters - p.numTestCasesFailed)
4855  .writeAttribute("failures", p.numTestCasesFailed);
4856  if(opt.no_skipped_summary == false)
4857  xml.writeAttribute("skipped", p.numTestCases - p.numTestCasesPassingFilters);
4858  xml.endElement();
4859 
4860  xml.endElement();
4861  }
4862 
4863  void test_case_start(const TestCaseData& in) override {
4864  test_case_start_impl(in);
4865  xml.ensureTagClosed();
4866  }
4867 
4868  void test_case_end(const CurrentTestCaseStats& st) override {
4869  xml.startElement("OverallResultsAsserts")
4870  .writeAttribute("successes",
4871  st.numAssertsCurrentTest - st.numAssertsFailedCurrentTest)
4872  .writeAttribute("failures", st.numAssertsFailedCurrentTest);
4873  if(opt.duration)
4874  xml.writeAttribute("duration", st.seconds);
4875  if(tc->m_expected_failures)
4876  xml.writeAttribute("expected_failures", tc->m_expected_failures);
4877  xml.endElement();
4878 
4879  xml.endElement();
4880  }
4881 
4882  void test_case_exception(const TestCaseException& e) override {
4883  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(mutex);
4884 
4885  xml.scopedElement("Exception")
4886  .writeAttribute("crash", e.is_crash)
4887  .writeText(e.error_string.c_str());
4888  }
4889 
4890  void subcase_start(const SubcaseSignature& in) override {
4891  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(mutex);
4892 
4893  xml.startElement("SubCase")
4894  .writeAttribute("name", in.m_name)
4895  .writeAttribute("filename", skipPathFromFilename(in.m_file))
4896  .writeAttribute("line", line(in.m_line));
4897  xml.ensureTagClosed();
4898  }
4899 
4900  void subcase_end() override { xml.endElement(); }
4901 
4902  void log_assert(const AssertData& rb) override {
4903  if(!rb.m_failed && !opt.success)
4904  return;
4905 
4906  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(mutex);
4907 
4908  xml.startElement("Expression")
4909  .writeAttribute("success", !rb.m_failed)
4910  .writeAttribute("type", assertString(rb.m_at))
4911  .writeAttribute("filename", skipPathFromFilename(rb.m_file))
4912  .writeAttribute("line", line(rb.m_line));
4913 
4914  xml.scopedElement("Original").writeText(rb.m_expr);
4915 
4916  if(rb.m_threw)
4917  xml.scopedElement("Exception").writeText(rb.m_exception.c_str());
4918 
4919  if(rb.m_at & (assertType::is_throws_as | assertType::is_throws_with)) {
4920  xml.scopedElement("ExpectedException").writeText(rb.m_exception_type);
4921  } else if((rb.m_at & assertType::is_normal) && !rb.m_threw) {
4922  xml.scopedElement("Expanded").writeText(rb.m_decomp.c_str());
4923  }
4924 
4925  log_contexts();
4926 
4927  xml.endElement();
4928  }
4929 
4930  void log_message(const MessageData& mb) override {
4931  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(mutex);
4932 
4933  xml.startElement("Message")
4934  .writeAttribute("type", failureString(mb.m_severity))
4935  .writeAttribute("filename", skipPathFromFilename(mb.m_file))
4936  .writeAttribute("line", line(mb.m_line));
4937 
4938  xml.scopedElement("Text").writeText(mb.m_string.c_str());
4939 
4940  log_contexts();
4941 
4942  xml.endElement();
4943  }
4944 
4945  void test_case_skipped(const TestCaseData& in) override {
4946  if(opt.no_skipped_summary == false) {
4947  test_case_start_impl(in);
4948  xml.writeAttribute("skipped", "true");
4949  xml.endElement();
4950  }
4951  }
4952  };
4953 
4954  DOCTEST_REGISTER_REPORTER("xml", 0, XmlReporter);
4955 
4956  struct Whitespace
4957  {
4958  int nrSpaces;
4959  explicit Whitespace(int nr)
4960  : nrSpaces(nr) {}
4961  };
4962 
4963  std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& out, const Whitespace& ws) {
4964  if(ws.nrSpaces != 0)
4965  out << std::setw(ws.nrSpaces) << ' ';
4966  return out;
4967  }
4968 
4969  struct ConsoleReporter : public IReporter
4970  {
4971  std::ostream& s;
4972  bool hasLoggedCurrentTestStart;
4973  std::vector<SubcaseSignature> subcasesStack;
4974  std::mutex mutex;
4975 
4976  // caching pointers/references to objects of these types - safe to do
4977  const ContextOptions& opt;
4978  const TestCaseData* tc;
4979 
4980  ConsoleReporter(const ContextOptions& co)
4981  : s(*co.cout)
4982  , opt(co) {}
4983 
4984  ConsoleReporter(const ContextOptions& co, std::ostream& ostr)
4985  : s(ostr)
4986  , opt(co) {}
4987 
4988  // =========================================================================================
4989  // WHAT FOLLOWS ARE HELPERS USED BY THE OVERRIDES OF THE VIRTUAL METHODS OF THE INTERFACE
4990  // =========================================================================================
4991 
4992  void separator_to_stream() {
4993  s << Color::Yellow
4994  << "==============================================================================="
4995  "\n";
4996  }
4997 
4998  const char* getSuccessOrFailString(bool success, assertType::Enum at,
4999  const char* success_str) {
5000  if(success)
5001  return success_str;
5002  return failureString(at);
5003  }
5004 
5005  Color::Enum getSuccessOrFailColor(bool success, assertType::Enum at) {
5006  return success ? Color::BrightGreen :
5007  (at & assertType::is_warn) ? Color::Yellow : Color::Red;
5008  }
5009 
5010  void successOrFailColoredStringToStream(bool success, assertType::Enum at,
5011  const char* success_str = "SUCCESS") {
5012  s << getSuccessOrFailColor(success, at)
5013  << getSuccessOrFailString(success, at, success_str) << ": ";
5014  }
5015 
5016  void log_contexts() {
5017  int num_contexts = get_num_active_contexts();
5018  if(num_contexts) {
5019  auto contexts = get_active_contexts();
5020 
5021  s << Color::None << " logged: ";
5022  for(int i = 0; i < num_contexts; ++i) {
5023  s << (i == 0 ? "" : " ");
5024  contexts[i]->stringify(&s);
5025  s << "\n";
5026  }
5027  }
5028 
5029  s << "\n";
5030  }
5031 
5032  void logTestStart() {
5033  if(hasLoggedCurrentTestStart)
5034  return;
5035 
5036  separator_to_stream();
5037  file_line_to_stream(s, tc->m_file, tc->m_line, "\n");
5038  if(tc->m_description)
5039  s << Color::Yellow << "DESCRIPTION: " << Color::None << tc->m_description << "\n";
5040  if(tc->m_test_suite && tc->m_test_suite[0] != '\0')
5041  s << Color::Yellow << "TEST SUITE: " << Color::None << tc->m_test_suite << "\n";
5042  if(strncmp(tc->m_name, " Scenario:", 11) != 0)
5043  s << Color::None << "TEST CASE: ";
5044  s << Color::None << tc->m_name << "\n";
5045 
5046  for(auto& curr : subcasesStack)
5047  if(curr.m_name[0] != '\0')
5048  s << " " << curr.m_name << "\n";
5049 
5050  s << "\n";
5051 
5052  hasLoggedCurrentTestStart = true;
5053  }
5054 
5055  void printVersion() {
5056  if(opt.no_version == false)
5057  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None << "doctest version is \""
5058  << DOCTEST_VERSION_STR << "\"\n";
5059  }
5060 
5061  void printIntro() {
5062  printVersion();
5063  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None
5064  << "run with \"--" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "help\" for options\n";
5065  }
5066 
5067  void printHelp() {
5068  int sizePrefixDisplay = static_cast<int>(strlen(DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY));
5069  printVersion();
5070  // clang-format off
5071  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest]\n" << Color::None;
5072  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None;
5073  s << "boolean values: \"1/on/yes/true\" or \"0/off/no/false\"\n";
5074  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None;
5075  s << "filter values: \"str1,str2,str3\" (comma separated strings)\n";
5076  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest]\n" << Color::None;
5077  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None;
5078  s << "filters use wildcards for matching strings\n";
5079  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None;
5080  s << "something passes a filter if any of the strings in a filter matches\n";
5081 #ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_UNPREFIXED_OPTIONS
5082  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest]\n" << Color::None;
5083  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None;
5084  s << "ALL FLAGS, OPTIONS AND FILTERS ALSO AVAILABLE WITH A \"" DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "\" PREFIX!!!\n";
5085 #endif
5086  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest]\n" << Color::None;
5087  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None;
5088  s << "Query flags - the program quits after them. Available:\n\n";
5089  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "?, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "help, -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "h "
5090  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*0) << "prints this message\n";
5091  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "v, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "version "
5092  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "prints the version\n";
5093  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "c, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "count "
5094  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "prints the number of matching tests\n";
5095  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "ltc, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "list-test-cases "
5096  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "lists all matching tests by name\n";
5097  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "lts, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "list-test-suites "
5098  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "lists all matching test suites\n";
5099  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "lr, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "list-reporters "
5100  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "lists all registered reporters\n\n";
5101  // ================================================================================== << 79
5102  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None;
5103  s << "The available <int>/<string> options/filters are:\n\n";
5104  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "tc, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "test-case=<filters> "
5105  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "filters tests by their name\n";
5106  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "tce, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "test-case-exclude=<filters> "
5107  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "filters OUT tests by their name\n";
5108  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "sf, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "source-file=<filters> "
5109  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "filters tests by their file\n";
5110  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "sfe, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "source-file-exclude=<filters> "
5111  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "filters OUT tests by their file\n";
5112  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "ts, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "test-suite=<filters> "
5113  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "filters tests by their test suite\n";
5114  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "tse, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "test-suite-exclude=<filters> "
5115  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "filters OUT tests by their test suite\n";
5116  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "sc, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "subcase=<filters> "
5117  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "filters subcases by their name\n";
5118  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "sce, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "subcase-exclude=<filters> "
5119  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "filters OUT subcases by their name\n";
5120  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "r, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "reporters=<filters> "
5121  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "reporters to use (console is default)\n";
5122  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "o, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "out=<string> "
5123  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "output filename\n";
5124  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "ob, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "order-by=<string> "
5125  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "how the tests should be ordered\n";
5126  s << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*3) << " <string> - by [file/suite/name/rand]\n";
5127  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "rs, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "rand-seed=<int> "
5128  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "seed for random ordering\n";
5129  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "f, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "first=<int> "
5130  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "the first test passing the filters to\n";
5131  s << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*3) << " execute - for range-based execution\n";
5132  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "l, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "last=<int> "
5133  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "the last test passing the filters to\n";
5134  s << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*3) << " execute - for range-based execution\n";
5135  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "aa, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "abort-after=<int> "
5136  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "stop after <int> failed assertions\n";
5137  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "scfl,--" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "subcase-filter-levels=<int> "
5138  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "apply filters for the first <int> levels\n";
5139  s << Color::Cyan << "\n[doctest] " << Color::None;
5140  s << "Bool options - can be used like flags and true is assumed. Available:\n\n";
5141  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "s, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "success=<bool> "
5142  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "include successful assertions in output\n";
5143  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "cs, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "case-sensitive=<bool> "
5144  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "filters being treated as case sensitive\n";
5145  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "e, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "exit=<bool> "
5146  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "exits after the tests finish\n";
5147  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "d, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "duration=<bool> "
5148  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "prints the time duration of each test\n";
5149  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "nt, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "no-throw=<bool> "
5150  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "skips exceptions-related assert checks\n";
5151  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "ne, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "no-exitcode=<bool> "
5152  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "returns (or exits) always with success\n";
5153  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "nr, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "no-run=<bool> "
5154  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "skips all runtime doctest operations\n";
5155  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "nv, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "no-version=<bool> "
5156  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "omit the framework version in the output\n";
5157  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "nc, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "no-colors=<bool> "
5158  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "disables colors in output\n";
5159  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "fc, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "force-colors=<bool> "
5160  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "use colors even when not in a tty\n";
5161  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "nb, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "no-breaks=<bool> "
5162  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "disables breakpoints in debuggers\n";
5163  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "ns, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "no-skip=<bool> "
5164  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "don't skip test cases marked as skip\n";
5165  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "gfl, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "gnu-file-line=<bool> "
5166  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << ":n: vs (n): for line numbers in output\n";
5167  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "npf, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "no-path-filenames=<bool> "
5168  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "only filenames and no paths in output\n";
5169  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "nln, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "no-line-numbers=<bool> "
5170  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "0 instead of real line numbers in output\n";
5171  // ================================================================================== << 79
5172  // clang-format on
5173 
5174  s << Color::Cyan << "\n[doctest] " << Color::None;
5175  s << "for more information visit the project documentation\n\n";
5176  }
5177 
5178  void printRegisteredReporters() {
5179  printVersion();
5180  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None << "listing all registered reporters\n";
5181  for(auto& curr : getReporters())
5182  s << "priority: " << std::setw(5) << curr.first.first
5183  << " name: " << curr.first.second << "\n";
5184  }
5185 
5186  void list_query_results() {
5187  separator_to_stream();
5188  if(opt.count || opt.list_test_cases) {
5189  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None
5190  << "unskipped test cases passing the current filters: "
5191  << g_cs->numTestCasesPassingFilters << "\n";
5192  } else if(opt.list_test_suites) {
5193  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None
5194  << "unskipped test cases passing the current filters: "
5195  << g_cs->numTestCasesPassingFilters << "\n";
5196  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None
5197  << "test suites with unskipped test cases passing the current filters: "
5198  << g_cs->numTestSuitesPassingFilters << "\n";
5199  }
5200  }
5201 
5202  // =========================================================================================
5203  // WHAT FOLLOWS ARE OVERRIDES OF THE VIRTUAL METHODS OF THE REPORTER INTERFACE
5204  // =========================================================================================
5205 
5206  void report_query(const QueryData& in) override {
5207  if(opt.version) {
5208  printVersion();
5209  } else if(opt.help) {
5210  printHelp();
5211  } else if(opt.list_reporters) {
5212  printRegisteredReporters();
5213  } else if(opt.count || opt.list_test_cases) {
5214  if(opt.list_test_cases) {
5215  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None
5216  << "listing all test case names\n";
5217  separator_to_stream();
5218  }
5219 
5220  for(unsigned i = 0; i < in.num_data; ++i)
5221  s << Color::None << in.data[i] << "\n";
5222 
5223  separator_to_stream();
5224 
5225  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None
5226  << "unskipped test cases passing the current filters: "
5227  << g_cs->numTestCasesPassingFilters << "\n";
5228 
5229  } else if(opt.list_test_suites) {
5230  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None << "listing all test suites\n";
5231  separator_to_stream();
5232 
5233  for(unsigned i = 0; i < in.num_data; ++i)
5234  s << Color::None << in.data[i] << "\n";
5235 
5236  separator_to_stream();
5237 
5238  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None
5239  << "unskipped test cases passing the current filters: "
5240  << g_cs->numTestCasesPassingFilters << "\n";
5241  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None
5242  << "test suites with unskipped test cases passing the current filters: "
5243  << g_cs->numTestSuitesPassingFilters << "\n";
5244  }
5245  }
5246 
5247  void test_run_start() override { printIntro(); }
5248 
5249  void test_run_end(const TestRunStats& p) override {
5250  separator_to_stream();
5251 
5252  const bool anythingFailed = p.numTestCasesFailed > 0 || p.numAssertsFailed > 0;
5253  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None << "test cases: " << std::setw(6)
5254  << p.numTestCasesPassingFilters << " | "
5255  << ((p.numTestCasesPassingFilters == 0 || anythingFailed) ? Color::None :
5256  Color::Green)
5257  << std::setw(6) << p.numTestCasesPassingFilters - p.numTestCasesFailed << " passed"
5258  << Color::None << " | " << (p.numTestCasesFailed > 0 ? Color::Red : Color::None)
5259  << std::setw(6) << p.numTestCasesFailed << " failed" << Color::None << " | ";
5260  if(opt.no_skipped_summary == false) {
5261  const int numSkipped = p.numTestCases - p.numTestCasesPassingFilters;
5262  s << (numSkipped == 0 ? Color::None : Color::Yellow) << std::setw(6) << numSkipped
5263  << " skipped" << Color::None;
5264  }
5265  s << "\n";
5266  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None << "assertions: " << std::setw(6)
5267  << p.numAsserts << " | "
5268  << ((p.numAsserts == 0 || anythingFailed) ? Color::None : Color::Green)
5269  << std::setw(6) << (p.numAsserts - p.numAssertsFailed) << " passed" << Color::None
5270  << " | " << (p.numAssertsFailed > 0 ? Color::Red : Color::None) << std::setw(6)
5271  << p.numAssertsFailed << " failed" << Color::None << " |\n";
5272  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None
5273  << "Status: " << (p.numTestCasesFailed > 0 ? Color::Red : Color::Green)
5274  << ((p.numTestCasesFailed > 0) ? "FAILURE!" : "SUCCESS!") << Color::None << std::endl;
5275  }
5276 
5277  void test_case_start(const TestCaseData& in) override {
5278  hasLoggedCurrentTestStart = false;
5279  tc = &in;
5280  }
5281 
5282  void test_case_end(const CurrentTestCaseStats& st) override {
5283  // log the preamble of the test case only if there is something
5284  // else to print - something other than that an assert has failed
5285  if(opt.duration ||
5286  (st.failure_flags && st.failure_flags != TestCaseFailureReason::AssertFailure))
5287  logTestStart();
5288 
5289  if(opt.duration)
5290  s << Color::None << std::setprecision(6) << std::fixed << st.seconds
5291  << " s: " << tc->m_name << "\n";
5292 
5293  if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::Timeout)
5294  s << Color::Red << "Test case exceeded time limit of " << std::setprecision(6)
5295  << std::fixed << tc->m_timeout << "!\n";
5296 
5297  if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::ShouldHaveFailedButDidnt) {
5298  s << Color::Red << "Should have failed but didn't! Marking it as failed!\n";
5299  } else if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::ShouldHaveFailedAndDid) {
5300  s << Color::Yellow << "Failed as expected so marking it as not failed\n";
5301  } else if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::CouldHaveFailedAndDid) {
5302  s << Color::Yellow << "Allowed to fail so marking it as not failed\n";
5303  } else if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::DidntFailExactlyNumTimes) {
5304  s << Color::Red << "Didn't fail exactly " << tc->m_expected_failures
5305  << " times so marking it as failed!\n";
5306  } else if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::FailedExactlyNumTimes) {
5307  s << Color::Yellow << "Failed exactly " << tc->m_expected_failures
5308  << " times as expected so marking it as not failed!\n";
5309  }
5310  if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::TooManyFailedAsserts) {
5311  s << Color::Red << "Aborting - too many failed asserts!\n";
5312  }
5313  s << Color::None;
5314  }
5315 
5316  void test_case_exception(const TestCaseException& e) override {
5317  logTestStart();
5318 
5319  file_line_to_stream(s, tc->m_file, tc->m_line, " ");
5320  successOrFailColoredStringToStream(false, e.is_crash ? assertType::is_require :
5321  assertType::is_check);
5322  s << Color::Red << (e.is_crash ? "test case CRASHED: " : "test case THREW exception: ")
5323  << Color::Cyan << e.error_string << "\n";
5324 
5325  int num_stringified_contexts = get_num_stringified_contexts();
5326  if(num_stringified_contexts) {
5327  auto stringified_contexts = get_stringified_contexts();
5328  s << Color::None << " logged: ";
5329  for(int i = num_stringified_contexts - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
5330  s << (i == num_stringified_contexts - 1 ? "" : " ")
5331  << stringified_contexts[i] << "\n";
5332  }
5333  }
5334  s << "\n" << Color::None;
5335  }
5336 
5337  void subcase_start(const SubcaseSignature& subc) override {
5338  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(mutex);
5339  subcasesStack.push_back(subc);
5340  hasLoggedCurrentTestStart = false;
5341  }
5342 
5343  void subcase_end() override {
5344  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(mutex);
5345  subcasesStack.pop_back();
5346  hasLoggedCurrentTestStart = false;
5347  }
5348 
5349  void log_assert(const AssertData& rb) override {
5350  if(!rb.m_failed && !opt.success)
5351  return;
5352 
5353  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(mutex);
5354 
5355  logTestStart();
5356 
5357  file_line_to_stream(s, rb.m_file, rb.m_line, " ");
5358  successOrFailColoredStringToStream(!rb.m_failed, rb.m_at);
5359  if((rb.m_at & (assertType::is_throws_as | assertType::is_throws_with)) ==
5360  0)
5361  s << Color::Cyan << assertString(rb.m_at) << "( " << rb.m_expr << " ) "
5362  << Color::None;
5363 
5364  if(rb.m_at & assertType::is_throws) {
5365  s << (rb.m_threw ? "threw as expected!" : "did NOT throw at all!") << "\n";
5366  } else if(rb.m_at &
5367  assertType::is_throws_as) {
5368  s << Color::Cyan << assertString(rb.m_at) << "( " << rb.m_expr << ", "
5369  << rb.m_exception_type << " ) " << Color::None
5370  << (rb.m_threw ? (rb.m_threw_as ? "threw as expected!" :
5371  "threw a DIFFERENT exception: ") :
5372  "did NOT throw at all!")
5373  << Color::Cyan << rb.m_exception << "\n";
5374  } else if(rb.m_at &
5375  assertType::is_throws_with) {
5376  s << Color::Cyan << assertString(rb.m_at) << "( " << rb.m_expr << ", \""
5377  << rb.m_exception_type << "\" ) " << Color::None
5378  << (rb.m_threw ? (!rb.m_failed ? "threw as expected!" :
5379  "threw a DIFFERENT exception: ") :
5380  "did NOT throw at all!")
5381  << Color::Cyan << rb.m_exception << "\n";
5382  } else if(rb.m_at & assertType::is_nothrow) {
5383  s << (rb.m_threw ? "THREW exception: " : "didn't throw!") << Color::Cyan
5384  << rb.m_exception << "\n";
5385  } else {
5386  s << (rb.m_threw ? "THREW exception: " :
5387  (!rb.m_failed ? "is correct!\n" : "is NOT correct!\n"));
5388  if(rb.m_threw)
5389  s << rb.m_exception << "\n";
5390  else
5391  s << " values: " << assertString(rb.m_at) << "( " << rb.m_decomp << " )\n";
5392  }
5393 
5394  log_contexts();
5395  }
5396 
5397  void log_message(const MessageData& mb) override {
5398  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(mutex);
5399 
5400  logTestStart();
5401 
5402  file_line_to_stream(s, mb.m_file, mb.m_line, " ");
5403  s << getSuccessOrFailColor(false, mb.m_severity)
5404  << getSuccessOrFailString(mb.m_severity & assertType::is_warn, mb.m_severity,
5405  "MESSAGE") << ": ";
5406  s << Color::None << mb.m_string << "\n";
5407  log_contexts();
5408  }
5409 
5410  void test_case_skipped(const TestCaseData&) override {}
5411  };
5412 
5413  DOCTEST_REGISTER_REPORTER("console", 0, ConsoleReporter);
5414 
5415 #ifdef DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
5416  struct DebugOutputWindowReporter : public ConsoleReporter
5417  {
5418  DOCTEST_THREAD_LOCAL static std::ostringstream oss;
5419 
5420  DebugOutputWindowReporter(const ContextOptions& co)
5421  : ConsoleReporter(co, oss) {}
5422 
5423 #define DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(func, type, arg) \
5424  void func(type arg) override { \
5425  bool with_col = g_no_colors; \
5426  g_no_colors = false; \
5427  ConsoleReporter::func(arg); \
5428  DOCTEST_OUTPUT_DEBUG_STRING(oss.str().c_str()); \
5429  oss.str(""); \
5430  g_no_colors = with_col; \
5431  }
5432 
5433  DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(test_run_start, DOCTEST_EMPTY, DOCTEST_EMPTY)
5434  DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(test_run_end, const TestRunStats&, in)
5435  DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(test_case_start, const TestCaseData&, in)
5436  DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(test_case_end, const CurrentTestCaseStats&, in)
5437  DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(test_case_exception, const TestCaseException&, in)
5438  DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(subcase_start, const SubcaseSignature&, in)
5439  DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(subcase_end, DOCTEST_EMPTY, DOCTEST_EMPTY)
5440  DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(log_assert, const AssertData&, in)
5441  DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(log_message, const MessageData&, in)
5442  DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(test_case_skipped, const TestCaseData&, in)
5443  };
5444 
5445  DOCTEST_THREAD_LOCAL std::ostringstream DebugOutputWindowReporter::oss;
5446 #endif // DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
5447 
5448  // the implementation of parseFlag()
5449  bool parseFlagImpl(int argc, const char* const* argv, const char* pattern) {
5450  for(int i = argc - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
5451  auto temp = std::strstr(argv[i], pattern);
5452  if(temp && strlen(temp) == strlen(pattern)) {
5453  // eliminate strings in which the chars before the option are not '-'
5454  bool noBadCharsFound = true;
5455  while(temp != argv[i]) {
5456  if(*--temp != '-') {
5457  noBadCharsFound = false;
5458  break;
5459  }
5460  }
5461  if(noBadCharsFound && argv[i][0] == '-')
5462  return true;
5463  }
5464  }
5465  return false;
5466  }
5467 
5468  // locates a flag on the command line
5469  bool parseFlag(int argc, const char* const* argv, const char* pattern) {
5470 #ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_UNPREFIXED_OPTIONS
5471  // offset (normally 3 for "dt-") to skip prefix
5472  if(parseFlagImpl(argc, argv, pattern + strlen(DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX)))
5473  return true;
5474 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_UNPREFIXED_OPTIONS
5475  return parseFlagImpl(argc, argv, pattern);
5476  }
5477 
5478  // the implementation of parseOption()
5479  bool parseOptionImpl(int argc, const char* const* argv, const char* pattern, String& res) {
5480  for(int i = argc - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
5481  auto temp = std::strstr(argv[i], pattern);
5482  if(temp) {
5483  // eliminate matches in which the chars before the option are not '-'
5484  bool noBadCharsFound = true;
5485  auto curr = argv[i];
5486  while(curr != temp) {
5487  if(*curr++ != '-') {
5488  noBadCharsFound = false;
5489  break;
5490  }
5491  }
5492  if(noBadCharsFound && argv[i][0] == '-') {
5493  temp += strlen(pattern);
5494  const unsigned len = strlen(temp);
5495  if(len) {
5496  res = temp;
5497  return true;
5498  }
5499  }
5500  }
5501  }
5502  return false;
5503  }
5504 
5505  // parses an option and returns the string after the '=' character
5506  bool parseOption(int argc, const char* const* argv, const char* pattern, String& res,
5507  const String& defaultVal = String()) {
5508  res = defaultVal;
5509 #ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_UNPREFIXED_OPTIONS
5510  // offset (normally 3 for "dt-") to skip prefix
5511  if(parseOptionImpl(argc, argv, pattern + strlen(DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX), res))
5512  return true;
5513 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_UNPREFIXED_OPTIONS
5514  return parseOptionImpl(argc, argv, pattern, res);
5515  }
5516 
5517  // parses a comma separated list of words after a pattern in one of the arguments in argv
5518  bool parseCommaSepArgs(int argc, const char* const* argv, const char* pattern,
5519  std::vector<String>& res) {
5520  String filtersString;
5521  if(parseOption(argc, argv, pattern, filtersString)) {
5522  // tokenize with "," as a separator
5523  // cppcheck-suppress strtokCalled
5524  DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wdeprecated-declarations")
5525  auto pch = std::strtok(filtersString.c_str(), ","); // modifies the string
5526  while(pch != nullptr) {
5527  if(strlen(pch))
5528  res.push_back(pch);
5529  // uses the strtok() internal state to go to the next token
5530  // cppcheck-suppress strtokCalled
5531  pch = std::strtok(nullptr, ",");
5532  }
5533  DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
5534  return true;
5535  }
5536  return false;
5537  }
5538 
5539  enum optionType
5540  {
5541  option_bool,
5542  option_int
5543  };
5544 
5545  // parses an int/bool option from the command line
5546  bool parseIntOption(int argc, const char* const* argv, const char* pattern, optionType type,
5547  int& res) {
5548  String parsedValue;
5549  if(!parseOption(argc, argv, pattern, parsedValue))
5550  return false;
5551 
5552  if(type == 0) {
5553  // boolean
5554  const char positive[][5] = {"1", "true", "on", "yes"}; // 5 - strlen("true") + 1
5555  const char negative[][6] = {"0", "false", "off", "no"}; // 6 - strlen("false") + 1
5556 
5557  // if the value matches any of the positive/negative possibilities
5558  for(unsigned i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
5559  if(parsedValue.compare(positive[i], true) == 0) {
5560  res = 1;
5561  return true;
5562  }
5563  if(parsedValue.compare(negative[i], true) == 0) {
5564  res = 0;
5565  return true;
5566  }
5567  }
5568  } else {
5569  // integer
5570  // TODO: change this to use std::stoi or something else! currently it uses undefined behavior - assumes '0' on failed parse...
5571  int theInt = std::atoi(parsedValue.c_str()); // NOLINT
5572  if(theInt != 0) {
5573  res = theInt;
5574  return true;
5575  }
5576  }
5577  return false;
5578  }
5579 } // namespace
5580 
5581 Context::Context(int argc, const char* const* argv)
5582  : p(new detail::ContextState) {
5583  parseArgs(argc, argv, true);
5584  if(argc)
5585  p->binary_name = argv[0];
5586 }
5587 
5588 Context::~Context() {
5589  if(g_cs == p)
5590  g_cs = nullptr;
5591  delete p;
5592 }
5593 
5594 void Context::applyCommandLine(int argc, const char* const* argv) {
5595  parseArgs(argc, argv);
5596  if(argc)
5597  p->binary_name = argv[0];
5598 }
5599 
5600 // parses args
5601 void Context::parseArgs(int argc, const char* const* argv, bool withDefaults) {
5602  using namespace detail;
5603 
5604  // clang-format off
5605  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "source-file=", p->filters[0]);
5606  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "sf=", p->filters[0]);
5607  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "source-file-exclude=",p->filters[1]);
5608  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "sfe=", p->filters[1]);
5609  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "test-suite=", p->filters[2]);
5610  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "ts=", p->filters[2]);
5611  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "test-suite-exclude=", p->filters[3]);
5612  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "tse=", p->filters[3]);
5613  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "test-case=", p->filters[4]);
5614  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "tc=", p->filters[4]);
5615  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "test-case-exclude=", p->filters[5]);
5616  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "tce=", p->filters[5]);
5617  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "subcase=", p->filters[6]);
5618  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "sc=", p->filters[6]);
5619  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "subcase-exclude=", p->filters[7]);
5620  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "sce=", p->filters[7]);
5621  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "reporters=", p->filters[8]);
5622  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "r=", p->filters[8]);
5623  // clang-format on
5624 
5625  int intRes = 0;
5626  String strRes;
5627 
5628 #define DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG(name, sname, var, default) \
5629  if(parseIntOption(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX name "=", option_bool, intRes) || \
5630  parseIntOption(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX sname "=", option_bool, intRes)) \
5631  p->var = !!intRes; \
5632  else if(parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX name) || \
5633  parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX sname)) \
5634  p->var = true; \
5635  else if(withDefaults) \
5636  p->var = default
5637 
5638 #define DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION(name, sname, var, default) \
5639  if(parseIntOption(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX name "=", option_int, intRes) || \
5640  parseIntOption(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX sname "=", option_int, intRes)) \
5641  p->var = intRes; \
5642  else if(withDefaults) \
5643  p->var = default
5644 
5645 #define DOCTEST_PARSE_STR_OPTION(name, sname, var, default) \
5646  if(parseOption(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX name "=", strRes, default) || \
5647  parseOption(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX sname "=", strRes, default) || \
5648  withDefaults) \
5649  p->var = strRes
5650 
5651  // clang-format off
5652  DOCTEST_PARSE_STR_OPTION("out", "o", out, "");
5653  DOCTEST_PARSE_STR_OPTION("order-by", "ob", order_by, "file");
5654  DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION("rand-seed", "rs", rand_seed, 0);
5655 
5656  DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION("first", "f", first, 0);
5657  DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION("last", "l", last, UINT_MAX);
5658 
5659  DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION("abort-after", "aa", abort_after, 0);
5660  DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION("subcase-filter-levels", "scfl", subcase_filter_levels, INT_MAX);
5661 
5662  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("success", "s", success, false);
5663  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("case-sensitive", "cs", case_sensitive, false);
5664  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("exit", "e", exit, false);
5665  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("duration", "d", duration, false);
5666  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-throw", "nt", no_throw, false);
5667  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-exitcode", "ne", no_exitcode, false);
5668  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-run", "nr", no_run, false);
5669  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-version", "nv", no_version, false);
5670  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-colors", "nc", no_colors, false);
5671  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("force-colors", "fc", force_colors, false);
5672  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-breaks", "nb", no_breaks, false);
5673  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-skip", "ns", no_skip, false);
5674  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("gnu-file-line", "gfl", gnu_file_line, !bool(DOCTEST_MSVC));
5675  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-path-filenames", "npf", no_path_in_filenames, false);
5676  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-line-numbers", "nln", no_line_numbers, false);
5677  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-skipped-summary", "nss", no_skipped_summary, false);
5678  // clang-format on
5679 
5680  if(withDefaults) {
5681  p->help = false;
5682  p->version = false;
5683  p->count = false;
5684  p->list_test_cases = false;
5685  p->list_test_suites = false;
5686  p->list_reporters = false;
5687  }
5688  if(parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "help") ||
5689  parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "h") ||
5690  parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "?")) {
5691  p->help = true;
5692  p->exit = true;
5693  }
5694  if(parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "version") ||
5695  parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "v")) {
5696  p->version = true;
5697  p->exit = true;
5698  }
5699  if(parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "count") ||
5700  parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "c")) {
5701  p->count = true;
5702  p->exit = true;
5703  }
5704  if(parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "list-test-cases") ||
5705  parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "ltc")) {
5706  p->list_test_cases = true;
5707  p->exit = true;
5708  }
5709  if(parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "list-test-suites") ||
5710  parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "lts")) {
5711  p->list_test_suites = true;
5712  p->exit = true;
5713  }
5714  if(parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "list-reporters") ||
5715  parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "lr")) {
5716  p->list_reporters = true;
5717  p->exit = true;
5718  }
5719 }
5720 
5721 // allows the user to add procedurally to the filters from the command line
5722 void Context::addFilter(const char* filter, const char* value) { setOption(filter, value); }
5723 
5724 // allows the user to clear all filters from the command line
5725 void Context::clearFilters() {
5726  for(auto& curr : p->filters)
5727  curr.clear();
5728 }
5729 
5730 // allows the user to override procedurally the int/bool options from the command line
5731 void Context::setOption(const char* option, int value) {
5732  setOption(option, toString(value).c_str());
5733 }
5734 
5735 // allows the user to override procedurally the string options from the command line
5736 void Context::setOption(const char* option, const char* value) {
5737  auto argv = String("-") + option + "=" + value;
5738  auto lvalue = argv.c_str();
5739  parseArgs(1, &lvalue);
5740 }
5741 
5742 // users should query this in their main() and exit the program if true
5743 bool Context::shouldExit() { return p->exit; }
5744 
5745 void Context::setAsDefaultForAssertsOutOfTestCases() { g_cs = p; }
5746 
5747 void Context::setAssertHandler(detail::assert_handler ah) { p->ah = ah; }
5748 
5749 // the main function that does all the filtering and test running
5750 int Context::run() {
5751  using namespace detail;
5752 
5753  // save the old context state in case such was setup - for using asserts out of a testing context
5754  auto old_cs = g_cs;
5755  // this is the current contest
5756  g_cs = p;
5757  is_running_in_test = true;
5758 
5759  g_no_colors = p->no_colors;
5760  p->resetRunData();
5761 
5762  // stdout by default
5763  p->cout = &std::cout;
5764  p->cerr = &std::cerr;
5765 
5766  // or to a file if specified
5767  std::fstream fstr;
5768  if(p->out.size()) {
5769  fstr.open(p->out.c_str(), std::fstream::out);
5770  p->cout = &fstr;
5771  }
5772 
5773  auto cleanup_and_return = [&]() {
5774  if(fstr.is_open())
5775  fstr.close();
5776 
5777  // restore context
5778  g_cs = old_cs;
5779  is_running_in_test = false;
5780 
5781  // we have to free the reporters which were allocated when the run started
5782  for(auto& curr : p->reporters_currently_used)
5783  delete curr;
5784  p->reporters_currently_used.clear();
5785 
5786  if(p->numTestCasesFailed && !p->no_exitcode)
5787  return EXIT_FAILURE;
5788  return EXIT_SUCCESS;
5789  };
5790 
5791  DOCTEST_REGISTER_REPORTER("console", 0, ConsoleReporter);
5792 
5793  // setup default reporter if none is given through the command line
5794  if(p->filters[8].empty())
5795  p->filters[8].push_back("console");
5796 
5797  // check to see if any of the registered reporters has been selected
5798  for(auto& curr : getReporters()) {
5799  if(matchesAny(curr.first.second.c_str(), p->filters[8], false, p->case_sensitive))
5800  p->reporters_currently_used.push_back(curr.second(*g_cs));
5801  }
5802 
5803 #ifdef DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
5804  if(isDebuggerActive())
5805  p->reporters_currently_used.push_back(new DebugOutputWindowReporter(*g_cs));
5806 #endif // DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
5807 
5808  // handle version, help and no_run
5809  if(p->no_run || p->version || p->help || p->list_reporters) {
5810  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(report_query, QueryData());
5811 
5812  return cleanup_and_return();
5813  }
5814 
5815  std::vector<const TestCase*> testArray;
5816  for(auto& curr : getRegisteredTests())
5817  testArray.push_back(&curr);
5818  p->numTestCases = testArray.size();
5819 
5820  // sort the collected records
5821  if(!testArray.empty()) {
5822  if(p->order_by.compare("file", true) == 0) {
5823  std::sort(testArray.begin(), testArray.end(), fileOrderComparator);
5824  } else if(p->order_by.compare("suite", true) == 0) {
5825  std::sort(testArray.begin(), testArray.end(), suiteOrderComparator);
5826  } else if(p->order_by.compare("name", true) == 0) {
5827  std::sort(testArray.begin(), testArray.end(), nameOrderComparator);
5828  } else if(p->order_by.compare("rand", true) == 0) {
5829  std::srand(p->rand_seed);
5830 
5831  // random_shuffle implementation
5832  const auto first = &testArray[0];
5833  for(size_t i = testArray.size() - 1; i > 0; --i) {
5834  int idxToSwap = std::rand() % (i + 1); // NOLINT
5835 
5836  const auto temp = first[i];
5837 
5838  first[i] = first[idxToSwap];
5839  first[idxToSwap] = temp;
5840  }
5841  }
5842  }
5843 
5844  std::set<String> testSuitesPassingFilt;
5845 
5846  bool query_mode = p->count || p->list_test_cases || p->list_test_suites;
5847  std::vector<String> queryResults;
5848 
5849  if(!query_mode)
5850  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_run_start, DOCTEST_EMPTY);
5851 
5852  // invoke the registered functions if they match the filter criteria (or just count them)
5853  for(auto& curr : testArray) {
5854  const auto& tc = *curr;
5855 
5856  bool skip_me = false;
5857  if(tc.m_skip && !p->no_skip)
5858  skip_me = true;
5859 
5860  if(!matchesAny(tc.m_file, p->filters[0], true, p->case_sensitive))
5861  skip_me = true;
5862  if(matchesAny(tc.m_file, p->filters[1], false, p->case_sensitive))
5863  skip_me = true;
5864  if(!matchesAny(tc.m_test_suite, p->filters[2], true, p->case_sensitive))
5865  skip_me = true;
5866  if(matchesAny(tc.m_test_suite, p->filters[3], false, p->case_sensitive))
5867  skip_me = true;
5868  if(!matchesAny(tc.m_name, p->filters[4], true, p->case_sensitive))
5869  skip_me = true;
5870  if(matchesAny(tc.m_name, p->filters[5], false, p->case_sensitive))
5871  skip_me = true;
5872 
5873  if(!skip_me)
5874  p->numTestCasesPassingFilters++;
5875 
5876  // skip the test if it is not in the execution range
5877  if((p->last < p->numTestCasesPassingFilters && p->first <= p->last) ||
5878  (p->first > p->numTestCasesPassingFilters))
5879  skip_me = true;
5880 
5881  if(skip_me) {
5882  if(!query_mode)
5883  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_case_skipped, tc);
5884  continue;
5885  }
5886 
5887  // do not execute the test if we are to only count the number of filter passing tests
5888  if(p->count)
5889  continue;
5890 
5891  // print the name of the test and don't execute it
5892  if(p->list_test_cases) {
5893  queryResults.push_back(tc.m_name);
5894  continue;
5895  }
5896 
5897  // print the name of the test suite if not done already and don't execute it
5898  if(p->list_test_suites) {
5899  if((testSuitesPassingFilt.count(tc.m_test_suite) == 0) && tc.m_test_suite[0] != '\0') {
5900  queryResults.push_back(tc.m_test_suite);
5901  testSuitesPassingFilt.insert(tc.m_test_suite);
5902  p->numTestSuitesPassingFilters++;
5903  }
5904  continue;
5905  }
5906 
5907  // execute the test if it passes all the filtering
5908  {
5909  p->currentTest = &tc;
5910 
5911  p->failure_flags = TestCaseFailureReason::None;
5912  p->seconds = 0;
5913 
5914  // reset atomic counters
5915  p->numAssertsFailedCurrentTest_atomic = 0;
5916  p->numAssertsCurrentTest_atomic = 0;
5917 
5918  p->subcasesPassed.clear();
5919 
5920  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_case_start, tc);
5921 
5922  p->timer.start();
5923 
5924  do {
5925  // reset some of the fields for subcases (except for the set of fully passed ones)
5926  p->should_reenter = false;
5927  p->subcasesCurrentLevel = 0;
5928  p->subcasesEnteredLevels.clear();
5929 
5930  // reset stuff for logging with INFO()
5931  p->stringifiedContexts.clear();
5932 
5933 #ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
5934  try {
5935 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
5936  FatalConditionHandler fatalConditionHandler; // Handle signals
5937  // execute the test
5938  tc.m_test();
5939  fatalConditionHandler.reset();
5940 #ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
5941  } catch(const TestFailureException&) {
5942  p->failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::AssertFailure;
5943  } catch(...) {
5944  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_case_exception,
5945  {translateActiveException(), false});
5946  p->failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::Exception;
5947  }
5948 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
5949 
5950  // exit this loop if enough assertions have failed - even if there are more subcases
5951  if(p->abort_after > 0 &&
5952  p->numAssertsFailed + p->numAssertsFailedCurrentTest_atomic >= p->abort_after) {
5953  p->should_reenter = false;
5954  p->failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::TooManyFailedAsserts;
5955  }
5956  } while(p->should_reenter == true);
5957 
5958  p->finalizeTestCaseData();
5959 
5960  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_case_end, *g_cs);
5961 
5962  p->currentTest = nullptr;
5963 
5964  // stop executing tests if enough assertions have failed
5965  if(p->abort_after > 0 && p->numAssertsFailed >= p->abort_after)
5966  break;
5967  }
5968  }
5969 
5970  if(!query_mode) {
5971  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_run_end, *g_cs);
5972  } else {
5973  QueryData qdata;
5974  qdata.run_stats = g_cs;
5975  qdata.data = queryResults.data();
5976  qdata.num_data = unsigned(queryResults.size());
5977  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(report_query, qdata);
5978  }
5979 
5980  return cleanup_and_return();
5981 }
5982 
5983 DOCTEST_DEFINE_DEFAULTS(CurrentTestCaseStats);
5984 
5985 DOCTEST_DEFINE_DEFAULTS(TestRunStats);
5986 
5987 IReporter::~IReporter() = default;
5988 
5989 int IReporter::get_num_active_contexts() { return detail::g_infoContexts.size(); }
5990 const IContextScope* const* IReporter::get_active_contexts() {
5991  return get_num_active_contexts() ? &detail::g_infoContexts[0] : nullptr;
5992 }
5993 
5994 int IReporter::get_num_stringified_contexts() { return detail::g_cs->stringifiedContexts.size(); }
5995 const String* IReporter::get_stringified_contexts() {
5996  return get_num_stringified_contexts() ? &detail::g_cs->stringifiedContexts[0] : nullptr;
5997 }
5998 
5999 namespace detail {
6000  void registerReporterImpl(const char* name, int priority, reporterCreatorFunc c) {
6001  getReporters().insert(reporterMap::value_type(reporterMap::key_type(priority, name), c));
6002  }
6003 } // namespace detail
6004 
6005 // see these issues on the reasoning for this:
6006 // - https://github.com/onqtam/doctest/issues/143#issuecomment-414418903
6007 // - https://github.com/onqtam/doctest/issues/126
6008 void DOCTEST_FIX_FOR_MACOS_LIBCPP_IOSFWD_STRING_LINK_ERRORS() { std::cout << std::string(); }
6009 
6010 } // namespace doctest
6011 
6012 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_DISABLE
6013 
6014 #ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_IMPLEMENT_WITH_MAIN
6015 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(4007) // 'function' : must be 'attribute' - see issue #182
6016 int main(int argc, char** argv) { return doctest::Context(argc, argv).run(); }
6017 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
6018 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_IMPLEMENT_WITH_MAIN
6019 
6020 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
6021 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
6022 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
6023 
6024 #endif // DOCTEST_LIBRARY_IMPLEMENTATION
6025 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_IMPLEMENT
doctest::detail::has_insertion_operator_impl::any_t
Definition: doctest.h:773

doctest::detail::stringifyBinaryExpr

Definition: doctest.h:1483
